indignation.eng_def: anger about a situation that you think is wrong or not fair
indignation.chi_def: （由錯誤或不公正的事激起的）憤怒，憤慨

indispensable.eng_def: Something or someone that is indispensable is so good or important that you could not manage without it, him, or her.
indispensable.eg: This book is an indispensable resource for researchers.

individual.eng_def: a single person or thing, especially when compared to the group or set to which they belong
individual.eg: Every individual has rights which must never be taken away.

individual.eng_def: a person who thinks or behaves in their own original way
individual.chi_def: （思想或行為）與眾不同的人，有個性的人
individual.eg: If nothing else, the school will turn her into an individual.

individual.eng_def: existing and considered separately from the other things or people in a group
individual.eg: Each individual table is finished by hand.

individual.eng_def: given to or relating to a single, separate person or thing
individual.eg: We deal with each case on an individual basis.

individual.eng_def: belonging or relating to, or suitable for, people or things that are different or particular in some way

indoor.eng_def: happening, used, or existing inside a building

induce.eng_def: to persuade someone to do something
induce.eg: They induced her to take the job by promising editorial freedom.
Pills for seasickness often induce drowsiness.

induce.eng_def: to use a drug to make a pregnant woman start giving birth
induce.eg: In this hospital, twins are often induced.

indulge.eng_def: to allow yourself or another person to have something enjoyable, especially more than is good for you
indulge.eg: The soccer fans indulged their patriotism, waving flags and singing songs.

indulge.eng_def: to give someone anything they want and not to mind if they behave badly
indulge.eg: My aunt indulges the children dreadfully.

industrial.eng_def: in or related to industry, or having a lot of industry and factories, etc.
a company whose main business is producing goods
industrial.eg: He owns a series of industrials across the US and beyond.
On Thursday the industrials moved up more than 50 points.

industrialize.eg: It was the first country to industrialize.

industry.eng_def: the companies and activities involved in the process of producing goods for sale, especially in a factory or special area
the people and activities involved in one type of business
something that is produced or is available in large quantities and makes a lot of money
the quality of regularly working hard
industry.eg: I must say that I'm very impressed by her industry.

inevitable.eng_def: certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented
inevitable.chi_def: 不可避免的；必然發生的
inevitable.eg: The accident was the inevitable consequence/result/outcome of carelessness.

inevitable.eng_def: something that is certain to happen and cannot be prevented
inevitable.chi_def: 不可避免的情況；逃避不了的事實
inevitable.eg: Eventually the inevitable happened and he had a heart attack.

infant.eng_def: a baby or a very young child
a student at an infant school
infant.eg: Jenny is a top-year infant now.

infant.eng_def: related to or connected with the first stage of school in the UK, for children aged four to seven years

infect.eng_def: to pass a disease to a person, animal, or plant
infect.eg: The ward was full of children infected with TB.

infect.eng_def: If a place, wound, or substance is infected, it contains bacteria or other things that can cause disease.
infect.eg: The meat had been infected by E coli bacteria.

infect.eng_def: to make someone have the same feeling or emotion as you
infect.eg: Her optimism seemed to infect all those around her.

infect.eng_def: to pass harmful programs from one computer to another, or within files in the same computer
infect.eg: A computer virus may lurk unseen in a computer's memory, calling up and infecting each of the machine's data files in turn.

infection.eng_def: a disease in a part of your body that is caused by bacteria or a virus
infection.chi_def: （由細菌或病毒造成的身體部位的）感染

infection.eng_def: an act of passing harmful programs into a computer or file, or the harmful programs themselves
infection.eg: You only have to open an attachment to pass the infection from computer to computer.

infectious.eng_def: (of a disease) able to be passed from one person, animal, or plant to another
able to pass a disease from one person, animal, or plant to another
infectious.chi_def: （人或動植物）傳染的，具傳染性的

infectious.eng_def: Something that is infectious has an effect on everyone who is present and makes them want to join in.
infectious.chi_def: 有感染力的；有影響力的

infer.eng_def: to form an opinion or guess that something is true because of the information that you have
infer.eg: What do you infer from her refusal?

inference.eng_def: a guess that you make or an opinion that you form based on the information that you have
inference.eg: They were warned to expect a heavy air attack and by inference many casualties.

inferior.eng_def: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
inferior.eg: These products are inferior to those we bought last year.

inferior.eng_def: of the lower surface of a body part
used to refer to a body part that is below another body part
someone who is considered to be less important than other people
inferior.eg: He regarded most men as his social, moral, and intellectual inferiors.

infinite.eng_def: without limits; extremely large or great

inflation.eng_def: a general, continuous increase in prices

influence.eng_def: the power to have an effect on people or things, or a person or thing that is able to do this
influence.chi_def: 影響，作用；有影響的人（或物）
influence.eg: Helen's a bad/good influence on him.

influence.eng_def: to affect or change how someone or something develops, behaves, or thinks
influence.eg: She's very good at making friends and influencing people.

influential.eng_def: having a lot of influence on someone or something
influential.eg: She wanted to work for a bigger and more influential (= powerful) newspaper.

inform.eng_def: to tell someone about particular facts
inform.eg: The name of the dead man will not be released until his relatives have been informed.

information.eng_def: facts about a situation, person, event, etc.
information.eg: Do you have any information about/on train times?

informative.eng_def: providing a lot of useful information
informative.chi_def: 提供資訊的；增長見聞的
informative.eg: This is an interesting and highly informative book.

ingenious.eng_def: (of a person) very intelligent and skilful, or (of a thing) skilfully made or planned and involving new ideas and methods
ingenious.chi_def: （人）靈巧的；（物品等）製作精巧的；（方法等）巧妙的

ingenuity.eng_def: someone's ability to think of clever new ways of doing something
ingenuity.chi_def: 心靈手巧；足智多謀；獨創力
ingenuity.eg: I was impressed by the ingenuity and energy of the contestants.

ingredient.eng_def: a food that is used with other foods in the preparation of a particular dish
ingredient.eg: The list of ingredients included 250 g of almonds.

ingredient.eng_def: one of the parts of something successful
ingredient.eg: Trust is a vital ingredient in a successful marriage.

inhabit.eg: These remote islands are inhabited only by birds.

inhabitant.eng_def: a person or animal that lives in a particular place
inhabitant.eg: a city of five million inhabitants

inherent.eng_def: existing as a natural or basic part of something
inherent.chi_def: 內在的；固有的，生來就有的
inherent.eg: There are dangers/risks inherent in almost every sport.

inherit.eng_def: to receive money, a house, etc. from someone after they have died
inherit.eg: Who will inherit the house when he dies?

inherit.eng_def: to be born with the same physical or mental characteristics as one of your parents or grandparents
inherit.eg: Rosie inherited her red hair from her mother.

inherit.eng_def: to begin to have responsibility for a problem or situation that previously existed or belonged to another person
inherit.chi_def: 接手，承擔（遺留的問題等）
inherit.eg: When I took on the job of manager, I inherited certain financial problems.

initial.eg: My initial surprise was soon replaced by delight.

initial.eng_def: the first letter of a name, especially when used to represent a name
initial.eg: He wrote his initials, P.M.R., at the bottom of the page.

initial.eng_def: to write your initials on something
initial.chi_def: 在…上簽署姓名的首字母
initial.eg: If you make any changes to the document, please initial them.

initiate.eng_def: to teach someone about an area of knowledge, or to allow someone into a group by a special ceremony
initiate.chi_def: 向（某人）傳授專門知識；（透過某種儀式）接納（新會員）
initiate.eg: At the age of eleven, Harry was initiated into the art of golf by his father.

initiate.eng_def: a person who has recently joined a group and has been taught its secrets

initiative.eng_def: a new plan or process to achieve something or solve a problem
initiative.eg: The peace initiative was welcomed by both sides.

initiative.eng_def: the ability to use your judgment to make decisions and do things without needing to be told what to do
initiative.chi_def: 主動性；自主決斷行事的能力
initiative.eg: Although she was quite young, she showed a lot of initiative and was promoted to manager after a year.

initiative.eng_def: If you do something on your own initiative, you plan it and decide to do it yourself without anyone telling you what to do.
the power or opportunity to win an advantage

inject.eng_def: to use a needle and syringe (= small tube) to put a liquid such as a drug into a person's body
inject.eg: Phil's a diabetic and has to inject himself with insulin every day.

inject.eng_def: to introduce something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process
inject.eg: A large amount of money will have to be injected into the company if it is to survive.

injection.eng_def: the act of putting a liquid, especially a drug, into a person's body using a needle and a syringe (= small tube)
injection.eg: Daily insulin injections are necessary for some diabetics.

injection.eng_def: the introduction of something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process
injection.eg: A cash injection of £20 million will be used to improve the health service.

injure.eng_def: to hurt or cause physical harm to a person or animal
injure.eg: A bomb exploded at the embassy, injuring several people.

injury.eng_def: physical harm or damage to someone's body caused by an accident or an attack

injustice.eng_def: (an example of) a situation in which there is no fairness and justice
injustice.eg: The sight of people suffering arouses a deep sense of injustice in her.

ink.eng_def: coloured liquid used for writing, printing, and drawing
tattoos (= patterns that are made on the skin using needles and ink)
ink.eg: I have only been tattooing for nine months but people seem to like my ink.
The printing plates have to be inked before they will print on the paper.

ink.eng_def: to tattoo someone (= decorate their skin with patterns using needles and ink)
ink.eg: Here are some important points to note before you get inked.

inland.eng_def: in the middle of a country, away from the sea
inland.eg: The Black Sea is a large inland sea.

inland.eng_def: towards the middle of a country, away from the sea
inland.chi_def: 向（或在）內陸，向（或在）內地
inland.eg: Seabirds often come inland to find food.

inn.eng_def: a pub where you can stay for the night, usually in the countryside
inn.chi_def: （通常位於鄉間可過夜的）酒館

inn.eng_def: a small hotel, usually in the countryside
inn.chi_def: （通常位於鄉間的）小旅店，客棧

inn.eng_def: used in the names of some hotels and restaurants
inn.chi_def: 飯店（用於某些旅館和飯店名稱）

inner.eng_def: inside or contained within something else
inner.eg: Leading off the main hall is a series of small inner rooms.

inner.eng_def: Inner feelings or thoughts are ones that you do not show or tell other people.
inner.eg: Sarah seemed to have a profound sense of inner peace.

innocence.eng_def: the fact that someone is not guilty of a crime
innocence.eg: She pleaded her innocence, but no one believed her.

innocence.eng_def: the quality of not having much experience of life and not knowing about the bad things that happen in life
innocence.eg: She has a child-like innocence which I find very appealing.

innocent.eng_def: (of a person) not guilty of a particular crime
innocent.eg: He firmly believes that she is innocent of the crime.

innocent.eng_def: having no knowledge of the unpleasant and evil things in life
innocent.eg: She has such an innocent face that I find it hard to believe anything bad of her.

innocent.eng_def: An innocent person is someone who is not involved with any military group or war.
innocent.eg: Several innocent bystanders were injured in the explosion.

innocent.eng_def: (of a thing) not intended to harm anyone
innocent.eg: It was an innocent remark, I didn't mean to hurt his feelings.

innocent.eng_def: a person who has very little experience and does not know about the bad things that happen in life

innovation.eng_def: (the use of) a new idea or method
innovation.chi_def: 新觀念；新方法；（新觀念或方法的）創造，使用
innovation.eg: the latest innovations in computer technology

innumerable.eg: The project has been delayed by innumerable problems.

input.eng_def: something such as energy, money, or information that is put into a system, organization, or machine so that it can operate
input.chi_def: （能源、資金或資訊的）投入，輸入
input.eg: I didn't have much input into the project (= the help I gave was small).

input.eng_def: the part that carries information to a machine, or the place where this is connected
input.eg: The inputs for the CD-ROM are at the back of the computer.

input.eng_def: to put information into a computer or other piece of electronic equipment
input.chi_def: （將資訊）輸入；錄入（電腦或其他電子設備）
input.eg: I've spent the morning inputting data into the computer.

inquire.eg: Shall I inquire about the price of tickets?

inquiry.eg: I've been making inquiries about/into the cost of a round-the-world ticket.

inquiry.eng_def: an official process to discover the facts about something bad that has happened

insect.eng_def: a type of very small animal with six legs, a body divided into three parts and usually two pairs of wings, or, more generally, any similar very small animal
insect.eg: Ants, beetles, butterflies, and flies are all insects.

insert.eng_def: to put something inside something else
insert.eg: Insert the key in/into the lock.

insert.eng_def: to add writing to a text, form, etc.
insert.eg: I've filled in the form, but you still need to insert (= add) your bank details and date of birth.

insert.eng_def: something that is made to go inside or into something else
insert.eg: These magazines have too many annoying inserts (= extra loose pages) advertising various products.

inside.eng_def: the part, space, or side of something that is inside
inside.eg: Did you clean the inside of the car?

inside.eng_def: The inside of a part of the body such as the arm or leg is the part facing in towards the rest of the body.
inside.eg: She dabbed perfume on the inside of her wrist.

inside.eng_def: a person's or animal's internal organs, especially the stomach or bowels
inside.eg: The dead seal's insides were spread all over the snow.

inside.eng_def: in or into a room, building, container, or something similar
inside.chi_def: 在（…）裡面，在（…）內部；裡面的，內部的
inside.eg: "Is Anna in the garden?" "No, she's inside (= in the house)."

inside.eng_def: If something is inside out, it has the usual inside part on the outside and the usual outside part on the inside.
inside.eg: She had her sweater on inside out.

inside.eng_def: If you do something or if something happens inside (of) a particular time or limit, you do it or it happens in less than that amount of time or under the limit.
inside.chi_def: 在（某段時間）內；少於（某時間）
inside.eg: The new faster trains can do the journey inside two hours.

inside.eng_def: (of information) obtained by someone in a group, organization, or company and therefore involving special or secret knowledge

inside.eg: Her husband's inside for armed robbery.

insight.eng_def: (the ability to have) a clear, deep, and sometimes sudden understanding of a complicated problem or situation
insight.eg: It was an interesting book, full of fascinating insights into human relationships.

insist.eng_def: to say firmly or demand forcefully, especially when others disagree with or oppose what you say
insist.eg: Greg still insists (that) he did nothing wrong.

insistence.eng_def: an occasion when you demand something and refuse to accept opposition, or when you say firmly that something is true
insistence.chi_def: 堅決要求；堅持主張；堅持
insistence.eg: Insistence on better working conditions by the union has resulted in fewer employee absences.

inspect.eng_def: to look at something or someone carefully in order to discover information, especially about their quality or condition
inspect.eg: After the crash both drivers got out and inspected their cars for damage.

inspect.eng_def: to officially visit a place or a group of people in order to check that everything is correct and legal
inspect.eg: An official from the Department of Health will be inspecting the restaurant this afternoon.

inspect.eng_def: If a building is inspected, it is examined carefully by a specially trained person, in order to discover if there is anything wrong with its structure.

inspection.eng_def: the act of looking at something carefully, or an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is correct and legal
inspection.eg: Her passport seemed legitimate, but on closer inspection, it was found to have been altered.

inspection.eng_def: an examination of the structure of a building by a specially trained person

inspector.eng_def: someone whose job is to officially inspect something
a police officer of middle rank, above a sergeant and below a superintendent

inspiration.eng_def: someone or something that gives you ideas for doing something
inspiration.eg: The golden autumn light provided the inspiration for the painting.

inspiration.chi_def: 靈感；突然想出的好主意
inspiration.eg: He had an inspiration - why not apply for some government money?

inspiration.eng_def: someone that people admire and want to be like
inspiration.eg: She has been an inspiration to us all.

inspire.eng_def: to make someone feel that they want to do something and can do it
inspire.eg: His confident leadership inspired his followers.

inspire.eng_def: to make someone have a particular strong feeling or reaction
inspire.eg: She inspires great loyalty among her followers.

inspire.eng_def: to give someone an idea for a book, film, product, etc.
inspire.eg: a piece of music inspired by dolphin sounds

install.eng_def: to put furniture, a machine, or a piece of equipment into position and make it ready to use
install.eg: The plumber is coming tomorrow to install the new washing machine.

install.eng_def: to put a computer program onto a computer so that the computer can use it
install.eg: Andrew, can you help me install this software?

install.eng_def: to put someone in an important job or position
install.eg: She has installed a couple of young academics as her advisers.

install.eng_def: to put someone/yourself in a comfortable position where you want to stay
install.chi_def: 將（某人）／自己安頓在某處
install.eg: He seems to have installed himself in your spare room for good!

installation.eng_def: an occasion when equipment, furniture, or a computer program is put into position or made ready to use
installation.eg: Do you have to pay extra for installation?

installation.eng_def: a place where there are buildings and equipment that have a particular, especially military, purpose
an occasion when someone is put in an important job or position
installation.eg: The installation of the new archbishop will take place in January.

installation.eng_def: a form of modern sculpture where the artist uses sound, movement, or space as well as objects in order to make an often temporary work of art
installation.chi_def: 裝置藝術（除物體外還運用聲音、動作或空間來創作臨時藝術品的現代雕塑形式）

installment.eng_def: a method of paying for something in which the buyer pays part of the cost immediately and then makes small regular payments until the debt is completely paid

instance.eng_def: a particular situation, event, or fact, especially an example of something that happens generally
instance.eg: There have been several instances of violence at the school.

instance.eng_def: to give something as an example
instance.eg: She argued the need for legal reform and instanced several recent cases with grossly unfair verdicts.

instant.eg: This type of account offers you instant access to your money.

instant.eng_def: Instant food or drink is dried, usually in the form of a powder, and can be prepared very quickly by adding hot water.
instant.chi_def: （食品或飲品）速食的，方便的，即溶的

instant.eng_def: an extremely short period of time
instant.eg: In an instant her mood had changed.

instead.eng_def: in place of someone or something else
instead.eg: There's no coffee - would you like a cup of tea instead?

instinct.eng_def: the way people or animals naturally react or behave, without having to think or learn about it
instinct.eg: All his instincts told him to stay near the car and wait for help.

institute.eng_def: an organization where people do a particular type of scientific, educational, or social work, or the buildings that it uses
to start or cause a system, rule, legal action, etc. to exist
institute.eg: She is threatening to institute legal proceedings against the hospital.

institution.eng_def: a large and important organization, such as a university or bank
a building where people are sent to be cared for, especially a hospital or prison
institution.chi_def: 社會收容機構（尤指醫院或監獄）

institution.eng_def: a custom or tradition that has existed for a long time and is accepted as an important part of a particular society
an occasion when a law, system, etc. begins or is introduced
institution.eg: The institution of the Freedom of Information Act has had a significant effect.

instruct.eng_def: to order or tell someone to do something, especially in a formal way
instruct.eg: The police have been instructed to patrol the building and surrounding area.

instruct.eng_def: to employ a lawyer to represent you in court
When a judge instructs a jury, he or she tells it what the law means and how to use it.
instruct.chi_def: （法官就法律適用要點）向（陪審團）作說明

instruct.eng_def: to teach someone how to do something
instruct.eg: He works in a sports centre instructing people in the use of the gym equipment.

instruction.eng_def: something that someone tells you to do
instruction.eg: The police who broke into the house were only acting on/under instructions.

instruction.eng_def: advice and information about how to do or use something, often written in a book or on the side of a container
instruction.eg: The cooking instructions say to bake it for half an hour.

instruction.eng_def: the teaching of a particular skill or subject
instruction.chi_def: 教授；指導（某種技能／科目）
instruction.eg: The video provides instruction on how to operate the computer.

instructor.eng_def: a person whose job is to teach people a practical skill
a teacher of a college or university subject, who usually teaches a limited number of classes

instrument.eng_def: an object, such as a piano, guitar, or drum, that is played to produce musical sounds
a tool or other device, especially one without electrical power, used for performing a particular piece of work
a device used for measuring speed, height, etc. in vehicles, especially aircraft
a way of achieving or causing something
instrument.eg: He saw the theatre as an instrument of change - a way of forcing people to consider social and political issues.

instrument.eng_def: a type of investment in a company or in government debt that can be traded on the financial markets
instrument.chi_def: 可以在金融市場上進行交易的投資（或政府債券）
instrument.eg: They trade in the debt instruments of developing countries.

insult.eg: She made several insults about my appearance.

insult.eng_def: to say or do something to someone that is rude or offensive
insult.eg: First he drank all my wine and then he insulted all my friends.

insurance.eng_def: an agreement in which you pay a company money and they pay your costs if you have an accident, injury, etc.

insure.eng_def: to protect yourself against risk by regularly paying a special company that will provide a fixed amount of money if you are killed or injured or if your home or possessions are damaged, destroyed, or stolen
insure.eg: The house is insured for two million dollars.

insure.eng_def: to provide insurance for someone or something
insure.chi_def: 為（某人或某物）提供保險；承保
insure.eg: They refused to insure us because they said we're too old.

intact.eng_def: complete and in the original state
intact.chi_def: 完整無缺的；未經觸動的
intact.eg: The church was destroyed in the bombing but the altar survived intact.
It's difficult to emerge from such a scandal with your reputation still intact.

integrate.eng_def: to mix with and join society or a group of people, often changing to suit their way of life, habits, and customs
integrate.chi_def: （使）融入（某社會或群體）；（使）成為一體
integrate.eg: He seems to find it difficult to integrate socially.

integrate.eng_def: to combine two or more things in order to become more effective
integrate.eg: You need to integrate exercise into your normal life.

integration.eng_def: a process in business where a company buys another company that supplies it with goods or that buys goods from it in order to control all the processes of production
integration.chi_def: （公司為全面控制整個生產過程而進行的）垂直一體化，縱向結合

integrity.eng_def: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles that you refuse to change
integrity.eg: No one doubted that the president was a man of the highest integrity.

integrity.eng_def: someone's high artistic standards or standards of doing their job, and that person's determination not to lower those standards
integrity.eg: Keen to preserve his artistic integrity, he refused several lucrative Hollywood offers.

integrity.eng_def: the quality of being whole and complete
integrity.eg: A modern extension on the old building would ruin its architectural integrity.

intellect.eng_def: the ability to understand and to think in an intelligent way
intellect.eg: Her energy and intellect are respected all over the world.

intellect.eng_def: a very educated person whose interests are studying and other activities that involve careful thinking

intellectual.eng_def: relating to your ability to think and understand things, especially complicated ideas
intellectual.eg: Looking after a baby at home all day is nice but it doesn't provide much intellectual stimulation.

intellectual.eng_def: a very educated person whose interests are studying and other activities that involve careful thinking and mental effort
intellectual.eg: She was too much of an intellectual to find popular movies interesting.

intelligence.eng_def: the ability to learn, understand, and make judgments or have opinions that are based on reason
secret information about the governments of other countries, especially enemy governments, or a group of people who collect and deal with this information

intelligent.eng_def: showing intelligence, or able to learn and understand things easily
intelligent.chi_def: 有才智的；聰穎的，理解力強的

intend.eng_def: to have as a plan or purpose
intend.eg: We intend to go to Australia next year.

intense.eng_def: extreme and forceful or (of a feeling) very strong
Intense people are very serious, and usually have strong emotions or opinions.
intense.chi_def: 認真的；熱切的；有強烈情感的；尖銳的

intensify.eng_def: to become greater, more serious, or more extreme, or to make something do this
intensify.eg: Fighting around the capital has intensified in the last few hours.

intensity.eng_def: the quality of being felt strongly or having a very strong effect
intensity.eg: The explosion was of such intensity that it was heard five miles away.

intensity.eng_def: the strength of something that can be measured such as light, sound, etc.
the quality of being very serious and having strong emotions or opinions
intensity.chi_def: （感情或看法的）強烈；認真；全情投入
intensity.eg: The intensity of their relationship was causing problems.

intensive.eng_def: involving a lot of effort or activity in a short period of time
intensive.chi_def: 密集的，集中的；加強的；深入的

intent.eng_def: giving all your attention to something
to be determined to do or achieve something
intent.eg: I've tried persuading her not to go but she's intent on it.

intent.eng_def: the fact that you want and plan to do something
intent.eg: I spent half the morning on the phone, which wasn't really my intent.

intention.eng_def: something that you want and plan to do
intention.eg: It wasn't my intention to exclude her from the list - I just forgot her.

interact.eng_def: to communicate with or react to
interact.chi_def: 交流，交往；相互作用，互相影響
interact.eg: Dominique's teacher says that she interacts well with the other children.

interaction.eng_def: an occasion when two or more people or things communicate with or react to each other
interaction.chi_def: 交流，交往；相互作用，相互影響
interaction.eg: There's not enough interaction between the management and the workers.

interest.eng_def: the feeling of wanting to give your attention to something or of wanting to be involved with and to discover more about something
interest.eg: I've always had an interest in astronomy.

interest.eng_def: Your interests are the activities that you enjoy doing and the subjects that you like to spend time learning about.
interest.eg: On his form he lists his interests as cycling and cooking.

interest.eng_def: the quality that makes you think that something is interesting
interest.eg: Would this book be of any interest to you?

interest.eng_def: something that brings advantages to or affects someone or something
interest.eg: A union looks after the interests of its members.

interest.eng_def: money that is charged by a bank or other financial organization for borrowing money
interest.eg: Interest charges on an overdraft are usually quite high.

interest.eng_def: money that you earn from keeping your money in an account in a bank or other financial organization
interest.eg: You should put the money in a savings account where it will earn interest.

interest.eng_def: an involvement or a legal right, usually relating to a business or possessions
interest.eg: He is a multi-millionaire with business interests around the world.

interest.eng_def: If someone or something interests you, you want to give that person or thing your attention and discover more about him, her, or it.
interest.eg: Sport has never really interested me.

interfere.eng_def: to involve yourself in a situation when your involvement is not wanted or is not helpful
interfere.eg: It's their problem and I'm not going to interfere.

interference.eng_def: an occasion when someone tries to interfere in a situation
interference.eg: She seems to regard any advice or help from me as interference.

interference.eng_def: noise or other electronic signals that stop you from getting good pictures or sound on a television or radio
interference.chi_def: （雜訊或其他電子訊號對電視或收音機的）干擾

interior.eg: The estate agent had pictures of the house from the outside but none of its interior.

interior.eng_def: the land that is furthest away from the outside or coast of a country or continent
in some countries, the government department that deals with subjects and events that are important in the country itself instead of events in other countries

interior.eg: The interior walls have patches of damp on them.

interior.eng_def: relating to the government department in some countries that deals with subjects and events that are important in that country instead of events in other countries

intermediate.eng_def: being between two other related things, levels, or points
intermediate.eg: There are three levels of difficulty in this game: low, intermediate, and high.

internal.eng_def: existing or happening inside a person, object, organization, place, or country
internal.eg: He sustained injuries to his arms, legs, and several internal organs.

international.eng_def: a sports event involving more than one country, or a person who competes in it
international.chi_def: 國際比賽；國際比賽選手

interpret.eng_def: to decide what the intended meaning of something is
interpret.eg: It's difficult to interpret these statistics without knowing how they were obtained.

interpret.eng_def: to express your own ideas about the intended meaning of a play or a piece of music when performing it
interpret.chi_def: （表演者根據本人對作品的理解）表演，演繹
interpret.eg: If Shakespeare's plays are to reach a large audience they need to be interpreted in a modern style.

interpret.eng_def: to change what someone is saying into another language
interpret.eg: We had to ask our guide to interpret for us.

interpretation.eng_def: an explanation or opinion of what something means
interpretation.eg: The dispute is based on two widely differing interpretations of the law.

interpretation.eng_def: a particular way of performing a piece of music, a part in a play, etc.
interpretation.chi_def: （音樂、戲劇角色等的）演繹；演出；表演
interpretation.eg: Her interpretation of Juliet was one of the best performances I have ever seen.

interpreter.eng_def: someone whose job is to change what someone else is saying into another language
interpreter.eg: She works as an interpreter in Brussels.

interpreter.eng_def: a computer program that changes the instructions in another program into a form that can be easily understood by a computer
someone who performs a piece of music or a part in a play, etc. in a way that expresses their own ideas about its meaning
interpreter.chi_def: （音樂或戲劇的）表演者；演繹者（以自己的理解方式表演）
interpreter.eg: He's a noted interpreter of traditional Irish music.

interrupt.eng_def: to stop a person from speaking for a short period by something you say or do
interrupt.eg: She tried to explain what had happened but he kept interrupting her.

interrupt.eng_def: to stop something from happening for a short period
interrupt.eg: We had to interrupt our trip when we heard John's mother had had an accident.

interruption.eng_def: an occasion when someone or something stops something from happening for a short period

intersection.eng_def: an occasion when two lines cross, or the place where this happens
intersection.eg: The intersection of the lines on the graph marks the point where we start to make a profit.

intersection.eng_def: the place where two or more roads join or cross each other

interval.eng_def: a period between two events or times
interval.eg: We see each other at regular intervals - usually about once a month.
The plants should be spaced at six-inch intervals.

interval.eng_def: a short period between the parts of a performance or a sports event
interval.chi_def: （演出的）幕間休息；（體育比賽的）中間休息，中場休息
interval.eg: There will be two 20-minute intervals during the opera.

interval.eng_def: repeated after a particular period of time or a particular distance
interval.eg: In the event of fire, the alarm will sound at 15-second intervals/at intervals of 15 seconds.

interval.eng_def: the amount by which one note is higher or lower than another
interval.eg: an interval of a fifth (= between one note and another one four notes higher)

intervene.eng_def: to intentionally become involved in a difficult situation in order to improve it or prevent it from getting worse
intervene.eg: The Central Bank intervened in the currency markets today to try to stabilize the exchange rate.

intervene.eng_def: to happen between two times or between other events or activities
intervene.eg: Two decades intervened between the completion of the design and the opening of the theatre.

intervention.eng_def: the practice of refusing to get involved in a situation, especially in a disagreement between countries or within a country
intervention.chi_def: （尤指對國家間或國家內部事務的）不干涉

interview.eng_def: a meeting in which someone asks you questions to see if you are suitable for a job or course
a meeting in which someone answers questions about himself or herself for a newspaper article, television show, etc.
interview.eg: an exclusive interview with Johnny Depp

interview.eng_def: a meeting in which the police ask someone questions to see if they have committed a crime
to ask someone questions in an interview
interview.eg: We've had 200 applicants for the job, but we only plan to interview about 20 of them.

intimacy.eng_def: a situation in which you have a close friendship or sexual relationship with someone
intimacy.eg: Intimacy between teachers and students is not recommended.

intimacy.eng_def: things that are said or done only by people who have a close relationship with each other
intimacy.eg: It was obvious from their witty intimacies that they had been good friends for many years.

intimate.eng_def: having, or being likely to cause, a very close friendship or personal or sexual relationship
intimate.chi_def: 親密的；有性關係的；宜於密切關係的

intimate.eng_def: (of knowledge or understanding) detailed, and obtained from a lot of studying or experience
intimate.eg: She has an intimate knowledge of Tuscany, where she has lived for 20 years.

intimate.eng_def: a friend you know very well
intimate.eg: Intimates of the star say that he has been upset by the personal attacks on him that have appeared in the press recently.

intimate.eng_def: to make clear what you think or want without saying it directly
intimate.eg: She has intimated that she will resign if she loses the vote.

intimidate.eng_def: to frighten or threaten someone, usually in order to persuade them to do something that you want them to do
intimidate.eg: They were intimidated into accepting a pay cut by the threat of losing their jobs.

into.eng_def: to the inside or middle of a place, container, area, etc.
into.eg: Would you put the jar back into the cupboard for me, please?

into.eng_def: used to show when a person or thing is changing from one form or condition to another
into.eg: Peel the cucumber and chop it into small cubes.

into.eng_def: used to show movement that involves something touching something else with a lot of force but without moving inside it
into.eg: He's always walking into things when he doesn't have his glasses on.

into.eng_def: in the direction of something or someone
into.eg: She was looking straight into his eyes.
an inquiry into the cause of the accident

into.eng_def: used when referring to the division of one number by another number

intonation.eng_def: the sound changes produced by the rise and fall of the voice when speaking, especially when this has an effect on the meaning of what is said
intonation.chi_def: （尤指對話語意義有影響的）語調，聲調
intonation.eg: The end of a sentence that is not a question is usually marked by falling intonation.

intonation.eng_def: the degree to which the notes of a piece of music are played or sung exactly in tune
intonation.eg: The violinist had good intonation, and a wonderful pure tone.

introduce.eng_def: to put something into use, operation, or a place for the first time
introduce.chi_def: 採用；引進；推行；放入，插入
introduce.eg: Apple has sold many millions of iPods since the product was introduced in 2001.

introduce.eng_def: to tell someone another person's name the first time that they meet
introduce.eg: I'd like to introduce my son, Mark.

introduce.eng_def: to be the beginning of something
introduce.eg: A haunting oboe solo introduces the third movement of the concerto.

introduce.eng_def: to speak or write before the beginning of a performance, programme or book and give information about it; to tell an audience about the person who is going to speak, sing, etc.
introduce.eg: The director will introduce the film personally at its premiere.

introduction.eng_def: an occasion when something is put into use or brought to a place for the first time
introduction.chi_def: 採用；引進；推行；放入，插入
introduction.eg: The introduction of new working practices has dramatically improved productivity.

introduction.eng_def: the action of telling someone another person's name the first time that they meet
introduction.eg: You'll have to do/make the introductions - I don't know everyone's name.
Have you read the introduction to the third edition?

introduction.eng_def: the first time someone experiences something
introduction.eg: That trip was my introduction to winter sports.

introduction.eng_def: a book or course that provides basic knowledge about a subject

intrude.eng_def: to go into a place or situation in which you are not wanted or not expected to be
intrude.eg: I didn't realize your husband was here, Dr Jones - I hope I'm not intruding.

intruder.eng_def: someone who is in a place or situation where they are not wanted
intruder.eg: I feel like an intruder when I visit their home.

intruder.eng_def: someone who enters a place without permission in order to commit a crime
intruder.eg: Intruders had entered the house through a back window.

intuition.eng_def: (knowledge from) an ability to understand or know something immediately based on your feelings rather than facts
intuition.eg: Often there's no clear evidence one way or the other and you just have to base your judgment on intuition.

invade.eng_def: to enter a country by force with large numbers of soldiers in order to take possession of it
invade.eg: Concentrations of troops near the border look set to invade within the next few days.

invade.eng_def: to enter a place in large numbers, usually when unwanted and in order to take possession or do damage
invade.chi_def: （通常為了謀財或搞破壞而不受歡迎地）湧入，蜂擁而至
invade.eg: Hundreds of squatters have invaded waste land in the hope that they will be allowed to stay.

invade.eng_def: to enter an area of activity in a forceful and noticeable way
invade.eg: Maria looks set to invade the music scene with her style and image.

invade.eng_def: to spoil a situation or quality for another person without thinking about their feelings
invade.eg: Famous people often find their privacy is invaded by the press.

invaluable.eg: The new job will provide you with invaluable experience.

invasion.eng_def: an occasion when an army or country uses force to enter and take control of another country
invasion.eg: They were planning to mount an invasion of the north of the country.

invasion.eng_def: an occasion when a large number of people or things come to a place in an annoying and unwanted way
invasion.chi_def: （通常為了謀財或搞破壞而不受歡迎地）湧入，蜂擁而至
invasion.eg: the annual invasion of foreign tourists

invasion.eng_def: an action or process that affects someone's life in an unpleasant and unwanted way

invent.eng_def: to design and/or create something that has never been made before
invent.eg: The first safety razor was invented by company founder King C. Gillette in 1903.

invent.eng_def: to create a reason, excuse, story, etc. that is not true, usually to deceive someone
invent.eg: But I didn't invent the story - everything I told you is true.

invention.eng_def: something that has never been made before, or the process of creating something that has never been made before
invention.eg: The world changed rapidly after the invention of the phone.

invention.eng_def: a story or excuse that is not true, or the act of creating a story or excuse that is not true
invention.eg: All that gossip about Linda was just pure invention.

inventor.eng_def: someone who has invented something or whose job is to invent things

inventory.eng_def: a detailed list of all the things in a place
inventory.eg: A set of 24 gilded chairs appear on the inventory of the house for 1736.

inventory.eng_def: the amount of goods a shop has, or the value of them
inventory.eg: Our inventory of used cars is the best in town.

inventory.eng_def: the counting of all the goods, materials, etc. kept in a place such as a shop

invest.eng_def: to put money, effort, time, etc. into something to make a profit or get an advantage
invest.eg: The institute will invest five million in the project.

investigate.eng_def: to examine a crime, problem, statement, etc. carefully, especially to discover the truth
investigate.eg: Police are investigating allegations of corruption involving senior executives.

investigation.eng_def: the act or process of examining a crime, problem, statement, etc. carefully, especially to discover the truth
investigation.chi_def: （對罪案、問題、陳述等的）調查，偵查（尤指為了發現真相）
investigation.eg: An investigation has been under way for several days into the disappearance of a 13-year-old boy.

investigator.eng_def: a person whose job is to examine a crime, problem, statement, etc. in order to discover the truth
investigator.eg: Investigators have studied the possible effects of contamination.

investment.eng_def: the act of putting money, effort, time, etc. into something to make a profit or get an advantage, or the money, effort, time, etc. used to do this
investment.chi_def: 投資（付諸金錢、努力、時間等以求得到利潤或取得成就某事的有利條件）；投資物，投資額
investment.eg: The government wanted an inflow of foreign investment.

invitation.eng_def: the act of inviting someone to go to an event
invitation.eg: Thanks for the invitation to your birthday party.

invitation.eng_def: an action that causes or encourages something to happen
invitation.eg: Leaving your house unlocked is an open (= clear) invitation to burglars.

invitation.eng_def: an occasion when someone is formally asked to do something
invitation.eg: This is a once in a lifetime invitation to invest in your dream home in the sun.

invitation.eng_def: a piece of paper or card that invites someone to an event
invitation.eg: I need to order the wedding invitations.

invite.eng_def: to ask or request someone to go to an event
to request something, especially formally or politely
invite.eg: Offers in the region of £1,000,000 are invited for the property.

invite.eng_def: to act in a way that causes or encourages something to happen or someone to believe or feel something
invite.eg: Behaving provocatively in class is just inviting trouble.
I didn't get an invite to their wedding.

involve.eng_def: If an activity, situation, etc. involves something, that thing is a part of the activity, etc.
involve.eg: Research involving the use of biological warfare agents will be used for defensive purposes.

involve.eng_def: If a situation involves someone or something, he, she, or it is affected by it.
involve.eg: The second accident involved two cars and a lorry.

involve.eng_def: to include someone in something, or to make them take part in or feel part of it
involve.eg: I prefer teaching methods that actively involve students in learning.

involvement.eng_def: the act or process of taking part in something
involvement.eg: The team's continued involvement in the competition is uncertain.
She spoke openly about her involvement with the former prime minister.

inward.eg: The force pushes the object in an inward direction.

inward.eng_def: inside your mind and not expressed to other people
relating to money coming into a country rather than leaving it
inward.eg: Inward foreign investment helped India achieve strong annual growth rates.

inwards.eg: After the accident, her thoughts began to turn inwards (= to her own interests or problems).

iron.eng_def: a chemical element that is a common greyish-coloured metal. It is strong, used in making steel, and exists in very small amounts in blood.
a piece of equipment for making clothes flat and smooth that has a handle and a flat base and is usually heated with electricity
a stick that has an iron or steel part at the end that is used to hit the ball in golf
iron.chi_def: （高爾夫球運動中的）鐵頭球杆，鐵杆
iron.eg: He'll probably use a 2 or 3 iron for the shot.

iron.eng_def: chains tied around someone to prevent them from escaping or moving
iron.eg: It was common practice for the prisoners to be clapped in irons (= tied with chains).

iron.eng_def: to make clothes flat and smooth using an iron
iron.eg: It takes about five minutes to iron a shirt properly.

iron.eng_def: very strong physically, mentally, or emotionally
iron.eg: I think you have to have an iron will to make some of these decisions.

ironic.eng_def: interesting, strange, or funny because of being very different from what you would usually expect
ironic.chi_def: 具有諷刺意味的；出乎意料的；令人啼笑皆非的
ironic.eg: It is ironic that although many items are now cheaper to make, fewer people can afford to buy them.

ironic.eng_def: showing that you really mean the opposite of what you are saying

irony.eng_def: a situation in which something which was intended to have a particular result has the opposite or a very different result
irony.chi_def: 具有諷刺意味的情況；出乎意料的情況；令人啼笑皆非的事情
irony.eg: The irony (of it) is that the new tax system will burden those it was intended to help.

irony.eng_def: the use of words that are the opposite of what you mean, as a way of being funny
irony.eg: Her voice heavy with irony, Simone said, "We're so pleased you were able to stay so long." (= Her voice made it obvious they were not pleased.)

irritable.eg: Be careful what you say - he's rather irritable today.

irritate.eng_def: to make someone angry or annoyed
irritate.eg: After a while her behaviour really began to irritate me.

irritate.eng_def: to make a part of your body sore or painful
irritate.eg: At first my contact lenses irritated my eyes.

irritation.eng_def: the feeling of being angry or annoyed, or something that makes you feel like this
irritation.eg: That kind of behaviour is sure to cause irritation.

irritation.eng_def: a painful or sore feeling in a part of the body
irritation.eg: It is an antiseptic cream suitable for minor skin irritations.

is.chi_def: （he、she或it 做主詞時be 的形式）

island.eng_def: a piece of land completely surrounded by water
a particular place that is peaceful, calm, etc., when other surrounding places are the opposite

island.chi_def: 交通島，安全島（同 traffic island）

isle.eng_def: (used especially in place names) an island
isle.eg: Explore the more remote Caribbean isles.

isolate.eng_def: to separate something from other things with which it is connected or mixed
isolate.eg: A high wall isolated the house from the rest of the village.

isolate.eng_def: to keep a person or animal separate from other people or animals by putting them in a different place
isolate.eg: He was isolated from all the other prisoners.

isolate.eng_def: to put a person, country, or organization in a situation where they are seen as being separate
isolate.eg: This policy will isolate minority groups and prevent integration.

isolation.eng_def: the condition of being alone, especially when this makes you feel unhappy
isolation.eg: The prisoner had been kept in isolation for three days.

isolation.eng_def: the fact that something is separate and not connected to other things
isolation.eg: I can't think about it in isolation (= separately) - I need some examples of the problem.

issue.eng_def: a subject or problem that people are thinking and talking about
most important in what is being discussed
issue.chi_def: （所討論問題中）最重要的，關鍵的
issue.eg: The point at issue is what is best for the child.

issue.eng_def: to make something seem more important than it should be, or to argue about it
issue.eg: Of course I'll help you, there's no need to make an issue of it.

issue.chi_def: 對…持強烈異議，很不贊同
issue.eg: I took issue with him over his interpretation of the instructions.

issue.eng_def: to have difficulty or disagreement with someone or something
issue.chi_def: 有問題（或麻煩）；（與…）有分歧
issue.eg: All the people in the study had low self-esteem and had issues with their bodies.

issue.eng_def: a set of newspapers or magazines published at the same time or a single copy of a newspaper or magazine
issue.eg: There's an article on motorbikes in the latest/next issue.

issue.eng_def: An issue of shares is a time when a company gives people the chance to buy part of it or gives extra shares to people who already own some.
to produce or provide something official
issue.eg: The office will be issuing permits on Tuesday and Thursday mornings.

itch.eng_def: to have or cause an uncomfortable feeling on the skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails
itch.eg: I can't wear wool - it makes me itch.

itch.eng_def: an uncomfortable feeling on the skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails
itch.eg: I've got an itch on the back of my neck.

item.eng_def: something that is part of a list or group of things
item.eg: the last item on the list

item.eng_def: one of several subjects to be considered
item.eg: There are three items on the agenda.

item.eng_def: a piece of news on television or radio, or in a newspaper
item.chi_def: （電視、廣播或報紙上的一條）新聞
item.eg: There's an interesting item on the back page.
Buyers from stores are given the opportunity to go through fashion collections item by item and place orders.

ivory.eng_def: the hard yellowish-white substance that forms the tusks of some animals such as elephants, used especially in the past to make decorative objects

ivy.eng_def: an evergreen plant (= one that never loses its leaves) that often grows up trees or buildings

jack.eng_def: a piece of equipment that can be opened slowly under a heavy object such as a car in order to raise it off the ground
jack.eg: You need a car jack in order to change a tyre.

jack.eng_def: a playing card with a picture of a man on it. It has a lower value than the cards showing a king or queen
a small ball towards which other balls are rolled or thrown in the games of bowls or boules
jack.chi_def: （草地滾木球遊戲或法國式滾球遊戲中的）靶子球

jack.eng_def: a connection between two pieces of electrical equipment

jacket.eg: Can you put the record back in its jacket, please?

jade.eng_def: a precious green stone from which jewellery and small decorative items are made, especially in China and Japan

jail.eng_def: a place where criminals are kept to punish them for their crimes, or where people accused of crimes are kept while waiting for their trials
to put someone in a jail
jail.eg: He was jailed for three years.

jam.eng_def: a sweet, soft food made by cooking fruit with sugar to preserve it. It is eaten on bread.

jam.eg: We were stuck in a jam for two hours.

jam.eng_def: something that is stuck in a machine, or that prevents the parts of a machine from moving
jam.chi_def: 堵在機器中的東西；讓機器部件無法運動的東西
jam.eg: She fed the documents into the machine making sure that there were no paper jams.
I'm in a jam - could you lend me some money till next week?

jam.eng_def: a situation in which a lot of people are in a small space
jam.eg: It's a real jam inside - it took me ten minutes to get to the bar.

jam.eng_def: to be, or make something, unable to move
jam.eg: The door jammed behind me and I couldn't get out.

jam.eng_def: to stop radio signals from reaching the people who want to receive them
jam.eg: Foreign radio broadcasts were regularly jammed.

jam.eng_def: to play jazz or rock music with other people informally without planning it or practising together
jam.chi_def: （與他人）即興演奏爵士樂（或搖滾樂）

jam.eng_def: to push something forcefully or with difficulty into something else
jam.eg: He jammed the boxes into the back of the car.
The centre of town was jammed with cars moving at a very slow pace.

janitor.eng_def: a person employed to take care of a large building, such as a school, and who deals with the cleaning, repairs, etc.

jar.eng_def: a glass or clay container with a wide opening at the top and sometimes a fitted lid, usually used for storing food

jar.eg: We often have a jar or two at the pub after work.

jar.eng_def: a sudden forceful or unpleasant shake or movement
jar.eg: With every jar of the carriage, the children shrieked with excitement.

jar.eng_def: to shake or move someone or something unpleasantly or violently
jar.eg: The sudden movement jarred his injured ribs.

jar.eng_def: If a sight, sound, or experience jars, it is so different or unexpected that it has a strong and unpleasant effect on something or someone.
jar.eg: The harsh colours jarred the eye.

jar.eng_def: to disagree or seem wrong or unsuitable
jar.eg: This comment jars with the opinions we have heard expressed elsewhere.

jasmine.eng_def: a climbing plant. One type has white sweet-smelling flowers in summer and another type has yellow flowers in winter.

jaw.eng_def: the lower part of your face that moves when you open your mouth
either of the two bones in your mouth that hold your teeth
the mouth of a person or animal, especially a large and frightening animal
jaw.chi_def: （尤指大型兇猛動物的）口部，嘴
jaw.eg: The lion opened its jaws and roared.

jaw.eng_def: something that opens and closes like the upper and lower parts of a mouth
jaw.eg: His foot was caught in the jaws of the trap.
The rescuers snatched the children from the jaws of death.
I met Jane and we had a good jaw over lunch.

jaw.eng_def: to talk for a long time
jaw.eg: He was jawing away to his girlfriend for hours on the phone.

jaywalk.eng_def: to walk across a street at a place where it is not allowed or without taking care to avoid the traffic

jazz.eng_def: a type of modern music originally developed by African-Americans, with a rhythm in which the strong notes often come before the beat. Jazz is usually improvised (= invented as it is played).

jealous.eng_def: upset and angry because someone that you love seems interested in another person
jealous.chi_def: 妒忌的；好妒忌的；吃醋的

jealous.eng_def: unhappy and angry because someone has something that you want
jealous.eg: He had always been very jealous of his brother's good looks.

jealous.eng_def: extremely careful in protecting someone or something
jealous.chi_def: 小心守護的，唯恐失去的
jealous.eg: She is very jealous of her independence, and doesn't want to get married.

jealousy.eng_def: a feeling of unhappiness and anger because someone has something or someone that you want
jealousy.eg: He broke his brother's new bike in a fit of jealousy.

jeans.eng_def: trousers made of denim (= strong blue cotton cloth) that are worn informally

jeep.eng_def: a brand name for a type of small strong vehicle used for travelling over rough ground, especially by the army
jeep.chi_def: （尤指軍隊用的）吉普車，越野車

jeer.eng_def: to laugh or shout insults at someone to show you have no respect for them
jeer.eg: The people at the back of the hall jeered (at) the speaker.

jelly.eng_def: a sweet soft food made by cooking fruit with sugar to preserve it. It is smooth, without any pieces of fruit in it. Jelly is eaten on bread.
jelly.eg: a peanut butter and jelly sandwich

jelly.eng_def: a soft, sweet, usually brightly coloured food made from sugar, gelatine, and fruit flavours, that shakes slightly when it is moved
jelly.eg: I've made a strawberry jelly for the children's tea.

jelly.eng_def: any soft, slightly wet substance that shakes slightly when it is moved
jelly.eg: Frogs' eggs are covered in a sort of transparent jelly.

jet.eng_def: an aircraft with a jet engine that is able to fly very fast
a thin stream of something, such as water or gas, that is forced out of a small hole
jet.eg: She turned on the hose and a jet of water sprayed across the yard.

jet.eng_def: a small hole in a piece of equipment through which gas or another fuel is forced before it is burned
jet.eg: I think the gas jet must be blocked, because the oven won't light.

jet.eng_def: a hard, black stone that shines when it is rubbed and is used to make jewellery and other decorative objects

jet.eg: I'm jetting off to New Zealand next week.

jewel.eng_def: a precious stone that is used to decorate valuable objects
jewel.eg: She was wearing a large gold necklace set with jewels.

jewel.eng_def: a small precious stone or a piece of specially cut glass, used in the mechanism of a watch
something that is very beautiful or valuable
jewel.eg: Many visitors consider the Sistine Chapel to be the jewel of the Vatican.

jewel.eng_def: a very kind or helpful person

jewelry.eng_def: decorative objects worn on your clothes or body that are usually made from valuable metals, such as gold and silver, and precious stones

jingle.eng_def: to make a repeated gentle ringing sound, or to make things do this
jingle.eg: She waited for him by the car, jingling the keys in her hand.

jingle.eng_def: a short simple tune, often with words, that is easy to remember and is used to advertise a product on the radio or television
jingle.chi_def: （廣播或電視廣告中容易記住的）短歌，短曲

job.eng_def: the regular work that a person does to earn money

job.eg: How long have you been out of a job?
The builders are aiming to get the job done by the end of the month.
She believed her job as a politician was to represent the views of her party and the people who voted for her.

job.eng_def: a problem or an activity that is difficult
job.eg: It was a real job getting the wheel off the bike.

job.eng_def: an example of a particular type
job.eg: It's an original, not one of those imitation jobs.

job.eng_def: a crime in which money or goods are stolen, or an action or activity that is dishonest or unpleasant
job.eg: He was put in prison for five years for doing a bank job.

jog.eng_def: to run at a slow, regular speed, especially as a form of exercise
jog.chi_def: 慢跑（尤指作為健身鍛煉的方式）
jog.eg: "What do you do to keep fit?" "I jog and go swimming."

jog.eng_def: to push or knock someone or something slightly, especially with your arm
jog.eg: A man rushed past and jogged her elbow, making her drop the bag.

jog.eng_def: to move forward slowly with a lot of shaking or movement up and down
jog.eg: The horse and cart jogged down the rough track towards the farm.

jog.eng_def: a run that you do at a slow, regular speed, especially as a form of exercise
jog.chi_def: 慢跑（尤指作為健身鍛煉的方式）
jog.eg: I haven't done much exercise all week, so I think I'll go for a jog this morning.

join.eng_def: to connect or fasten things together
join.eg: A long suspension bridge joins the two islands.

join.eng_def: If roads or rivers join, they meet at a particular point.
join.eg: The A11 joins the M11 south of Cambridge.

join.eng_def: to get involved in an activity or journey with another person or group
join.eg: I don't have time for a drink now, but I'll join you later.

join.eng_def: to become a member of an organization
join.eg: I felt so unfit after Christmas that I decided to join a gym.

join.eng_def: to become one of a particular large group of people
join.eg: When I leave school at the end of this month, I'll probably have to join the ranks of the unemployed.

join.eng_def: a place where two things meet or are fastened together
join.eg: She'd stitched the two pieces together really carefully so that you couldn't see the join.

joint.eng_def: belonging to or shared between two or more people
a place in your body where two bones are connected
to force a joint in the body out of its correct position by accident
joint.eg: I put my shoulder out of joint last weekend lifting heavy boxes.

joint.eng_def: a place where two things are fastened together
joint.eg: Damp has penetrated the joints in the wood panelling.

joint.eng_def: a large piece of meat that is cooked in one piece
a piece of meat for cooking, usually containing a bone
joint.eg: Fry four chicken joints in a pan with some mushrooms and garlic.

joint.eng_def: a bar or restaurant that serves food and drink at low prices
joint.eg: We had lunch at a hamburger joint and then went to see a movie.

joint.eng_def: a place where people go for entertainment, especially one that has a bad reputation
joint.chi_def: 不良場所（尤指聲譽不佳的娛樂場所）
joint.eg: He owned several bars in the city and ran an illegal gambling joint.

joint.eng_def: a cigarette containing the drug cannabis
to cut meat into large pieces ready for cooking
joint.chi_def: 把（肉）切成大塊（供烹調用）

joke.eng_def: something, such as a funny story or trick, that is said or done in order to make people laugh
joke.eg: Did I tell you the joke about the chicken crossing the road?

joke.eng_def: a person or thing that is very bad or silly
joke.eg: Our new teacher's a joke - he can't even control the class.
They joked and laughed as they looked at the photos.

joke.eng_def: If you think that someone is joking, you think that they do not really mean what they say.
joke.eg: I thought he was joking when he said Helen was pregnant, but she really is.

jolly.eg: I love the bright yellow you've painted the children's room - it makes it look really jolly.
That's a jolly nice scarf you're wearing.

jolly.eng_def: to encourage someone to do something by putting that person in a good mood and persuading them gently
jolly.eg: I'll try to jolly my parents into letting me borrow the car this weekend.

journal.eng_def: a serious magazine or newspaper that is published regularly about a particular subject
a written record of what you have done each day, sometimes including your private thoughts and feelings
journal.eg: She kept a travel journal during her trip to South America.

journalism.eng_def: the work of collecting, writing, and publishing news stories and articles in newspapers and magazines or broadcasting them on the radio and television

journalist.eng_def: a person who writes news stories or articles for a newspaper or magazine or broadcasts them on radio or television
journalist.chi_def: 新聞記者；報紙撰稿人；廣播員

journey.eng_def: the act of travelling from one place to another, especially in a vehicle
journey.chi_def: （尤指搭乘交通工具的）旅行，行程
journey.eg: I love going on long journeys.
As we journeyed south, the landscape became drier and rockier.

joy.eg: They were filled with joy when their first child was born.

joy.eng_def: a person or thing that causes happiness
joy.chi_def: 使人高興的人（或物）；樂事；樂趣
joy.eg: Listening to music is one of his greatest joys.
Did you have any joy finding that book you wanted?

joyful.eg: Christmas is such a joyful time of year.

judge.eng_def: a person who is in charge of a trial in a court and decides how a person who is guilty of a crime should be punished, or who makes decisions on legal matters
the person who officially decides who is the winner of a competition
a person who has the knowledge to give an opinion about something or is able to decide if someone or something is good or bad
judge.eg: She's such a bad judge of character.

judge.eng_def: to form, give, or have as an opinion, or to decide about something or someone, especially after thinking carefully
judge.chi_def: （尤指認真考慮之後）斷定，判斷，估計
judge.eg: So far, he seems to be handling the job well, but it's really too soon to judge.

judge.eng_def: to express a bad opinion of someone's behaviour, often because you think you are better than them
judge.chi_def: （常指因為覺得優於他人而妄加）評論，批評，指責
judge.eg: You have no right to judge other people because of what they look like or what they believe.

judge.eng_def: to officially decide who will be the winner of a competition
judge.eg: I've been asked to judge the children's poetry competition.

judge.eng_def: used to express the reasons why you have a particular opinion
judge.eg: Judging by what he said, I think it's very unlikely that he'll be able to support your application.

judgement.eng_def: the ability to form valuable opinions and make good decisions
a decision or opinion about someone or something that you form after thinking carefully
judgement.eg: It proved difficult to come to/form/make a judgment about how well the school was performing.
In my judgment, we should let the solicitor deal with this.
It is the judgment of this court that you are guilty of murder.

judgment.eng_def: the ability to form valuable opinions and make good decisions
a decision or opinion about someone or something that you form after thinking carefully
judgment.eg: It proved difficult to come to/form/make a judgment about how well the school was performing.
In my judgment, we should let the solicitor deal with this.
It is the judgment of this court that you are guilty of murder.

jug.eng_def: a container for holding liquids that has a handle and a shaped opening at the top for pouring
a large, round container for liquids that has a flat base, a handle, and a very narrow raised opening at the top for pouring
jug.chi_def: （帶柄及頂部有狹窄開口的）大罐

jug.eng_def: the amount of liquid that a jug holds
jug.chi_def: 一大罐的容量；一壺的容量

jug.eg: I always knew he'd end up in (the) jug.

jug.eng_def: the amount held by a jug
jug.chi_def: 一大罐的容量；一壺的容量
jug.eg: There was a jugful of water on each table.

juice.eng_def: the liquid that comes from fruit or vegetables

juice.eg: Fry the meat first to seal in the juices.
My cousin Gianni's got all the juice in this neighborhood.
This early in the morning it's hard to get the creative juices flowing (= to start thinking of good ideas).

juicy.eng_def: Juicy foods contain a lot of juice and are enjoyable to eat.
used to describe information that is especially interesting because it is shocking or personal
juicy.chi_def: （資訊）生動有趣的，富刺激性的
juicy.eg: I've got some really juicy gossip for you.

juicy.eng_def: big, important, or of a high quality
juicy.eg: If sales continue like this, we should be showing a nice juicy profit at the end of the year.

jump.eng_def: to push yourself suddenly off the ground and into the air using your legs
jump.eg: The children were jumping up and down with excitement.

jump.eng_def: to push yourself suddenly off the ground in order to go over something
jump.eg: Can you jump over/across this stream?

jump.eng_def: to move or act suddenly or quickly
jump.chi_def: 突然（或快速）行動（或移動）
jump.eg: He suddenly jumped to his feet/jumped up and left.

jump.eng_def: If a noise or action causes you to jump, your body makes a sudden sharp movement because of surprise or fear.
jump.chi_def: （受驚等後）猛地一跳，突然一跳
jump.eg: The loud explosion made everyone jump.

jump.eng_def: to increase suddenly by a large amount
If a story, film, play, etc. jumps, it moves suddenly between different parts of it.
jump.chi_def: （故事、電影、戲劇等在不同部分間）突然轉換，跳躍
jump.eg: The movie is about his adult life, but it keeps jumping (back) to when he was a child.

jump.eng_def: to avoid or leave out a point or stage from the correct order in a series
jump.eg: You have to follow the instructions exactly, you can't just jump a few steps ahead.
They were just walking home when a bunch of guys jumped (on) them.

jump.eng_def: to go past or away from something illegally or wrongly
jump.eg: The police video showed that she had jumped the (traffic) lights.

jump.eng_def: to fail to appear for a court trial after being released until the trial in exchange for payment
jump.eg: I'd never have thought Hugh would jump bail.

jump.eng_def: If a place is jumping, it is crowded and full of life.
jump.eg: This joint (= place of entertainment) is really jumping tonight.

jump.eng_def: a sudden movement off the ground and into the air
jump.eg: He won with a jump of 8.5 metres.

jump.eng_def: a sudden sharp movement because of surprise or fear
jump.chi_def: （受驚等後）猛地一跳，突然一跳
jump.eg: The door slammed and Rita woke up with a jump.
Interest rates are now at 6.75 - that's a jump of almost 2 percent.

jungle.eng_def: a tropical forest in which trees and plants grow very closely together
jungle.eg: The Yanomami people live in the South American jungle.

jungle.eng_def: an uncontrolled or confusing mass of things
jungle.chi_def: 亂七八糟的一叢，雜亂的一堆
jungle.eg: Our garden is a real jungle.

jungle.eng_def: a situation in which it is difficult to succeed because a lot of people are competing against each other
jungle.chi_def: 弱肉強食的地方，生存競爭激烈殘酷之處
jungle.eg: You've got to be determined in this life - it's a jungle out there, kid.

jungle.eng_def: a type of popular dance music with an extremely fast rhythm and a low range of musical notes
jungle.chi_def: 叢林音樂（一種節奏極快、曲調低的流行舞曲）

junior.eng_def: someone who has a job at a low level within an organization
junior.chi_def: 地位（或等級）較低者；年資較淺者，晚輩

junior.eng_def: a student at a junior school

junior.eg: Lewis has just moved up to the juniors.

junior.eng_def: a student in the third year of a course that lasts for four years at a school or college
junior.chi_def: （美國四年制中學或大學的）三年級學生

junior.eng_def: a young person below a particular age who is involved in an activity, especially sport
junior.chi_def: 初級者（參與某項活動，尤其是體育活動時低於特定年齡的年青人）
junior.eg: Saturday morning sessions are for juniors only.

junior.eng_def: three, eight, etc. years younger than someone
junior.chi_def: 較年幼者（小某人3歲、8歲等）
junior.eg: My brother is five years my junior.

junior.eng_def: used to refer to your son
junior.eg: Come on, Junior, time for bed.

junior.chi_def: 地位（或等級）較低的；年資較淺的
junior.eg: I object to being told what to do by someone junior to me.

junior.eng_def: connected with or involving young people below a particular age
junior.chi_def: 初級的（低於特定年齡的）

junior.eng_def: used after a man's name to refer to the younger of two men in the same family who have the same name
junior.chi_def: （置於姓名後表示家庭同名兩人中的較年幼者）小

junk.eng_def: things that are considered to be of no use or value, or of low quality
junk.chi_def: 廢棄的舊東西；破爛的東西；便宜貨
junk.eg: We ought to clear out this cupboard - it's full of junk.

junk.eng_def: a Chinese ship with a flat bottom and square sails
to get rid of something because it is of no use or value

jury.eng_def: a group of people who have been chosen to listen to all the facts in a trial in a law court and to decide if a person is guilty or not guilty, or if a claim has been proved
a group of people chosen to decide the winner of a competition

just.eng_def: now, very soon, or very recently

just.eg: Who was that at the door just now?
John's in the bath just now - can he call you back?
This carpet would be just right for the dining room.
"Would you like another drink?" "OK, just one more."

just.eng_def: used to make a statement or order stronger
just.eg: He just won't do as he's told.

just.eng_def: used to reduce the force of a statement and to suggest that it is not very important
just.eg: Can I just borrow the scissors for a second?
We arrived at the airport just in time to catch the plane.

just.eng_def: If something is just possible, there is a slight chance that it will happen.
just.eg: It's just possible that we might be going away that weekend.
It's just dreadful what happened to her.
The judge's sentence was perfectly just in the circumstances.

just.eng_def: people who behave in a morally correct way
just.chi_def: 公正的人，有正義感的人

justice.eng_def: fairness in the way people are dealt with
justice.eg: There's no justice in the world when people can be made to suffer like that.

justice.eng_def: the system of laws in a country that judges and punishes people
justice.eg: the justice system in this country consists of a series of law courts at different levels.

justice.eng_def: a judge in a law court
justice.eg: The president is expected to name a new Supreme Court justice within the next few days.

justice.eng_def: used before the name of a judge in the High Court
justice.chi_def: （用於英國高等法院的法官姓名前）法官

justify.eng_def: to give or to be a good reason for
justify.chi_def: 為…辯護；證明…正當（或有理、正確）；是…的正當理由
justify.eg: I can't really justify taking another day off work.

justify.eng_def: If you justify yourself, you give a good reason for what you have done.
justify.eg: It was the only thing that I could do - I don't have to justify myself to anyone.

juvenile.eng_def: relating to a young person who is not yet old enough to be considered an adult
silly and typical of a child

kangaroo.eng_def: a large Australian mammal with a long stiff tail, short front legs and long powerful back legs on which it moves by jumping

keen.eng_def: very interested, eager, or wanting (to do) something very much
keen.eg: They were very keen to start work as soon as possible.
Many people are taking a keen interest (= a very great interest) in the result of the vote.

keen.eng_def: to make a loud, long, sad sound, especially because someone has died

keep.eng_def: to have or continue to have in your possession
keep.eg: Do you want this photograph back or can I keep it?

keep.eng_def: to own and manage a small shop
keep.eg: My uncle kept a little tobacconist's in Gloucester.

keep.eng_def: If you keep animals, you own and take care of them, but not in your home as pets.
keep.eg: to keep pigs/goats/chickens

keep.eng_def: to watch and care for someone's children while their parents are away
keep.eg: Jody will keep the children while I shop.

keep.eng_def: to do what you have told someone that you would do
keep.eg: I made a promise to you and I intend to keep it.

keep.eng_def: to go to a meeting or event that has been arranged
keep.eg: She phoned to say she couldn't keep her appointment.

keep.eng_def: to make a regular record of events or other information so that you can refer to it later
keep.chi_def: 寫日記／記帳／作記錄（等等）
keep.eg: I've kept a diary for twelve years now.

keep.eng_def: to not tell anyone a secret that you know
(of a watch or clock) to show the correct time
keep.eg: Does your watch keep good time?

keep.eng_def: to be the player who defends your team's goal by trying to prevent players from the other team scoring goals
to (cause to) stay in a particular place or condition
keep.eg: I wish you'd keep quiet.

keep.eng_def: to not tell people about something
keep.eg: They managed to keep the school's problems quiet for a while.

keep.eng_def: to continue doing something without stopping, or to do it repeatedly
keep.eg: He keeps trying to distract me.

keep.eng_def: to continue in the same way as before
keep.eg: If things keep going like this, we'll have to close the business.

keep.eng_def: to continue to do something or to live normally in a difficult situation
keep.chi_def: （在困難的條件下）繼續（做）；正常生活
keep.eg: Sometimes it was hard to keep going, but we did it for the children's sake.

keep.eng_def: to help someone to continue doing something or living normally, especially in a difficult situation
keep.chi_def: （尤指在困難的條件下）協助…繼續（做）；正常生活
keep.eg: It was my friends that kept me going through all this.

keep.eng_def: to prevent someone from getting too hungry when they have to wait to eat a meal
keep.chi_def: （在等待吃飯時）使…不至於太餓
keep.eg: Have a piece of fruit to keep you going.

keep.eng_def: to delay someone or prevent them from doing something
keep.eg: He's very late - what's keeping him?

keep.eng_def: If you say that news or information for someone can keep, you mean that you can tell it to them later.
keep.eg: "I must tell you something." "Can't it keep? I'm in a hurry!"

keep.eng_def: (of food) to stay fresh and in good condition
keep.eg: Milk keeps much longer in a fridge.

keep.eng_def: to provide yourself or another person with food, clothing, a home, and other things necessary for basic living
keep.eg: He wanted a job that would allow him to keep his family in comfort.

keep.eng_def: the cost of providing food, heating, and other necessary things for someone
keep.eg: He's old enough now to earn his keep and stop living off his parents.

keep.eng_def: the strong main tower of a castle

keeper.eng_def: a person who takes care of animals or is in charge of valuable objects, a building, etc.

kernel.eng_def: the part of a nut that is inside the shell and can be eaten
the whole seed of the maize plant
the most important part of something, although it might not always be easy to find
kernel.eg: There is often a kernel of truth in what they say.

ketchup.eng_def: a thick, cold, red sauce made from tomatoes
ketchup.eg: Do you want some ketchup with your burger?

kettle.eng_def: a container for boiling water, that has a lid, handle, and spout and is made from plastic or metal
to start to boil water in a kettle
an occasion when police form lines around a crowd of people and prevent them from leaving a particular area
kettle.chi_def: （警察控制大批街頭人群的戰術）把人群困在一定區域，不讓離開

kettle.eng_def: If the police kettle a crowd of people, they form lines around them and prevent them from leaving a particular area.
kettle.chi_def: （警察)把人群困在一定區域，不讓離開

key.eng_def: a piece of metal that has been cut into a special shape and is used for opening or closing a lock, starting a car engine, etc.
