any of the set of moving parts that you press with your fingers on a computer keyboard, or musical instrument to produce letters, numbers, symbols, or musical notes
a set of musical notes based on one particular note
key.eg: The song changes key halfway through.

key.eng_def: a list of the symbols used in a map or book with explanations of what they mean
a list of the answers to the questions in an exercise or test
key.eg: See the key to test 3 on page 176.

key.eng_def: very important and having a lot of influence on other people or things
key.eg: She was a key figure in the international art world.

key.eng_def: to intentionally damage a car by scratching its paint using a key
key.chi_def: 故意用鑰匙刮花一輛車

keyboard.eng_def: the set of keys on a computer or typewriter that you press in order to make it work, or the row of keys on a musical instrument such as a piano
an electronic musical instrument similar to a piano
to put information into a computer using a keyboard

kick.eng_def: to hit someone or something with the foot, or to move the feet and legs suddenly and violently
kick.eg: I kicked the ball as hard as I could.

kick.eng_def: If a gun kicks, it jumps back suddenly and with force when the gun is fired.
used to say that you are very annoyed with yourself because you have done something stupid or missed a chance
kick.chi_def: （由於做了蠢事或錯失機會而）懊惱，自責
kick.eg: When I realized what I'd done I could have kicked myself.
He gave the ball a good kick.

kick.eng_def: a strong feeling of excitement and pleasure
kick.chi_def: 極度的快感（或刺激）；極大的樂趣
kick.eg: I get a real kick out of winning a race.

kick.eng_def: the strong effect of an alcoholic drink
kick.eg: Watch out for the fruit punch, it has a real kick.

kick.eng_def: a new interest, especially one that does not last long
kick.eg: He's on an exercise kick (= he exercises a lot) at the moment.

kid.eg: He took the kids to the park while I was working.
He was only 16, just a kid really.

kid.eng_def: to be very happy and excited about the things around you, and often react to them in a way that is silly and not controlled
kid.chi_def: 像進了糖果店的孩子（形容對周圍的事物感到非常高興、激動，以至於行為表現得可笑，難以控制）
kid.eg: You should have seen him when they arrived. He was like a kid in a candy store.

kid.eng_def: very soft leather made from the skin of a young goat
to say something as a joke, often making someone believe something that is not true
kid.eg: Oh no, I forgot your birthday! Hey, just/only kidding!

kid.eng_def: to believe something that is not true, usually because you want it to be true
kid.eg: He says there's a good chance she'll come back to him but I think he's kidding himself.

kidnap.eng_def: to take a person away illegally by force, usually in order to demand money in exchange for releasing them
kidnap.eg: The wife of a businessman was kidnapped from her home in London last night.

kidnap.eng_def: the crime of taking someone away by force and demanding money in exchange for releasing them

kidney.eng_def: either of a pair of small organs in the body that take away waste matter from the blood to produce urine
these organs from an animal, used as food

kill.eng_def: to cause someone or something to die
kill.eg: Her parents were killed in a plane crash.

kill.eng_def: to stop or destroy a relationship, activity, or experience
kill.eg: Lack of romance can kill a marriage.
We killed off two six-packs watching the game.

kill.eng_def: to cause someone a lot of effort or difficulty
kill.chi_def: 使付出很多努力；給（某人）招來很多困難
kill.eg: It wouldn't kill you to apologize.

kill.eng_def: to cause someone a lot of pain
kill.eg: I must sit down, my feet are killing me!

kill.eng_def: If you say that someone will kill you, you mean that they will be very angry with you.
kill.chi_def: （意指極為憤怒）非殺了（某人）不可
kill.eg: My sister would kill me if she heard me say that.

kill.eng_def: to make someone laugh a lot
an animal or bird that has been hunted and killed, or the action of killing
kill.chi_def: 被捕殺的動物，獵物；殺死，捕殺
kill.eg: The leopard seizes its kill and begins to eat.

kilogram.eng_def: a unit of mass equal to 1,000 grams

kilometer.eng_def: a unit of measurement equal to 1,000 metres

kin.eg: We can't release his name until we have informed his next of kin.

kind.eng_def: generous, helpful, and thinking about other people's feelings
kind.eg: She's a very kind and thoughtful person.

kind.eng_def: a group with similar characteristics, or a particular type
kind.eg: Today's vehicles use two kinds of fuel - petrol and diesel.

kindergarten.eng_def: the first year of school, for children aged five

kindergarten.chi_def: 幼稚園，托兒所（同 nursery school）

kindle.eng_def: to cause a fire to start burning by lighting paper, wood, etc.
to cause strong feelings or ideas in someone
kindle.chi_def: 激起（熱情等）；使產生想法
kindle.eg: Her imagination was kindled by the exciting stories her grandmother told her.

king.eng_def: (the title of) a male ruler of a country, who holds this position because of his royal birth
the most important, best, or most respected member of a group of animals, things, or people
king.chi_def: （同類動物、事物或人中的）首屈一指者，最重要者
king.eg: The lion is often called the king of the jungle.

king.eng_def: In the game of chess, the king is the most important piece on the board. It can move one square in any direction.
a card with a picture of a king on it, used in games
used as part of the name of something that is larger than the ordinary type
king.chi_def: （作為名稱的一部分，指某一種類中）巨型的，較大的

kingdom.eng_def: a country ruled by a king or queen
kingdom.eg: the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

kingdom.eng_def: an area that is controlled by a particular person or where a particular quality is important
kingdom.chi_def: （某人）佔統治地位的地方；管轄範圍；（某種特質為重的）領域

kingdom.eng_def: one of the groups that natural things can be divided into, depending on their type

kiss.eng_def: to touch with your lips, especially as a greeting, or to press your mouth onto another person's mouth in a sexual way
kiss.eg: There was a young couple on the sofa, kissing passionately.
The breeze/sun kissed her bare shoulders.

kiss.eng_def: If you tell a child you will kiss a part of the body that hurts better, you mean you will make it feel better by kissing it.
kiss.chi_def: 吻（孩子的傷痛處）以示安慰；以吻消除疼痛
kiss.eg: "Mummy, I hurt my knee." "Come here, darling, and let me kiss it better."

kit.eng_def: a set of things, such as tools or clothes, used for a particular purpose or activity
kit.chi_def: （用於某種目的或活動的）成套工具（或服裝）

kit.eng_def: a set of parts sold ready to be put together
kit.chi_def: 配套元件（供購買者裝配成件）
kit.eg: He's making a model car from a kit.

kit.eng_def: the particular clothing worn by a sports team, or the particular clothing and small pieces of equipment worn and used by people such as soldiers and sailors
kit.chi_def: （運動隊的）全套服裝；（士兵、水手等的）全套裝備

kitchen.eng_def: a room where food is kept, prepared, and cooked and where the dishes are washed
kitchen.eg: We usually eat breakfast in the kitchen.

kite.eng_def: a frame covered with cloth or plastic and joined to a long string, that you fly in the air when the weather is windy
a large bird of prey (= a bird that eats other birds and small animals)

kitty.eng_def: an amount of money that is made up of small amounts given by different people, used by them for an agreed purpose
kitty.eg: We all put $20 in/into the kitty to cover the cost of food.

knee.eng_def: the middle joint of the leg that allows the leg to bend
knee.eg: The baby was crawling around on its hands and knees.

knee.eng_def: the part of a piece of clothing that covers the knee
knee.eg: She was wearing an old pair of trousers with rips at the knees.

knee.eng_def: to hit someone with your knee
knee.eg: She kneed him in the groin.

kneel.eng_def: to go down into, or stay in, a position where one or both knees are on the ground

knife.eng_def: a tool, usually with a metal blade and a handle, used for cutting and spreading food or other substances, or as a weapon
to attack someone using a knife
knife.eg: He knifed her in the back.

knight.eng_def: a man given a rank of honour by a British king or queen because of his special achievements, and who has the right to be called "Sir"
knight.eg: He hopes to be made a knight for his work at the Bank of England.

knight.eng_def: (in the past) a man of high social position trained to fight as a soldier on a horse
in the game of chess, a piece in the shape of a horse's head that moves two squares in one direction and then one square at an angle of 90°
to give someone the rank of knight
knight.eg: He was knighted for his work with famine victims.

knit.eng_def: to make clothes, etc. by using two long needles to connect wool or another type of thread into joined rows
to do the most basic type of stitch, when knitting something

knit.eg: The broken bone should begin to knit (together) in a few days.

knob.eng_def: a round handle, or a small, round device for controlling a machine or electrical equipment
knob.chi_def: 球形把手；（機器等的）旋鈕

knob.eng_def: a round lump on the surface or end of something
a small amount of something solid, especially butter
knob.eg: Put a knob of butter in the frying pan.

knock.eng_def: to repeatedly hit something, producing a noise
knock.eg: She knocked on the window to attract his attention.

knock.eng_def: If an engine is knocking, it is producing a repeated high sound either because the fuel is not burning correctly or because a small part is damaged and is therefore allowing another part to move in ways that it should not.
If something such as a pipe knocks, it makes a repeated high sound.
to hit, especially forcefully, and cause to move or fall
knock.eg: He accidentally knocked the vase off the table.

knock.eng_def: If you knock two rooms into each other or knock two rooms through, you remove the wall between them so that they form one room.

knock.eg: Don't knock him - he's doing his best.

knock.eng_def: a sudden short noise made when someone or something hits a surface
knock.eg: There was a knock at/on the door.

knock.eng_def: the act of something hard hitting a person or thing
knock.eg: He received a nasty knock on the head from a falling slate.

knot.eng_def: a join made by tying together the ends of a piece or pieces of string, rope, cloth, etc.
a tight mass, for example of hair or string
knot.eg: Alice's hair is always full of knots and tangles.

knot.eng_def: a small group of people standing close together
knot.eg: Knots of anxious people stood waiting in the hall.

knot.eng_def: a small hard area on a tree or piece of wood where a branch was joined to the tree
a measure of the speed of ships, aircraft, or movements of water and air. One knot is one nautical mile per hour.
knot.chi_def: 節（飛機或輪船的航速以及流速單位；1節約等於1浬／小時）
knot.eg: a top speed of about 20 knots

knot.eng_def: to tie in or with a knot
knot.eg: He caught the rope and knotted it around a post.

knot.eng_def: to form a tight, hard, rounded mass
knot.eg: His muscles knotted (= swelled) with the strain.

know.eng_def: to have information in your mind
used to ask someone to tell you a piece of information

know.eg: I know (that) she'll be really pleased to hear the news.

know.eng_def: to be familiar with or have experience and understanding of
know.eg: I've known Daniel since we were at school together.

know.eng_def: If you know a subject, you are familiar with it and understand it.
If you know a language, you can speak and understand it.

know.eg: That's Peter alright - I'd know him anywhere!

know.eng_def: to be able to do something because you have the necessary knowledge
know.eg: Do you know how to print on this computer?

know.eng_def: to spend time with someone or something so that you gradually learn more about him, her, or it
know.eg: The first couple of meetings are for the doctor and patient to get to know each other.

know.eng_def: to have heard the name of a person but not seen or talked to them
If you know someone by sight, that person looks familiar to you, but is not a friend of yours.
to have knowledge about something that most people do not have
know.eg: This resort is considered by those who are in the know to have the best downhill skiing in Europe.

knowledge.eng_def: understanding of or information about a subject that you get by experience or study, either known by one person or by people generally
knowledge.chi_def: 知識；學問；學識；了解；理解
knowledge.eg: Her knowledge of English grammar is very extensive.

knowledge.eng_def: the state of knowing about or being familiar with something
knowledge.eg: They both deny all knowledge of the affair.

knowledgeable.eg: He's very knowledgeable about German literature.

knuckle.eng_def: one of the joints in the hand where your fingers bend, especially where your fingers join on to the main part of your hand

koala.eng_def: an Australian mammal with greyish fur. Koalas live in eucalyptus trees and eat their leaves.

lab.chi_def: 實驗室；實驗大樓（同 laboratory）

label.eng_def: a piece of paper or other material that gives you information about the object it is attached to
label.eg: Remember to put some address labels on the suitcases.

label.eng_def: a word or a phrase that is used to describe the characteristics or qualities of people, activities, or things, often in a way that is unfair
label.chi_def: （用來描述人、活動或事物特點或特性的，常為不公正的）稱號，綽號
label.eg: He seems to be stuck with the label of "troublemaker".

label.eng_def: a company that produces goods for sale, the goods themselves, or the company's name or symbol
label.chi_def: 公司；品牌商品；公司名稱；公司標誌
label.eg: Her favourite designer label (= maker of expensive clothes) is Armani.

labor.eng_def: the Labor Party, an Australian political party that believes in social equality and the rights of workers

laboratory.eng_def: a room or building with scientific equipment for doing scientific tests or for teaching science, or a place where chemicals or medicines are produced

lace.eng_def: a decorative cloth made by twisting thin thread in delicate patterns with holes in them
a string that you use to fasten openings, especially in shoes, by putting it through two lines of small holes and tying the ends together
to add alcohol or drugs to food or drink, often secretly
lace.chi_def: （常指偷偷地）在（食物或飲料）中摻（酒、藥等）

lace.eng_def: to put the lace of a shoe or boot through its holes, or to fasten a shoe or boot by tying a lace
lace.chi_def: 給…穿鞋帶，繫（鞋或靴子）的鞋帶

lack.eng_def: the fact that something is not available or that there is not enough of it
lack.eg: Her only problem is a lack of confidence.

lack.eng_def: to not have or not have enough of something that is needed or wanted
lack.eg: He just lacks a little confidence.

lad.eg: A group of young lads were standing outside the shop.

ladder.eng_def: a piece of equipment used for climbing up and down, that consists of two vertical bars or pieces of rope joined to each other by a set of horizontal steps
ladder.eg: She was up a ladder, cleaning the window.

ladder.eng_def: a series of increasingly important jobs or stages in a particular type of work or process
ladder.chi_def: （職位晉升的）階梯；（發展的）階段
ladder.eg: Once he started at Paramount in 1967, he moved rapidly up the corporate ladder.

ladder.eng_def: a long, vertical hole in a pair of tights or a stocking
ladder.chi_def: （緊身褲襪或長筒襪的）抽絲，滑絲

ladder.eng_def: (in particular sports) a system in which all the players who play regularly are given a position in a list and can improve their position by beating other players in that list
ladder.chi_def: （某項體育比賽採用的）階梯晉級賽

ladder.eng_def: If a pair of tights or a stocking ladders or if you ladder it, a long hole appears in it.
ladder.eg: Damn! That's the second pair of tights I've laddered today!

lady.eng_def: a polite or old-fashioned way of referring to or talking to a woman
lady.eg: There's a young lady here to see you.

lady.eng_def: a woman who behaves in a way that is traditionally considered to be suitable for a woman
lady.eg: Of course I remember Mrs Connor - she was a real lady.

lady.eng_def: sometimes used before the name of a job done by a woman
used to talk to a woman in a way that is not polite and is considered offensive by many women
lady.chi_def: （用作不禮貌的稱呼）女士，女人

lady.eng_def: a women's toilet in a public place or building such as a hotel or restaurant
lady.eg: I'm just going to the ladies.

lady.eng_def: used to talk to the members of the audience when you are making a speech
lady.chi_def: （講話時對聽衆的稱呼）女士們先生們
lady.eg: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen, and welcome to our show.

lady.eng_def: a title given in the UK to a woman or girl who has the social rank of a peer, or to the wife of a peer or knight
lady.chi_def: （用於稱呼英國擁有貴族頭銜的女性或爵士的妻子）夫人，小姐，太太

ladybird.eng_def: a small, red beetle that is round and has black spots

ladybug.eng_def: a small, red beetle that is round and has black spots

lag.eng_def: to move or make progress so slowly that you are behind other people or things
lag.eg: He's lagging behind - I think we'd better wait for him to catch us up.

lag.eng_def: to cover something with a thick layer of material in order to stop heat from escaping or to stop water from freezing
lag.chi_def: （為保溫而）覆蓋，（爲防止結冰而）給…加保溫層

lag.eng_def: to send someone to prison or to arrest someone
a delay between two things happening
lag.eg: You have to allow for a time lag between order and delivery.

lag.eng_def: a prisoner or a person who has often been a prisoner in the past

lake.eng_def: a large area of water surrounded by land and not connected to the sea except by rivers or streams
lake.eg: We used to go boating on that lake.

lake.eng_def: an amount of a liquid produced that is more than is needed, so that it has to be stored or wasted
lake.chi_def: （因過量生産而出現的）奶／油／酒（等等）
lake.eg: Overproduction caused butter mountains and wine lakes.

lamb.eng_def: a young sheep, or the flesh of a young sheep eaten as meat
lamb.eg: lambs gambolling about in the fields

lamb.eng_def: (of a sheep) to give birth to lambs

lame.eng_def: (especially of animals) not able to walk correctly because of physical injury to or weakness in the legs or feet
(especially of an excuse or argument) weak and unsatisfactory
lame.chi_def: （尤指藉口或論據）站不住腳的，無說服力的

lame.eng_def: a type of cloth with threads of gold or silver in it

lament.eng_def: to express sadness and feeling sorry about something
lament.chi_def: 對…感到悲痛，對…表示失望，痛惜
lament.eg: The poem opens by lamenting (over) the death of a young man.

lament.eng_def: a song, poem, or other piece of writing that expresses sadness about someone's death
lament.eg: The whole play can be interpreted as a lament for lost youth.

lamp.eng_def: a device for giving light, especially one that has a covering or is contained within something
any of various devices that produce particular types of light

land.eng_def: the surface of the earth that is not covered by water
land.eg: It is cheaper to drill for oil on land than at sea.

land.eng_def: an area of ground, especially when used for a particular purpose such as farming or building
land.eg: This sort of land is no good for growing potatoes.
Most of the families lived off the land (= grew their own food, etc.).
a land of ice and snow

land.eng_def: to (cause to) arrive on the ground or other surface after moving down through the air
land.eg: We should land in Madrid at 7 a.m.

land.eng_def: to arrive on land from the sea
land.eg: We landed at Port Said in the early evening.

land.eng_def: to arrive at or appear on a particular website
land.chi_def: 流覽到（網站）；出現在（網站上）
land.eg: If you click on the link you land on his blog.

land.eng_def: to take goods or people off a ship or aircraft
land.chi_def: 使上岸；使下飛機；（從船或飛機上）卸下（貨物）
land.eg: The general's plan involved landing troops behind enemy lines.

land.eng_def: to catch a fish with a hook (= curved piece of wire) or net and remove it from the water
to get or achieve something good, especially in a way that seems easy or unexpected
land.chi_def: （尤指輕而易舉或意外地）獲得，得到，贏得
land.eg: He landed a senior editorial job.

landlady.eng_def: a woman who is paid rent by people for the use of a room, building, or piece of land that she owns
a woman who is in charge of a pub or bar
landlady.chi_def: 酒吧女老闆，酒館女老闆

landlord.eng_def: a person or organization that owns a building or an area of land and is paid by other people for the use of it
landlord.eg: The landlord had promised to redecorate the bedrooms before we moved in.

landlord.eng_def: a man who is in charge of a pub or bar

landmark.eng_def: a building or place that is easily recognized, especially one that you can use to judge where you are
landmark.eg: The Rock of Gibraltar is one of Europe's most famous landmarks.

landmark.eng_def: an important stage in something's development
landmark.eg: The invention of the silicon chip was a landmark in the history of the computer.

landscape.eng_def: a large area of countryside, especially in relation to its appearance
landscape.chi_def: 鄉間，野外；（尤指鄉村的）風景，景色

landscape.eng_def: a view or picture of the countryside, or the art of making such pictures
landscape.chi_def: 鄉村風景；鄉村風景畫；鄉村風景繪畫

landscape.eng_def: to change the appearance of an area of land, especially next to a building or road so that it looks more like natural countryside
landscape.chi_def: 給（建築物周邊）做園林美化；對（道路周邊）做景觀美化

landscape.eng_def: A landscape document is to be printed with the longer side of the paper at the top and bottom.

landslide.eng_def: a mass of rock and earth moving suddenly and quickly down a steep slope
the winning of an election with an extremely large number of votes
landslide.chi_def: （選舉中）一方選票佔壓倒性多數，大勝
landslide.eg: The opinion polls are predicting a landslide for the Republicans in next week's election.

lane.eng_def: a narrow road in the countryside or in a town
lane.chi_def: 鄉間小路；小巷，小街，胡同
lane.eg: He drives so fast along those narrow country lanes.

lane.eng_def: a special strip of a road, sports track, or swimming pool that is used to keep vehicles or competitors separate
lane.chi_def: 車道；（田徑比賽的）跑道；泳道

lane.eng_def: a route across the sea or through the air that ships or aircraft regularly sail or fly along
lane.eg: The English Channel is the busiest shipping lane in the world.

language.eng_def: a system of communication consisting of sounds, words, and grammar, or the system of communication used by people in a particular country or type of work
language.eg: She does research into how children acquire language.

lantern.eng_def: a light inside a container that has a handle for holding it or hanging it up, or the container itself

lap.eng_def: the top surface of the upper part of the legs of a person who is sitting down
lap.eg: Come and sit on my lap and I'll read you a story.

lap.eng_def: a complete trip around a race track that is repeated several times during a competition
lap.eg: He recorded the fastest lap in last weekend's Hungarian Grand Prix.

lap.eng_def: a run around a track or sports field that is made by a winner of a race or a team that has won a game
lap.chi_def: （贏得比賽勝利後的）繞場慶祝

lap.eng_def: to go past someone in a race who has been round the track one less time than you
lap.eg: He finished last after being lapped twice by the leading runners.

lap.eng_def: to make one complete trip around a track
(of an animal) to drink a liquid by taking it in small amounts into the mouth with a lot of short, quick movements of the tongue
(of waves) to hit something gently, producing quiet sounds
lap.chi_def: （波浪）輕輕地拍擊，輕輕地敲打
lap.eg: The water lapped against the side of the pool.

large.eng_def: enjoying yourself very much by dancing and drinking alcohol
large.eg: We were larging it at a club last night.

largely.chi_def: 主要地；大多；在很大程度上

laser.eng_def: (a device that produces) a powerful, narrow beam of light that can be used as a tool to cut metal, to perform medical operations, or to create patterns of light for entertainment

lash.eng_def: to hit with a lot of force
lash.eg: The prisoners were regularly lashed with electric cable.

lash.eng_def: to tie together tightly and firmly
lash.eg: I've lashed your case to the roof rack.

lash.eng_def: a thin strip of leather at the end of a whip, or a hit with this, especially as a form of punishment
lash.eg: He received 30 lashes for the crime.

lash.eng_def: a sudden, violent movement of something that can bend
lash.eg: With a powerful lash of its tail, the fish jumped out of the net and back into the river.

last.eng_def: (the person or thing) after everyone or everything else
last.eg: I hate being the last one to arrive at a meeting.
I've finished my essay at last!

last.eng_def: the least expected or wanted person or thing
last.chi_def: 最讓人想不到的人／事；最不想見的人／最不願做的事
last.eg: Three extra people to feed - that's the last thing I need!

last.eng_def: at the latest time in the day
last.eg: I'll switch on the washing machine last thing so it'll be finished when I get up in the morning.

last.eng_def: If you say that it is the last time you will do something, you mean that you will never do it again.
last.eg: He never even thanked me, so that's the last time I do him a favour.

last.eng_def: (being) the only one or part that is left
last.chi_def: 最後的，最末的；最後的一個（或一部分）
last.eg: Do you mind if I have the last chocolate?

last.eng_def: (being) the most recent or the one before the present one
last.chi_def: 上一次的；最近的；最後的
last.eg: Did you hear the storm last night (= during the previous night)?

last.eng_def: to continue being good or suitable
last.eg: There's no point buying something that isn't going to last.

late.eng_def: (happening or being) near the end of a period of time
late.chi_def: 末期的，晚期的；接近終了

late.eng_def: (happening or arriving) after the planned, expected, usual, or necessary time
in football, if a tackle is late, it is made after the ball has been moved by another player and the player, not the ball, is kicked
late.chi_def: （足球比賽中的鏟球）遲了（此時球已移動，於是被踢到的不是球而是對方隊員）
late.eg: He was booked for a late challenge in the first minute.
It was no great surprise that you were tired given the lateness of the hour.

late.eng_def: used to refer to someone who has died
late.eg: She gave her late husband's clothes to charity.

lately.eg: I haven't been feeling so well lately.

latest.eng_def: newest or most recent or modern
latest.chi_def: 最新的；最近的；最先進的
latest.eg: Have you seen her latest movie?

latest.eng_def: the most recent news or technical development
latest.chi_def: 最新消息；最新技術動態
latest.eg: Have you heard the latest (= the most recent news) about Jilly and Patrick - they're getting a divorce.

latest.eng_def: used to emphasize that something must happen or be done before a stated time or day
latest.eg: I have to get this finished by Friday at the latest.

latitude.eng_def: the position north or south of the equator measured from 0° to 90°
an area near to a particular latitude
latitude.eg: At these latitudes the sun does not rise at all on winter days.

latitude.eng_def: freedom to behave, act, or think in the way you want to
latitude.eg: Courts can show a considerable degree of latitude when it comes to applying the law.

latter.eng_def: near or towards the end of something
latter.chi_def: 後半程的，靠後的，末尾的
latter.eg: Building of the new library should begin in the latter part of next year.

latter.eng_def: the second of two people, things, or groups previously mentioned
latter.eg: She offered me more money or a car and I chose the latter.

latter.eng_def: the last of more than two people, things, or groups previously mentioned
latter.chi_def: （已提及的兩個以上的人、事物或群體中的）最後一個

laugh.eng_def: to smile while making sounds with your voice that show you think something is funny or you are happy
the act or sound of laughing

laugh.chi_def: 令人愉快的活動，好玩的活動
laugh.eg: "How was the party?" "Oh, it was a laugh."
You'd like Sharon - she's a good laugh.

laughter.eng_def: the act or sound of laughing
laughter.eg: She roared with laughter (= laughed very loudly).

launch.eng_def: an event to celebrate or introduce something new
launch.chi_def: 啓動儀式，發布會，發表會
launch.eg: How much champagne will we need for the launch?

launch.eng_def: an occasion when a ship is put into water, or a spacecraft is sent into space, for the first time
launch.chi_def: 下水（船首次出航）；發射（火箭首次升空）
launch.eg: The launch of the space shuttle was delayed for 24 hours because of bad weather.

launch.eng_def: a boat that has an engine and carries passengers for short distances, especially on a lake or a river, or from the land to a larger boat
launch.chi_def: （尤指河或湖上的）汽艇，遊艇，摩托艇

launch.eng_def: to begin something such as a plan or introduce something new such as a product
launch.eg: The programme was launched a year ago.

launch.eng_def: to send something out, such as a new ship into the water or a spacecraft into space
launch.eg: A spokesman for the dockyard said they hoped to launch the first submarine within two years.
The defender launched himself at the attacking player, bringing him to the ground.

laundry.eng_def: the dirty clothes and sheets that need to be, are being, or have been washed
laundry.chi_def: 待洗（或正在洗滌、洗完）的衣物
laundry.eg: I've got to do (= wash) my laundry.

laundry.eng_def: a business that washes clothes, sheets, etc. for customers

lava.eng_def: hot liquid rock that comes out of the earth through a volcano, or the solid rock formed when it cools
lava.chi_def: （火山噴出的）岩漿，熔岩；火山岩

law.eng_def: a rule, usually made by a government, that is used to order the way in which a society behaves
law.chi_def: 法，法律；法律制度，法律體系
law.eg: There are laws against drinking in the street.

law.eng_def: the system of rules of a particular country, group, or area of activity
law.eg: What does the law say about having alcohol in the blood while driving?

law.eng_def: the area of knowledge or work that involves studying or working with the law
law.eg: She's going to study law at university.
The law was/were out in force at the demonstration.

law.eng_def: When someone goes to law about something, they ask a court to make a legal judgment about it.
a general rule that states what always happens when the same conditions exist

lawful.eg: Judge Keenan concluded that the surveillance had been lawful.

lawmaker.eng_def: someone, such as a politician, who is responsible for making and changing laws

lawn.eng_def: an area of grass, especially near to a house or in a park, that is cut regularly to keep it short
lawn.chi_def: （尤指房屋附近或公園的）草地，草坪
lawn.eg: Will you mow the lawn at the weekend?

lawyer.eng_def: someone whose job is to give advice to people about the law and speak for them in court
lawyer.eg: I want to see my lawyer before I say anything.

lay.eng_def: to put something in especially a flat or horizontal position, usually carefully or for a particular purpose
lay.eg: She laid the baby on the bed.

lay.eng_def: to prepare a plan or a method of doing something
lay.eg: Even the best laid plans go wrong sometimes.

lay.eng_def: (of an animal or bird) to produce eggs from out of the body
lay.eg: Thousands of turtles drag themselves onto the beach and lay their eggs in the sand.

lay.chi_def: 與（某人）發生性關係，與（某人）性交
lay.eg: So did you get laid (= find someone to have sex with)?

lay.eng_def: to risk something, usually money, on the result of an event
lay.eg: She won't get the job - I'd lay money on it!

lay.eng_def: to express a claim, legal statement, etc. in a serious or official way
lay.eg: She can't accept she made a mistake and now she's trying to lay the blame on (= accuse) her assistant.

lay.eng_def: to say that you own something
lay.eg: Two companies have laid claim to the design.

lay.eng_def: not trained in or not having a detailed knowledge of a particular subject
lay.chi_def: 未經訓練的；外行的；非專業的
lay.eg: From a lay viewpoint the questionnaire is virtually incomprehensible.

lay.eng_def: having a position in a religious organization that is not a full-time job and is not paid
lay.chi_def: （尤指在教會等組織中）兼職的，客串的

lay.eng_def: used to describe how good someone is at sex, or how often they have sex
lay.eg: She's a good lay (= sex with her is enjoyable).

layer.eng_def: a level of material, such as a type of rock or gas, that is different from the material above or below it, or a thin sheet of a substance
the group of people at a particular level in an organization
layer.eg: We've cut the number of management layers from five to three.

layer.chi_def: 把…按層排列，把…分層放置
layer.eg: Layer the pasta with slices of tomato.

layer.eng_def: to cut hair so that some top parts of the hair are shorter than the hair underneath, to give it a particular style or shape
layer.eg: Can you layer it a little at the front, please?

layman.eng_def: someone who is part of a religious organization but who is not paid or specially trained
someone who is not trained in or does not have a detailed knowledge of a particular subject

layout.eng_def: the way that something is arranged
layout.eg: I like the layout of the house.

lazy.eng_def: not willing to work or use any effort
lazy.eg: Managers had complained that the workers were lazy and unreliable.
We spent a lazy day on the beach sunbathing.

lead.eng_def: to control a group of people, a country, or a situation
lead.eg: I think we've chosen the right person to lead the expedition.

lead.eng_def: (especially in sports or other competitions) to be in front, to be first, or to be winning
lead.chi_def: （尤指在比賽中）領先，位居前列
lead.eg: After 30 minutes the challengers were leading by two goals.

lead.eng_def: to cause someone to do something, especially something bad
lead.eg: The brochure led me to believe that the price included home delivery.

lead.eng_def: to show the way to a group of people, animals, vehicles, etc. by going in front of them
lead.eg: I don't know the way, so you'd better lead.

lead.eng_def: To lead a group of moving people or vehicles is to walk or drive in front of them.
lead.eg: The local youth band will lead the parade this weekend.

lead.eng_def: to take someone somewhere, by going with them
lead.eg: She led them down the hall.

lead.eng_def: to take hold of a person or animal and take him, her, or it somewhere
lead.eg: She took the child by the hand and led him upstairs to bed.

lead.eng_def: to show the way by going in front
lead.eg: You've been there before - why don't you lead the way?

lead.eng_def: to make more progress than other people in the development of something
lead.eg: The company has been leading the way in network applications for several years.

lead.eng_def: (especially of roads, paths, doors, signs, information, etc.) to go in a particular direction or have a particular result, or to allow or cause this
lead.eg: There's a track that leads directly to the reservoir.

lead.eng_def: to live a particular type of life
lead.chi_def: 過著忙碌／正常／寧靜等的生活
lead.eg: He was able to lead a normal life, despite the illness.

lead.eng_def: a winning position during a race or other situation where people are competing
lead.eg: For the first time in the race Harrison is in the lead.

lead.eng_def: the act of showing a person or group of people what to do
lead.eg: We'll go through the dance routine again - follow my lead (= do what I do).

lead.eng_def: a piece of information that allows a discovery to be made or a solution to be found
lead.eg: A lead from an informer enabled the police to make several arrests.

lead.eng_def: the main part or actor in a film or play
a wire covered in plastic and used to connect electrical equipment to the electricity supply
a piece of rope, chain, etc. tied to an animal, especially to a dog at its collar when taking it for a walk
lead.eg: Please keep your dog on a lead when on the beach.

lead.eng_def: used to describe the main performer or part in a performance
lead.eg: Who played the lead role in the movie?

lead.eng_def: a chemical element that is a very heavy, soft, dark grey, poisonous metal, used especially in the past on roofs and for pipes and also for protection against radiation
(the narrow strip of) coloured material, usually black and made of graphite, in the centre of a pencil

leader.eng_def: a person in control of a group, country, or situation
someone or something that is winning during a race or other situation where people are competing
leader.eg: He's fallen two laps behind the leaders.

leader.eng_def: the most important violin player in an orchestra

leadership.eng_def: the set of characteristics that make a good leader
leadership.eg: What the company lacks is leadership.

leadership.eng_def: the position or fact of being the leader
leadership.eg: The group flourished under her firm leadership.

leadership.eng_def: the person or people in charge of an organization
leadership.eg: There is growing discontent with the leadership.

leaf.eng_def: one of the flat, usually green parts of a plant that are joined at one end to the stem or branch
When a plant is in leaf or when it comes into leaf, it has or gets leaves on it.
leaf.eg: The trees are in leaf early this year.

leaf.eng_def: an extra part of a table that can be folded away when not being used

league.eng_def: a group of teams playing a sport who take part in competitions between each other
league.eg: Who do you think will win the league championship this year?

league.eng_def: a group of people or countries who join together because they have the same interest

leak.eng_def: (of a liquid or gas) to escape from a hole or crack in a pipe or container; (of a container) to allow liquid or gas to escape
leak.eg: Water was leaking from the pipe.

leak.eng_def: to allow secret information to become generally known
leak.eg: He leaked the names to the press.

leak.eng_def: a hole or crack through which a liquid or gas can flow out of a container, or the liquid or gas that comes out
leak.eg: There's water on the floor - we must have a leak.

leak.eng_def: the origin of secret information that becomes known, or the act of making it known
leak.eg: There have been several security leaks recently.

lean.eng_def: to (cause to) slope in one direction, or to move the top part of the body in a particular direction
lean.eg: She leaned forward and whispered something in my ear.

lean.eng_def: If a period of time is lean, there is not enough of something, especially money or food, at that time.
lean.eg: It has been a particularly lean year for the education department.

lean.eng_def: A lean company or organization does not use too many people or spend too much money, so that there is no waste.
lean.eg: Nowadays even efficient, lean, well-run industries are failing.

leap.eng_def: to make a large jump or sudden movement, usually from one place to another
leap.eg: He leaped out of his car and ran towards the house.

leap.eng_def: to provide help, protection, etc. very quickly
leap.eg: He leaped to his friend's defence.

leap.eng_def: to achieve something suddenly, usually fame, power, or importance
leap.chi_def: 一舉獲得（常指名望或權勢）
leap.eg: He leapt to fame after his appearance in a Broadway play.

leap.eng_def: to increase, improve, or grow very quickly
leap.eg: Shares in the company leaped 250 percent.

leap.eng_def: a big change, increase, or improvement
a large jump or sudden movement
leap.eg: With one leap he crossed the stream.

learn.eng_def: to get knowledge or skill in a new subject or activity
to make yourself remember a piece of writing by reading it or repeating it many times
learn.eg: I don't know how actors manage to learn all those lines.

learn.eng_def: to start to understand that you must change the way you behave
learn.eg: She'll have to learn that she can't have everything she wants.

learn.eng_def: to be told facts or information that you did not know
learn.eg: We were all shocked to learn of his death.

learned.eng_def: A learned person has studied for a long time and has a lot of knowledge.
learned.chi_def: 學識豐富的，知識淵博的

learned.eng_def: Learned behaviour has been copied from others.
learned.eg: This sort of aggression is learned behaviour.

learning.eg: His friends praised his generosity, wit, and learning.

least.eng_def: less than anything or anyone else; the smallest amount or number
least.eg: This group is the least likely of the four to win.

leather.eng_def: animal skin treated in order to preserve it, and used to make shoes, bags, clothes, equipment, etc.

leave.eng_def: to go away from someone or something, for a short time or permanently
leave.eg: I'll be leaving at five o'clock tomorrow.

leave.eng_def: to not take something or someone with you when you go, either intentionally or by accident
leave.eg: Hey, you've left your keys on the table.

leave.eng_def: If something leaves something else, a part or effect of it stays after it has gone or been used.
leave.eg: His shoes left muddy marks on the floor.

leave.eng_def: If you leave something in a particular condition, you do not touch it, move it, or act to change it in any way, so that it stays in the same condition.
leave.chi_def: 使保留；使保持（某種狀態）
leave.eg: Leave that chair where it is.

leave.eng_def: If you leave something or someone doing something, he, she, or it is still doing it when you go away.
leave.eg: I left the children watching television.

leave.eng_def: to not eat or use all of something
leave.eg: They'd eaten all the cake, but they'd left some sandwiches.

leave.eng_def: to stop doing something, or to leave a place because you have finished an activity
to end a relationship with a husband, wife, or partner and stop living with them
leave.chi_def: 結束（與丈夫、妻子或伴侶的）關係並不再同居

leave.eng_def: If you leave (doing) something, you wait before you do it.
leave.eg: I'll leave these letters till Monday (= write them on Monday).

leave.eng_def: To leave a wife, husband, or other close family member is to die while these family members are still alive.
leave.eg: He left a wife and two children.

leave.eng_def: If you leave something that you own to someone, you say they should receive it when you die.
leave.chi_def: 死後將…贈與；給（某人）留下（遺産）
leave.eg: He left his nieces all his money./He left all his money to his nieces.

leave.eng_def: to allow someone to make a choice or decision about something, or to make someone responsible for something
leave.chi_def: 讓（某人）決定；允許（某人）選擇；使（某人）對…負責
leave.eg: I left the decision (up) to her.

leave.eng_def: time allowed away from work for a holiday or illness
leave.eg: How much annual/paid leave do you get?

leave.eng_def: formal permission to be away from work or studies

leave.eg: He decided the time had come to take leave of his home town.

lecture.eng_def: a formal talk on a serious subject given to a group of people, especially students
lecture.eg: We went to a lecture on Italian art.

lecture.eng_def: an angry or serious talk given to someone in order to criticize their behaviour
lecture.eg: My dad gave me a lecture on the evils of alcohol last night.

lecture.eng_def: to give a formal talk to a group of people, often at a college or university
lecture.eg: For ten years she lectured in law.

lecture.eng_def: to talk angrily or seriously to someone in order to criticize their behaviour
lecture.eg: His parents used to lecture him on his table manners.

lecturer.eng_def: someone who teaches at a college or university

left.eng_def: on or towards the side of your body that is to the west when you are facing north
left.eg: His left eye was heavily bandaged.
First I'll introduce the speaker sitting on my left.

left.eng_def: the political groups that believe wealth and power should be shared between all parts of society
left.eg: The war is generally opposed on the left.

left.eng_def: past simple and past participle of leave
relating to political groups that believe wealth and power should be shared between all parts of society
left.eg: The left wing of the party is unhappy with the legislation.

leg.eng_def: one of the parts of the body of a human or animal that is used for standing or walking
leg.eg: My legs were tired after so much walking.

leg.eng_def: the part of a piece of clothing that you put your leg in
leg.eg: He rolled up his trouser legs and waded into the water.

leg.eng_def: one of the thin vertical parts that support an object
a particular stage of a journey, competition, or activity
leg.eg: He has tickets for the first leg of the NCAA Men's Hockey Championship.

leg.eng_def: to run away in order to escape from something
leg.eg: They legged it round the corner when they saw the police coming.

legal.chi_def: 法律的，法律上的，法律方面的

legal.eg: Is abortion legal in your country?

legal.eng_def: used to refer to a standard size of paper in the US, 8.5 inches by 14 inches
legal.chi_def: 法律規格紙（在美國使用的一種紙張大小的標準，長14英寸，寬8.5英寸）
legal.eg: Your poster should be on letter or legal size paper.

legend.eng_def: a very old story or set of stories from ancient times, or the stories, not always true, that people tell about a famous event or person
legend.chi_def: 傳說，傳奇故事；民間故事
legend.eg: The dance was based on several Hindu legends.

legend.eng_def: someone very famous and admired, usually because of their ability in a particular area
legend.eg: Jazz legend Ella Fitzgerald once sang in this bar.

legend.eng_def: the words written on or next to a picture, map, coin, etc. that explain what it is about or what the symbols on it mean
legend.chi_def: （對圖畫、地圖、硬幣等的）說明，圖例

legendary.eng_def: very famous and admired or spoken about
legendary.chi_def: 名聲顯赫的；津津樂道的
legendary.eg: He became editor of the legendary Irish journal "The Bell".

legislation.eng_def: a law or set of laws suggested by a government and made official by a parliament
legislation.eg: The government has promised to introduce legislation to limit fuel emissions from cars.

legislative.eng_def: relating to laws or the making of laws
legislative.eg: The European Parliament will have greater legislative powers (= ability to make laws).

legislator.eng_def: a member of a group of people who together have the power to make laws

legislature.eng_def: the group of people in a country or part of a country who have the power to make and change laws

legitimate.chi_def: 合法的，正當的，法律允許的
legitimate.eg: The army must give power back to the legitimate government.

legitimate.chi_def: 合理的，可接受的，得到認可的
legitimate.eg: He claimed that the restaurant bill was a legitimate business expense.

legitimate.eng_def: A legitimate child is one whose parents are legally married at the time of his or her birth.
to make something legal or acceptable
legitimate.eg: The government fears that talking to terrorists might legitimate their violent actions.

leisure.eng_def: the time when you are not working or doing other duties

leisurely.eng_def: used to describe an action that is done in a relaxed way, without hurrying
leisurely.eg: We enjoyed a leisurely picnic lunch on the lawn.

lemon.eng_def: an oval fruit that has a thick, yellow skin and sour juice
lemon.eg: For this recipe you need the juice of two lemons.

lemon.eng_def: the juice of a lemon or a drink made from this juice

lemon.chi_def: 有毛病的東西；不成功的東西
lemon.eg: Only one of his inventions turned out to be a lemon.
I felt such a lemon when I discovered I'd missed my appointment.

lemonade.eng_def: a drink made with the juice of lemons, water, and sugar
a cold, sweet fizzy drink (= one with bubbles) with a lemon flavour

lend.eng_def: to give something to someone for a short period of time, expecting it to be given back
lend.eg: She doesn't like lending her books.

lend.eng_def: If a bank or other organization lends money, it gives money to someone who agrees that they will pay the money back in the future, usually with extra money added to the original amount.
lend.eg: The bank refuses to lend to students.

lend.eng_def: If something lends a particular quality to something else, it adds that quality to it.
lend.eg: Vases of flowers all around the room lent the place a cheerful look/lent a cheerful look to the place.

lend.eng_def: If something lends itself to something else, it is suitable for that thing or can be considered in that way.
lend.eg: The novel's complex, imaginative style does not lend itself to translation.

length.eng_def: the measurement of something from end to end or along its longest side
length.eg: The boat is ten metres in length.

length.eng_def: a piece of something such as string or pipe
a unit used in describing the distance by which a horse or boat wins a race, equal to the measurement from one end of the horse or boat to the other
the distance from one end of a swimming pool to the other
the amount of time something lasts
the amount of writing in a book or document
length.eg: He's written books of various lengths on the subject.
George went on at great length about his various illnesses.

length.eng_def: If something happens at length, it happens after a long period of time.
length.eg: At length, the authorities allowed her to go home.

length.eng_def: long enough to reach the stated place
of the stated amount of time
length.eg: a full-length movie (= one which has not been shortened)

lengthen.eng_def: to make something longer, or to become longer
lengthen.eg: I'll have to lengthen this skirt.

lengthen.eng_def: If you lengthen something, or it lengthens, it takes longer to happen.
lengthen.eg: There is a plan to lengthen the three-year course to four years.

lens.eng_def: a curved piece of glass, plastic, or other transparent material, used in cameras, glasses, and scientific equipment, that makes objects seem closer, larger, smaller, etc.
lens.eg: a camera with a zoom lens

lens.eng_def: the part of the eye behind the pupil (= the black hole at the front of the eye) that helps you to see clearly by focusing (= collecting) light onto the retina

leopard.eng_def: a large wild cat that has yellow fur with black spots on it and lives in Africa and southern Asia

less.eng_def: a smaller amount (of), or to a smaller degree
less.eg: We must try to spend less money.

less.eng_def: used to say that behaviour does not have the good or attractive characteristic that is stated
less.eg: I think he was less than honest with me.

less.eng_def: If something happens less and less, it becomes gradually smaller in amount or happens less often.
less.eg: He's less and less able to look after himself.
The total is 30 dollars, less the five dollars deposit that you paid.

less.eng_def: used to form adjectives meaning "without (the thing mentioned)"

lessen.eng_def: If something lessens or is lessened, it becomes less strong.
lessen.eg: A healthy diet can lessen the risk of heart disease.

lesson.eng_def: a period of time in which a person is taught about a subject or how to do something
lesson.eg: How can we make science lessons more interesting?

lesson.eng_def: an experience that teaches you how to behave better in a similar situation in the future
lesson.eg: There is a lesson for all parents in this tragic accident.

lest.eng_def: in order to prevent any possibility that something will happen
lest.eg: They were afraid to complain about the noise lest they annoyed the neighbours.

let.eng_def: to allow something to happen or someone to do something by not doing anything to stop an action or by giving your permission
let.eg: She wanted to go but her parents wouldn't let her.

let.eng_def: used to show that you accept what is going to happen, although you do not like it
let.eg: Let it rain - it won't spoil our afternoon.

let.eng_def: used to say that you wish something to happen very much
let.eg: Oh, please let him get the job!

let.eng_def: used to express a suggestion or request that includes you and the other person or people
to allow your house or land to be lived in or used by someone else in exchange for a regular payment
let.eg: They are letting their house (out) for the summer.

let.eng_def: used after a negative statement to emphasize how unlikely a situation is because something much more likely has never happened
let.chi_def: （用於否定句後表示強調）當然不會，更不用說
let.eg: Some people never even read a newspaper, let alone a book.

let.eng_def: (in tennis or similar games) a situation in which the ball touches the net as it crosses it, so that you have to play the point again
let.chi_def: （網球等運動專案的）發球擦網，發球觸網

let.eng_def: without being prevented from doing something
let.eg: People will be able to travel from country to country without let or hindrance.

let.eng_def: the act of allowing someone to use your house, land, etc. in exchange for regular payments
let.eg: a five-year let on a flat

letter.eng_def: a written message from one person to another, usually put in an envelope and sent by post
letter.eg: I got a letter from the bank this morning.

letter.eng_def: any of the set of symbols used to write a language, representing a sound in the language
the exact words of the law and not its more important general meaning
used to refer to a standard size of paper in the US, 8.5 inches by 11 inches
letter.chi_def: （美國）標準信紙（長11英寸，寬8.5英寸）
letter.eg: Fliers are usually printed either on letter size or legal size paper.

lettuce.eng_def: a plant with large, green leaves, eaten uncooked in salads

level.eg: The water level in the lake is much higher after heavy rain.

level.eng_def: the amount or number of something
level.eg: Inflation is going to rise two percent from its present level.

level.eng_def: someone's ability compared to other people
level.chi_def: （與他人相比的）能力，水準，級別
level.eg: a class for advanced level students

level.eng_def: a floor in a large building
level.eg: The library has three levels, with a conference centre at ground level.

level.eng_def: a position within a system in which people are arranged according to their importance
level.eg: These are subjects for discussion at management level.

level.eng_def: relating to a particular area of the country/the whole of the country
level.eg: These sorts of policies are made at local level.

level.eng_def: a tool that contains a tube of liquid with an air bubble in it, used to show if a surface is level

level.eg: The top of the tree is level with his bedroom window.
Make sure the camera is level before you take the picture.

level.eng_def: an amount of a liquid or substance that fills a spoon/cup but does not go above the edges, used as a measure in cooking
level.chi_def: （烹飪時用於計量的）一平勺／杯的量

level.eng_def: having the same value, amount, number of points, etc.
level.eg: Pieretti would have to win the next three stages in order to draw level with (= reach the same position as) Le Sage in the Tour de France.

level.eng_def: If you speak in a level voice or give someone a level look, you do it in a calm and controlled way.
level.chi_def: （說話聲或目光）平靜的，平穩的
level.eg: In a level voice, he ordered the soldiers to aim and fire.
Level the wet cement before it sets.

level.eng_def: to completely destroy a building or area

liable.eng_def: having (legal) responsibility for something or someone
liable.chi_def: 承擔責任的；負有（法律）責任的
liable.eg: The law holds parents liable if a child does not attend school.

liable.chi_def: 很可能會發生的，可能性很大的
liable.eg: The areas of town near the river are liable to flooding (= are often flooded).

liar.eg: He's such a liar - you can't trust a word he says.

liberal.eng_def: respecting and allowing many different types of beliefs or behaviour
liberal.chi_def: 自由開放的，開放的，開明的

liberal.eng_def: (of a political party or a country) believing in or allowing more personal freedom and development towards a fairer sharing of wealth and power within society
liberal.chi_def: （指政黨或國家）自由的，開放的

liberal.eng_def: giving or given in a generous way
liberal.chi_def: 慷慨的，大方的，毫不吝嗇的
liberal.eg: He was very liberal with the wine.

liberal.eng_def: not exact; without attention to or interest in detail
liberal.chi_def: 不確切的，模糊的，籠統的
liberal.eg: a liberal interpretation of the law

liberal.eng_def: someone who respects many different types of beliefs or behaviour

liberate.eng_def: to help someone or something to be free
liberate.eg: They said they sent troops in to liberate the people/the country from a dictator.
She liberated those spoons from a restaurant last week.

liberation.eng_def: an occasion when something or someone is released or made free
liberation.eg: the liberation of France from Nazi occupation

liberation.eng_def: used to refer to activities connected with removing the disadvantages experienced by particular groups within society

liberty.eng_def: the freedom to live as you wish or go where you want
liberty.eg: For most citizens, liberty means the freedom to practise their religious or political beliefs.

liberty.eng_def: to be allowed to do something
liberty.eg: I'm not at liberty to reveal any names.

liberty.eng_def: freedom to live as you wish or go where you want
liberty.eg: These laws will restrict our ancient rights and liberties.

liberty.eng_def: an example of speech or behaviour that upsets other people because it shows little respect or does not follow what is thought to be polite or acceptable
liberty.eg: What a liberty, to refuse the invitation on your behalf, without even asking you!

liberty.eng_def: to change something, especially a piece of writing, in a way that people disagree with
to be too friendly with someone, usually in a sexual way
liberty.chi_def: （對某人）過分親昵，過分親熱；調戲
liberty.eg: Some of the younger women complained that he'd been taking liberties with them.

librarian.eng_def: a person who works in a library
librarian.chi_def: 圖書管理員，圖書館館員

library.eng_def: a building, room, or organization that has a collection, especially of books, for people to read or borrow, usually without payment
a collection or set of books or other things, all produced in the same style or about the same subject

license.eng_def: to give someone official permission to do or have something
license.eg: Several companies have been licensed to sell these products.

lick.eng_def: to move the tongue across the surface of something
lick.eg: He licked the chocolate off his fingers.

lick.eng_def: If flames or waves lick something, they pass over it quickly or touch it lightly like a tongue.
lick.chi_def: （火焰）蔓延，掠過，吞捲；（波浪）拍擊，沖刷
lick.eg: Within a few seconds flames were licking at the curtains.

lick.eng_def: to defeat easily in a competition, fight, etc.
lick.chi_def: （在競賽、爭鬥等中）輕易打敗，輕取

lick.eng_def: the act of hitting someone with something such as a whip

lick.eg: The trains go by at a hell of a lick.

lick.eng_def: a small amount or thin layer
lick.eg: The living room could do with a lick of paint.

lick.eng_def: in jazz or rock music, a short series of notes played by one musician
lick.chi_def: （爵士樂或搖滾樂中的）小過門

lick.eg: Can I have a lick of your ice cream?

lid.eng_def: a cover on a container, that can be lifted up or removed
lid.eg: Can you get the lid off this jar?

lid.eng_def: an  eyelid  (= either of the two pieces of skin that can close over each eye)
lid.eg: She looked at him from under half-closed lids.

lie.eng_def: to be in or move into a horizontal position on a surface
If something lies in a particular place, position, or direction, it is in that place, position, or direction.
lie.eg: There's an old pair of shoes of yours lying at/in the bottom of the wardrobe.
The hardest part of the competition still lies ahead of us.

lie.eng_def: If responsibility, blame, a decision, a choice, etc. lies with someone, they have responsibility, must make the decision, etc.
lie.eg: Responsibility for the disaster must ultimately lie with the government.

lie.eng_def: When the dead body of an important person lies in state, it is arranged so that the public can see and honour it before it is buried.
lie.chi_def: （重要人物的遺體埋葬前經整容後）供公衆瞻仰

lie.eng_def: to say or write something that is not true in order to deceive someone
something you say that you know is not true
lie.eg: I told a lie when I said I liked her haircut.

lieutenant.eng_def: (the title of) an officer of middle rank in the armed forces

life.eng_def: the period between birth and death, or the experience or state of being alive
life.chi_def: 壽命；生命；一生，人生；生活；性命
life.eg: Life's too short to worry about money!

life.eng_def: a way of living or a particular part of someone's life
life.chi_def: 生活方式；生活（的某一部分）

life.eng_def: the period for which a machine or organization lasts
life.eg: The newer batteries have a much longer life.

life.eng_def: the quality that makes people, animals, and plants different from objects, substances, and things that are dead
life.eg: The doctor could find no sign of life in the old man's body.

life.eng_def: In art, if you work from life, you paint, draw, etc. real people or objects, usually while they are in front of you rather than from memory.
especially in children's games, one of the limited number of times that you can lose, but still continue playing
life.chi_def: （尤指兒童遊戲中的）一次機會；命
life.eg: Every time the little man gets hit, you lose a life.

life.eng_def: to make something more real or exciting
life.eg: It's always been an interesting period in history and this film really brought it to life.

life.eng_def: to become more real or exciting
life.chi_def: 使更加實在；使更有生機
life.eg: The game really came to life in the second half.

life.eng_def: for the whole of a person's life
life.eg: I believe marriage is for life.

life.eng_def: to be willing to die in order to defend or support someone or something
life.eg: They were ready to give their lives for their country.

life.eng_def: If you believe in life after death, you believe that people continue to exist in some form after they die.
to completely change how or where you live
life.eg: She decided to start a new life in Australia.

lifeboat.eng_def: a large boat that is kept ready to go out and save people who are in danger in the water
lifeboat.chi_def: （用於救援生命有危險的人的）救生船，救生筏

lifeboat.eng_def: a small boat kept on a ship for people to leave in if the ship is not safe or might sink
lifeboat.chi_def: （配在船上供逃生用的）救生船，救生筏

lifeguard.eng_def: a person on a beach or at a swimming pool whose job is to make certain that the swimmers are safe and save them if they are in danger

lifelong.eng_def: lasting for the whole of a person's life
lifelong.chi_def: 終生的，終身的；一輩子的
lifelong.eg: She was a lifelong member of the Labour party.

lifetime.eng_def: the period of time during which someone lives or something exists
lifetime.eg: We'll see a tremendous lot of technological changes during/in our lifetime.

lift.eng_def: to move something from a lower to a higher position
lift.eg: Could you help me lift this table, please?

lift.eng_def: to win a race or competition in which the prize is a metal cup
lift.eg: He is the hot favourite to lift the cup again next month.

lift.eng_def: to dig underground vegetables or plants out of the ground
lift.chi_def: 把（蔬菜或植物）挖出來，刨出，拔出

lift.eng_def: to take hold of and raise something in order to remove, carry, or move it to a different position
lift.eg: She lifted the baby out of her chair.

lift.eng_def: to make your voice louder, especially when performing
to make something more interesting or enjoyable
lift.chi_def: 使更有趣；增加…的趣味性
lift.eg: The article is informative enough, but it's a little dull - we need something to lift it.
Nothing - not even the prospect of dinner - could lift his spirits.

lift.eng_def: (of mist or fog) to go away until none is left
lift.eg: The morning mist had lifted and the sun was starting to come through.

lift.eng_def: to end a rule or law
lift.eg: The restrictions on water usage have been lifted now that the river levels are normal.

lift.eng_def: to use someone else's writing, music, or idea, pretending that it is your own
lift.eg: He'd lifted whole passages from a website.

lift.eng_def: a device like a box that moves up and down, carrying people or goods from one floor of a building to another or taking people up and down underground in a mine
lift.eg: Take the lift to the sixth floor.

lift.eng_def: an act of lifting or raising something
lift.eg: Give it one more lift and we'll have it at the top of the stairs.

lift.eng_def: the force on the wing of a bird or aircraft that keeps it in the air as it moves forward
a free journey in another person's vehicle, especially a car
lift.eg: I'll give you a lift to the train station if you like.
She'd been feeling low but hearing that she'd got the job gave her a lift.

light.eng_def: the brightness that comes from the sun, fire, etc. and from electrical devices, and that allows things to be seen
a piece of equipment that produces light, such as a lamp or a bulb
light.eg: Could you switch/turn the light on/off, please?

light.eng_def: something that will produce a flame and cause burning, such as a match or a cigarette lighter
light.eg: Have you got a light, please?

light.eng_def: to cause something to start burning
light.eg: The lamp caught fire and set light to the curtains.

light.eng_def: not weighing a lot
light.eg: Here, take this bag - it's quite light.

light.eng_def: Light clothes are made of thin material that allows you to be cool.
lit by the natural light of the day
light.eg: The big windows make the room feel wonderfully light and airy.

light.eng_def: (of colours) pale
entertaining and easily understood, but not serious and not intended to make you think
light.eg: I want some light reading for the summer holidays - a romance or something.

light.eng_def: to behave as if a situation, especially a problem, is not serious or important
light.eg: It is easy to make light of other people's problems.

light.eng_def: not great in strength or amount
someone who eats/drinks/smokes only a little
someone who is easily woken up by noise, etc.
A light meal is small and easy to digest.
light.eg: I don't eat much for lunch - just a light snack.

light.eng_def: used to describe alcoholic drinks that are not strong in flavour
light.chi_def: 酒精飲料度數低的，低度的
light.eg: It's described on the label as "light, fruity wine".

light.eng_def: needing only a very small amount of effort
A light sentence in prison is a short one.
light.eg: He got off with a fairly light sentence because it was his first conviction.

light.eng_def: to do something quickly and easily
light.eg: Heather made light work of painting the walls.

light.eng_def: to start to burn or to make something start to burn
to produce light that makes an object or area bright or easy to see
light.eg: The stage had been lit with candles.

lighten.eg: The sky had lightened and there were breaks in the clouds.

lighten.eng_def: to make a difficult situation or responsibility easier
lighten.chi_def: 減輕（某人的）負擔／壓力（等等）
lighten.eg: Getting a new assistant will lighten (= reduce) the workload considerably.
The sun always lightens my hair.

lighten.eng_def: to (cause to) become happier and less worried
lighten.eg: His mood lightened after the phone call.

lighthouse.eng_def: a tall building near the coast or shore with a flashing light at the top to warn ships of rocks and other dangers

lightning.eng_def: a flash of bright light in the sky that is produced by electricity moving between clouds or from clouds to the ground

like.eng_def: to enjoy or approve of something or someone
to show that you think something is good on a social networking website by clicking on a symbol or the word 'like'
used to say politely that you want something
like.eg: I think I'd like the soup for my starter.
I'd like one of the round loaves, please.

like.eng_def: similar to; in the same way or manner as

like.eg: It looks like I'm going to be in the office until late tonight.

like.chi_def: 為…所特有的，符合…特點的
like.eg: That's just like Maisie to turn up half an hour late to her own party!
She looks best in bright, vibrant colours, like red and pink.

like.eng_def: used before you describe how you were feeling or what you said when something happened to you
like.chi_def: （用於引出自己對已發生事件的感覺或想法）
like.eg: Then I saw how late it was and I'm like, so upset.

like.eng_def: used in conversation as a pause or to emphasize an adjective
like.chi_def: （用於對話中表示停頓或強調形容詞）
like.eg: He's, like, really friendly - someone you can talk to.

like.eng_def: a person, thing, or group similar in character or quality to the one mentioned
like.eg: Boxing hasn't seen the likes of Muhammad Ali since he retired.
There's a big sports hall for tennis and badminton and such like.
The star lists his likes as "my new Porsche, my girlfriend, and staying up all night."

like.eng_def: not for the type of people mentioned
like.chi_def: 不是為…之類的人準備的
like.eg: First-class travel is for rich people - it's not for the likes of us.

like.eng_def: (on a page on a social networking website) an act of showing that you think something is good by clicking a button
like.eg: My new profile picture got 100 likes.

like.eng_def: to be likely to do something

like.eg: The paper criticized what it described as the animal-like behaviour of the fans.

likelihood.eng_def: the chance that something will happen
likelihood.eg: This latest dispute greatly increases the likelihood of a strike.
In all likelihood everything will go to plan.

likely.eng_def: If something is likely, it will probably happen or is expected.
likely.chi_def: 很可能的，可能要發生的
likely.eg: Do remind me because I'm likely to forget.
As likely as not, she'll end up in court over this problem.
Most likely he'll turn up late.
"Do you want to come running with me?" "Not likely!"

likewise.eg: Just water these plants twice a week, and likewise the ones in the bedroom.

lily.eng_def: any of various plants with a large, bell-shaped flower on a long stem

limb.eng_def: an arm or leg of a person or animal
limb.eg: The accident victims mostly had injuries to their lower limbs (= legs).

limb.eng_def: a large branch of a tree
limb.eg: An 18-year-old student at California State University died yesterday when she was struck by a falling limb from a large oak tree.

lime.eng_def: a round fruit containing a lot of juice that is sour like a lemon but smaller and green, or the small tree on which this fruit grows
a large tree with leaves shaped like a heart and pale yellow flowers
a white substance that is used especially to spread on the land to improve the quality of earth so that crops grow better
white material that collects inside water pipes, kettles, etc. in areas where the water is hard (= contains a lot of natural chemicals)
to spread the substance lime on a piece of land

limit.eng_def: the greatest amount, number, or level of something that is either possible or allowed
limit.eg: Is there a limit on the amount of money you can claim?

limit.eng_def: the amount of something that is enough and not too much
something that is very annoying or not convenient
limit.chi_def: 忍耐的限度，容忍的極限
limit.eg: And now you're cutting your toenails in bed! That really is the limit!

limit.eng_def: the largest amount of alcohol that is legally allowed to be present in the blood while a person is driving a vehicle
limit.chi_def: （法律規定的開車時血液中酒精含量的）最高限量
limit.eg: She was definitely driving over the limit.
I'd like to play squash, but I'm 60 and I know my limits.

limit.eng_def: to control something so that it is not greater than a particular amount, number, or level
limit.eg: I've been asked to limit my speech to ten minutes maximum.

limitation.eng_def: the act of controlling and especially reducing something
If someone or something has limitations, that person or thing is not as good as he, she, or it could be.
limitation.eg: Living in an apartment is fine, but it does have its limitations - for example, you don't have your own garden.

limo.eng_def: a large, expensive car, often driven by a chauffeur (= a person employed to drive a car for someone else)
limo.chi_def: （通常有專職司機的）大型豪華轎車

limo.eng_def: a small bus to take people to and from an airport
limo.chi_def: （往返機場接客的）中型客車；機場班車

limousine.eng_def: a large, expensive car, often driven by a chauffeur (= a person employed to drive a car for someone else)
limousine.chi_def: （通常有專職司機的）大型豪華轎車

limousine.eng_def: a small bus to take people to and from an airport
limousine.chi_def: （往返機場接客的）中型客車；機場班車

limp.eng_def: to walk slowly and with difficulty because of having an injured or painful leg or foot
limp.eg: Three minutes into the game, Jackson limped off the pitch with a serious ankle injury.

limp.eng_def: to move or develop slowly and with difficulty
limp.eg: The little boat limped slowly towards the shore.

limp.eng_def: soft and neither firm nor stiff
a way of walking slowly and with difficulty because of having an injured or painful leg or foot
limp.chi_def: （因為腿腳受傷或疼痛）艱難緩慢的行走

line.eng_def: a long, thin mark on the surface of something
line.eg: a straight line

line.eng_def: a group of people or things arranged in a row
line.eg: a line of trees

line.eng_def: a group of people standing one behind the other who are waiting for something
line.chi_def: （一群人排列等候所形成的）隊，排
line.eg: Just get in line and wait your turn like everyone else.

line.eng_def: a series of people or things that follow each other in time
line.eg: She is the latest in a long line of controversial leaders.

line.eng_def: a long, thin and sometimes imaginary mark that forms the edge, border, or limit of something
line.eg: That ball was definitely in! It was nowhere near the line!

line.eng_def: a connection to a phone system
line.eg: I'm afraid your line's been disconnected because your last bill hasn't been paid.

line.eng_def: (the route followed by) a railway track
line.eg: The train was delayed, apparently due to leaves on the line.

line.eng_def: a way of dealing with or thinking about something or someone
line.eg: The government's official line has always been to refuse to negotiate with terrorists.

line.eng_def: a way of thinking about a particular subject
line.eg: We cannot agree with their line of reasoning.

line.eng_def: a row of positions used to defend against enemy attack, especially the ones closest to enemy positions
line.eg: They were taken prisoner while on a reconnaissance mission behind enemy lines.

line.eng_def: the shape of something that has been designed or created
line.chi_def: （設計或創造出的）輪廓，外形線條
line.eg: They have a reputation for designing cars with elegant aerodynamic lines.

line.eng_def: a long, strong, thin piece of material, such as string, rope, or wire, used to support something
line.eg: I'd hung the washing out on the clothes line.

line.eng_def: a company that transports people or goods
line.eg: a shipping line

line.eng_def: a remark that is intended to entertain, persuade, or deceive
line.chi_def: （為達到逗樂、勸說或欺騙目的而說的）話語，詞句，言語
line.eg: a speech full of memorable lines

line.eng_def: a row of words that form part of a text
line.eg: We could get more lines on the page if we reduced the type size.

line.eng_def: the words that an actor speaks when performing in a film, play, etc.
line.eg: I only had two lines in the whole play.

line.eng_def: a punishment for school students in which a sentence has to be written repeatedly
line.chi_def: （學校裡對學生作出的）罰抄寫
line.eg: She got 200 lines for swearing at her teacher.

line.eng_def: a short series of musical notes
the type of job someone does
line.eg: "What line of work are you in?" "I'm a teacher."

line.eng_def: a range of similar things that are for sale
line.eg: There are discounts on many items from our older lines.

line.eng_def: to form a row along the side of something
line.eg: Thousands of people lined the streets to watch the presidential procession pass by.

line.eng_def: to cover the inside surface of something
line.eg: I lined the drawers with old wallpaper.

linen.eng_def: strong cloth made from the fibres of the flax plant
sheets, tablecloths, etc. made from linen or a similar material
linen.chi_def: （桌布、床單等）亞麻製品；仿亞麻製品

liner.eng_def: a large ship for carrying passengers in great comfort on long journeys

linger.eng_def: to take a long time to leave or disappear
linger.eg: After the play had finished, we lingered for a while in the bar hoping to catch sight of the actors.

linguist.eng_def: someone who studies foreign languages or can speak them very well, or someone who teaches or studies linguistics
linguist.chi_def: 語言學家，語言學者；通曉數國語言的人

link.eng_def: a connection between two people, things, or ideas
link.eg: There's a direct link between diet and heart disease.

link.eng_def: a connection between documents on the internet
link.eg: Click on this link to visit our online bookstore.

link.eng_def: one of the rings in a chain
to make a connection between two or more people, things, or ideas
link.eg: The explosions are not thought to be linked in any way.

lion.eng_def: a large wild animal of the cat family with yellowish-brown fur that lives in Africa and southern Asia
someone who is important, successful, or powerful

lip.eng_def: one of the two soft, red edges of the mouth
lip.eg: She kissed me on the lips.

lip.eng_def: a part of an edge of a container that is shaped to allow liquid to be poured easily from the container
the act of arguing with someone in a way that is rude or does not show enough respect
lip.eg: That's enough of your lip, young lady!

lipstick.eng_def: a coloured substance that women put on their lips to make them more attractive

liquid.eng_def: a substance, such as water, that is not solid or a gas and that can be poured easily
liquid.eg: Mercury is a liquid at room temperature.

liquid.eng_def: in the form of money, rather than investments or property, or able to be changed into money easily
liquid.chi_def: 現金的；易變現的，流動的
liquid.eg: She has very few liquid assets as most of her wealth is tied up in property.

liquid.eng_def: in the form of a liquid

liquid crystal display.eng_def: a screen for showing text or pictures that uses a liquid that becomes dark when an electric current flows across it

list.eng_def: a record of short pieces of information, such as people's names, usually written or printed with a single thing on each line and often ordered in a way that makes a particular thing easy to find
If a ship has a list, it leans to one side.
to make a list, or to include something in a list
list.chi_def: 將…列成單子；把…列入名單
list.eg: I've listed some useful reading material on the handout.

list.eng_def: (of a ship) to lean to one side, especially as a result of damage
list.chi_def: （尤指船因遭到損害向一側）傾斜，歪斜
list.eg: The tanker is listing badly and liable to sink at any moment.

list.eng_def: to make a company's shares available on a particular financial market
list.eg: Last year, eight new companies were listed on the Lahore stock exchange.

listen.eng_def: to give attention to someone or something in order to hear him, her, or it
listen.eg: What kind of music do you listen to?

listener.eg: We've received a lot of complaints about the changes from regular listeners to the programme.

literacy.eng_def: the ability to read and write
literacy.eg: Far more resources are needed to improve adult literacy.

literacy.eng_def: knowledge of a particular subject, or a particular type of knowledge
literacy.chi_def: （某領域或某方面的）知識，能力
literacy.eg: Computer literacy is becoming as essential as the ability to drive a car.

literal.eng_def: The literal meaning of a word is its original, basic meaning.
literal.eg: The literal meaning of "television" is "seeing from a distance".

literal.eng_def: A literal translation of a text is done by translating each word separately, without looking at how the words are used together in a phrase or sentence.
literal.eg: Her translation is too literal, resulting in unnatural-sounding prose.

literate.eng_def: having knowledge of a particular subject, or a particular type of knowledge
literate.chi_def: 掌握（某個領域或某方面）知識的；通曉…的

literature.eng_def: written artistic works, especially those with a high and lasting artistic value
literature.chi_def: 文學；（尤指有傳世價值的）文學作品

literature.eng_def: all the information relating to a subject, especially information written by experts
literature.eg: It's important to keep up-to-date with the literature in your field.

literature.eng_def: printed material published by a company that is intended to encourage people to buy that company's products or services; material that an organization publishes in order to persuade people to agree with its opinions
literature.chi_def: （公司的）宣傳資料，産品簡介，服務專案介紹
literature.eg: Could you send me your literature on/about car insurance policies, please?
