litter.eng_def: small pieces of rubbish that have been left lying on the ground in public places
litter.chi_def: （散落在公共場所的）小塊垃圾，廢棄物
litter.eg: About two percent of fast-food packaging ends up as litter.

litter.eng_def: a group of animals that are born at the same time and have the same mother
dried grass or plant stems used by animals as a bed
a substance that is put in a container to be used as a toilet by pets
to spread across an area or place untidily
litter.eg: The park was littered with bottles and cans after the concert.

litter.eng_def: A place, document, or other object that is littered with something has or contains a lot of that thing.
litter.eg: The newspaper has a reputation for being littered with spelling mistakes.

litter.eng_def: to drop rubbish on the ground in a public place
litter.eg: People who litter often have no pride in the area.

little.eg: It came in a little box.

little.eng_def: a small amount of food or drink
little.eg: I always like to have a little something around eleven o'clock in the morning.

little.eng_def: a present that is not of great value
little.eg: I want to buy a little something to give to Val when I visit her in hospital.
When you were little your hair was really curly.

little.eng_def: used to emphasize an opinion that is being given about something or someone
little.chi_def: （用於強調對某人或某物的意見）真，確實
little.eg: That was a nice little suit she was wearing.

little.chi_def: 不太重要的，不很嚴重的；微小的，輕微的
little.eg: I had a little problem with my car, but it's been fixed now.
There seems little hope of a ceasefire.
This sauce needs a little salt.
I could only hear a little of what they were saying.

little.eng_def: an amount that is not much or not enough
little.eg: We did very little on Sunday.
I was a little bit worried by what she said.

little.chi_def: 一點一點地，逐漸地，漸漸地
little.eg: Little by little she came to understand why he had behaved the way he did.
She slept very little that night.
The wine they gave us was little better than vinegar.

live.eng_def: (to continue) to be alive or have life
live.eg: He only lived a few days after the accident.

live.eng_def: to be kept usually in a particular place
live.eg: Where do the knives live in your kitchen?

live.eng_def: to spend your life in a particular way
live.eg: After a while you get used to living alone.

live.eng_def: to stay alive, especially by getting enough money to pay for food, a place to stay, clothing, etc.
live.eg: For several years she lived by begging.

live.eng_def: (of things that are not alive) to exist or continue to exist
live.chi_def: （指逝去的事物）繼續存在，留存
live.eg: The memory of those terrible days lives on.

live.chi_def: 享受生活的樂趣，盡情地享受生活
live.eg: I want to live a little before I settle down.
Millions of live animals are shipped around the world each year.

live.eng_def: (of a performance) broadcast, recorded, or seen while it is happening
live.chi_def: 現場直播的，實況轉播的
live.eg: This evening there will be a live broadcast of the debate.

live.eng_def: (of a wire) carrying or charged with electricity
(of a fire, coals, or a match) still burning or able to burn
live.chi_def: （火、煤炭或火柴）燃燒的，可燃的
live.eg: There are live coals in the fireplace.

live.eng_def: broadcast as it happens; performing or being performed in front of an audience
live.eg: I've got two tickets to see them (perform) live.

live.eng_def: If a new system, especially a computer system, goes live, it starts to operate.
live.chi_def: （新系統，尤指電腦系統）開始運行；開始工作
live.eg: Our new payments system will go live at the beginning of next month.

lively.eng_def: full of energy and enthusiasm; interesting and exciting
lively.chi_def: 精力充沛的；生氣勃勃的；活躍的
lively.eg: It's hard work teaching a class of lively children.
The room was painted a lively electric blue.

liver.eng_def: a large organ in the body that cleans the blood and produces bile, or this organ from an animal used as meat

livestock.eng_def: animals and birds that are kept on a farm, such as cows, sheep, or chickens

lizard.eng_def: a small reptile that has a long body, four short legs, a long tail, and thick skin

load.eng_def: the amount of weight carried, especially by a vehicle, a structure such as a bridge, or an animal
load.chi_def: （尤指車輛、橋樑、動物等的）負重，負荷，載重
load.eg: The maximum load for this elevator is eight persons.
I've got a load of work to get through before tomorrow.

load.eng_def: the amount of electrical power that is supplied
the amount of work to be done by a person
load.eg: If we share the organization of the party, that will help spread the load.

load.eng_def: a painful, difficult, or tiring situation to deal with
load.eg: I wish I could do something to lighten your load (= make your situation easier).

load.eng_def: to put a lot of things into a vehicle or machine
load.eg: How long will it take to load this sand onto the lorry?

load.eng_def: to have too much to carry, or too much work to do
load.chi_def: 承受太多的（重量或工作），負擔的（重量或工作）太多
load.eg: I was loaded down with shopping.

load.eng_def: to contain a lot of something
load.eg: Most fast foods are loaded with fat.

load.eng_def: to put film in a camera or bullets in a gun
load.eg: Do not load the film (= put it into the camera) in bright light.

load.eng_def: to put information or a program onto a computer
load.chi_def: 把資訊輸入電腦；把程式載入電腦
load.eg: You need to load this program onto your computer.

load.eng_def: all the people or goods in the stated type of vehicle or container
load.chi_def: （指車輛或容器的裝載量）滿…的，一…的

loaf.eng_def: bread that is shaped and baked in a single piece and can be sliced for eating
a dish made of meat or vegetables cut into small pieces then pressed together and cooked in a single solid piece
loaf.chi_def: （肉糜或小塊蔬菜壓緊後烹製成的長條形）糕

loaf.eg: Stop loafing (about/around) and get on with cleaning the windows!

loan.eng_def: an amount of money that is borrowed, often from a bank, and has to be paid back, usually together with an extra amount of money that you have to pay as a charge for borrowing
loan.eg: She's trying to get a $50,000 loan to start her own business.

loan.eng_def: an act of borrowing or lending something
loan.eg: Thank you very much for the loan of your bike.

loan.eng_def: If a football player is on loan, they are playing for a different club for a limited period of time.
loan.chi_def: （足球隊員）被（其他俱樂部）租借
loan.eg: He spent a month on loan at Newcastle.
This library loans books and CDs.

lobby.eng_def: to try to persuade a politician, the government, or an official group that a particular thing should or should not happen, or that a law should be changed
lobby.chi_def: 遊說，試圖說服（政客、政府或官方團體）
lobby.eg: Small businesses have lobbied hard for/against changes in the tax laws.

lobby.eng_def: a group of people who try to persuade the government or an official group to do something
the (large) room into which the main entrance door opens in a hotel or other large building
in the UK parliament, a room where someone meets a member of parliament who they have arranged to talk to, or one of the two passages that members of parliament walk through as a way of voting
lobby.chi_def: （英國議會的）接見廳，會見廳，表決廳

lobster.eng_def: an animal that lives in the sea and has a long body covered with a hard shell, two large claws, and eight legs, or its flesh when used as food

local.eng_def: from, existing in, serving, or responsible for a small area, especially of a country
limited to a particular part of the body
a person who lives in the particular small area that you are talking about
local.eg: The café is popular with both locals and visitors.

local.eng_def: a pub near to where a person lives, especially if they often go there to drink
local.chi_def: （尤指經常去的）家附近的酒吧

local.eng_def: a train or bus that makes all or most of the stops along its route, allowing passengers to get on or off
a division within a union representing people from a particular area
local.chi_def: （尤指全國性工會組織的）當地分支機搆

locate.eng_def: to be in a particular place
locate.chi_def: 位於…／在…附近／坐落在…（等等）
locate.eg: Our office is located in midtown Manhattan.

locate.eng_def: to find or discover the exact position of something
locate.chi_def: 確定…的位置，發現…的位置
locate.eg: Police are still trying to locate the suspect.

locate.eng_def: to move to a place to do business
locate.eg: The company hopes to locate in its new offices by June.

location.eg: The hotel is in a beautiful location overlooking the lake.

location.eng_def: a place away from a studio where all or part of a film or a television show is recorded
location.chi_def: （電影、電視等的）外景地，拍攝地
location.eg: The documentary was made on location in the Gobi desert.

location.eng_def: the act of finding the exact position of something
location.chi_def: 確定…的位置，發現…的位置
location.eg: The latest navigational aids make the location of the airfield quite easy.

lock.eng_def: a device that prevents something such as a door from being opened and can only be opened with a key
lock.eg: I heard someone turn a key in the lock.

lock.eng_def: a length of water with gates at each end where the level of water can be changed to allow boats to move between parts of a canal or river that are at different heights
something that is certain to happen
lock.eg: She's a lock for promotion this year.

lock.eng_def: a small group of hairs, especially a curl
lock.eg: There is a lock of Napoleon's hair in the display cabinet.

lock.eng_def: the amount a road vehicle's front wheels can be turned from one side to the other by turning its steering wheel
lock.eg: You need it on full lock (= with the wheel turned as much as possible).

lock.eng_def: a way of holding someone that you are fighting against so that they cannot move
lock.chi_def: 鎖住（對手），使（對手）動彈不得
lock.eg: The smaller wrestler held his opponent in a full body lock.

lock.eng_def: to put something in a safe place and fasten the lock
lock.eg: He locked the confidential documents in his filing cabinet.

lock.eng_def: to fasten something with a key, or be fastened with a key
lock.eg: Don't forget to lock the door when you go out.

lock.eng_def: to become fixed in one position
lock.eg: I tried to start moving but the wheels had locked.

locker.eng_def: a cupboard, often tall and made of metal, in which you can keep your possessions, and leave them for a period of time
locker.eg: We had several hours to wait for our train, so we left our bags in a (luggage) locker, and went to look around the town.

locomotive.eng_def: relating to movement or the ability to move

locust.eng_def: a large insect found in hot areas that flies in large groups and destroys plants and crops

lodge.eng_def: to make an official complaint about something
lodge.chi_def: 提出索賠／投訴／抗議（等等）
lodge.eg: The US lodged a formal protest against the arrest of the foreign reporters.

lodge.eng_def: to (cause to) become stuck in a place or position
lodge.eg: A fish bone had lodged in her throat.

lodge.eng_def: to put something in a safe place
lodge.eg: You should lodge a copy of the letter with your solicitor.

lodge.eng_def: to pay rent to stay somewhere
lodge.eg: She lodged with Mrs Higgins when she first came to Cambridge.

lodge.eng_def: a small house in the country, used especially by people on holiday or taking part in sports, or one on land belonging to a large house
lodge.chi_def: （尤指度假者或體育活動者用的）鄉間小屋，小舍

lodge.eng_def: the place where a beaver lives

lodge.chi_def: 尖頂棚屋，簡陋小屋（同 wigwam）

lodge.eng_def: a local group of an organization such as the Freemasons
lodge.chi_def: （共濟會等組織的）地方分會，地方分支機搆

lodge.eng_def: the room used by a person whose job is to be at the entrance to a large building such as a hotel or college in order to help people

lofty.eng_def: Lofty ideas, etc. are of a high moral standard.
If you have a lofty way of behaving or talking, etc., you act as if you think you are better than other people.

log.eng_def: a thick piece of tree trunk or branch, especially one cut for burning on a fire
a full written record of a journey, a period of time, or an event
log.chi_def: （旅程、某段時間或事件的）日記，日誌

log.eng_def: to cut down trees so that you can use their wood
log.eg: The forest has been so heavily logged that it is in danger of disappearing.
The Better Business Bureau has logged more than 90 complaints.

log.eng_def: to travel and record a particular distance

logic.eng_def: a particular way of thinking, especially one that is reasonable and based on good judgment
logic.eg: I fail to see the logic behind his argument.

logic.eng_def: a formal scientific method of examining or thinking about ideas

logo.eng_def: a design or symbol used by a company to advertise its products

lollipop.eng_def: a hard sweet on a stick

lone.eng_def: someone who has children but no partner living with them
lone.chi_def: 單親／單身母親／單身父親

lonely.eng_def: unhappy because you are not with other people
lonely.eg: She gets lonely now that all the kids have left home.

lonely.eng_def: A lonely place is a long way from where people live.
lonely.chi_def: 孤獨的，孤零零的，遠離人群的
lonely.eg: a lonely stretch of Arizona highway

lonesome.eg: I was just sitting here all by my lonesome.

long.eng_def: continuing for a large amount of time
being a distance between two points that is more than average or usual
used to describe a piece of writing that has a lot of pages or words
used to mean "(for) a long time", especially in questions and negative sentences
long.chi_def: （尤用在疑問句和否定句中）長久地，長時間地

long.eng_def: a long period of time before or after something
long.chi_def: 在…之前（或之後）的很長一段時間
long.eg: She left the house long before I arrived.

long.eng_def: used with the past participle or the -ing form of the verb to mean that a state or activity has continued for a long time
long.chi_def: （與過去分詞或動詞的 ing 形式連用表示持續了很久的狀態或活動）

long.eng_def: used to say that something must happen before something else can happen
long.eg: I can come as long as I can leave by 4.00.
She longed to see him again.

longevity.eg: To what do you attribute your longevity?

longevity.eng_def: remaining popular or useful for a long time
longevity.eg: For longevity in car design, you really need to keep it simple.

longitude.eng_def: the distance of a place east or west of an imaginary line between the North Pole and the South Pole, measured in degrees

look.eng_def: to direct your eyes in order to see
to try to find something or someone
used when you are telling someone to be careful or to pay attention
to be planning to do something
look.eg: I'm looking to start my own business.

look.eng_def: the act of looking at someone or something
look.eg: She gave him a look of real dislike.

look.eng_def: the act of trying to find someone or something
look.eg: I had another look for the watch, but couldn't find it.
She had a worried look about her.
The look this year will be relaxed and casual.

look.eng_def: the appearance of someone or something
look.eg: They liked the look of the hotel, but it was too expensive.

look.eng_def: a person's appearance, especially how attractive they are

look.chi_def: 看看吧；瞧（用於表達憤怒）
look.eg: Look, I've already told you it's not possible.

loose.eng_def: not firmly held or fastened in place
loose.eg: There were some loose wires hanging out of the wall.

loose.eng_def: Loose hair is not tied back.
loose.eg: Her hair was hanging loose to her shoulders.

loose.eng_def: Loose things are not held together or attached to anything else.
loose.eg: A few loose sheets of paper were lying around.

loose.eng_def: (of clothes) not fitting closely to the body
loose.eg: Wear comfortable, loose clothing to your exercise class.

loose.eng_def: not tightly controlled, or not exact
loose.chi_def: 未嚴加控制的；不嚴謹的，不精確的
loose.eg: It's a fairly loose adaptation of the novel.

loose.eng_def: to speak or express emotions very freely, especially in an uncontrolled way
loose.chi_def: 敞開了說，放開了說，自由表達
loose.eg: The coach loosed an angry tirade against his team.

loosen.eg: The screws holding the bed together had loosened.

loosen.eng_def: to make something such as your hair or a piece of clothing less tight

lord.eng_def: a man who has a lot of power in a particular area of activity
lord.eg: Several alleged drug lords are to be put on trial.

lord.eng_def: to behave as if you are better than someone and have the right to tell them what to do
lord.chi_def: 對（某人）指手畫腳，對（某人）發號施令
lord.eg: He likes to lord it over his little sister.

lord.eng_def: a title used in front of the names of male peers and officials of very high rank

lord.chi_def: （英國議會中的）貴族院，上議院（同 the House of Lords）

lord.eng_def: in the UK, used to address a judge or peer
lord.chi_def: （在英國對法官或貴族的稱呼）大人，閣下

lord.eng_def: (in the Christian religion) God or Jesus Christ

lose.eng_def: to no longer have something because you do not know where it is
to have something or someone taken away from you
lose.eg: At least 600 staff will lose their jobs if the factory closes.

lose.eng_def: to have less of something than you had before
If you lose time, you waste it.
lose.eg: Four million hours were lost last year through stress-related illnesses.

lose.eng_def: If a clock loses time, it goes more slowly than it should.
lose.eg: My watch loses ten minutes every day.
Lose the belt and let's see how the dress looks.

lose.eng_def: A business that is losing money is spending more money than it is receiving.
lose.eg: Banks will lose millions of pounds because of new legislation.

lose.eng_def: to fail to succeed in a game, competition, etc.
lose.eg: If we lose this game, we're out of the championship.

loser.eng_def: a person or team that does not win a game or competition
loser.eg: The losers of both games will play each other for third place.

loser.eng_def: a person who is always unsuccessful at everything they do
someone or something that is in a worse position or has less value at the end of a process
loser.eg: The latest price increases mean that the real loser, as usual, is the consumer.

loss.eng_def: the fact that you no longer have something or have less of something
loss.eg: Many parents feel a sense of loss when their children leave home.

loss.eng_def: a disadvantage caused by someone leaving or by something being taken away
loss.eg: It would be a great loss to the department if you left.
They never got over the loss of their son.

loss.eng_def: a situation in which a business spends more money than it earns
loss.eg: The company announced a pre-tax loss of three million dollars.

loss.eng_def: an occasion when a number of people die
loss.eg: The plane crashed with serious loss of life.

lot.eng_def: lots (of) a large amount or number of people or things

lot.eg: Your sister looks a lot like you.

lot.eng_def: to be the main cause of a problem or an unpleasant situation
lot.chi_def: 是問題的主要原因；應負最大的責任
lot.eg: People who sell drugs to kids have a lot to answer for.
I made enough curry for three people and he ate the lot.

lot.eng_def: an amount or set of things, especially when there are several of these amounts
lot.eg: I've already done one lot of washing.

lot.eng_def: in an auction (= public sale), an object or set of objects that are being sold
lot.eg: Lot number 134 is a fine old walnut bureau.

lot.eng_def: a film studio and the land around it
the quality of someone's life and the experiences that they have
lot.eg: They should do something to improve the lot of the lowest-paid workers.

lot.eng_def: to make a decision by choosing from a set of objects such as pieces of paper or sticks that are all the same except for one
lot.eg: We drew lots to decide who would go.

lotion.eng_def: a liquid that you put on your skin in order to protect it, improve its condition, or make it smell pleasant

lottery.eng_def: a game, often organized by the state or a charity in order to make money, in which tickets with numbers are sold to people who then have a chance of winning a prize if their number is chosen
something that depends only on luck and is not fair
lottery.eg: Education in England is something of a lottery.

lotus.eng_def: a type of tropical water lily (= a plant with large, flat leaves that float on the surface of lakes and pools)

loud.eng_def: (of clothes) having unpleasantly bright colours or too strong patterns, or (of a person) demanding attention and talking and laughing loudly
loud.chi_def: （衣服）過於鮮豔的，花哨的；（人）惹人注目的，招搖的
loud.eg: You shouldn't wear anything too loud to a job interview.

loudspeaker.eng_def: a piece of equipment that changes electrical signals into sounds, especially used in public places so that large numbers of people can hear someone speaking or music playing

lounge.eng_def: a room in a hotel, airport, theatre, etc. where people can relax or wait
lounge.chi_def: （飯店、機場、劇院等的）休息廳，等候室

lounge.eng_def: the room in a house or apartment that is used for relaxing and entertaining guests in
lounge.eg: All the family were sitting in the lounge watching television.

lousy.eng_def: used to say that you feel insulted by something
lousy.eg: All he offered me was a lousy 20 bucks (= a small amount of money)!

lousy.eng_def: used to say that something is full of something, or has too much of it
lousy.chi_def: （表示很多或太多）充滿了…，充斥著…
lousy.eg: The internet is lousy with this kind of stuff.

love.eng_def: to like another adult very much and be romantically and sexually attracted to them, or to have strong feelings of liking a friend or person in your family
used, often in requests, to say that you would very much like something
love.eg: I'd love a cup of coffee if you're making one.

love.eng_def: the feeling of liking another adult very much and being romantically and sexually attracted to them, or strong feelings of liking a friend or person in your family
love.eg: "I've been seeing him over a year now." "Is it love?"

love.eng_def: a person that you love and feel attracted to
love.eg: He was the love of my life.

love.eng_def: used as a friendly form of address
love.chi_def: （用於表示友好的稱呼）親愛的親愛的

love.eng_def: used before your name at the end of letters, cards, etc. to friends or family
love.eg: See you at Christmas. Love, Kate.

love.eng_def: to love someone in a romantic and sexual way
love.eg: I'm in love for the first time and it's wonderful.

love.eng_def: to start to love someone romantically and sexually
love.eg: I was 20 when I first fell in love.
I don't share my boyfriend's love of cooking.

love.eng_def: something that you like very much
love.eg: Music is one of her greatest loves.

love.eng_def: (in tennis) the state of having no points

lovely.eng_def: used to describe a person who is kind, friendly, and pleasant to be with

lovely.eg: Simon was there with the usual bevy of lovelies.

lover.eng_def: the person you are having a sexual relationship with, but are not married to
lover.eg: They were friends before they became lovers.

lover.eng_def: someone with a strong liking for something

low.eng_def: not measuring much from the base to the top
close to the ground or the bottom of something

low.eg: Temperatures are very low for the time of year.

low.eng_def: producing only a small amount of sound, heat, or light
low.chi_def: （聲、熱或光）低的，暗的，小的，少的
low.eg: They spoke in low voices so I would not hear what they were saying.

low.eng_def: of bad quality, especially when referring to something that is not as good as it should be
not considered important because of being at or near the bottom of a range of things, especially jobs or social positions
low.chi_def: （尤指職位或社會地位）低下的，卑微的

low.eng_def: (of a sound or voice) near or at the bottom of the range of sounds
low.eg: He has a very low voice.

low.chi_def: 憂鬱的，情緒低落的，消沈的
low.eg: Illness of any sort can leave you feeling low.

low.eng_def: close to the ground or the bottom of something
low.eg: The planes fly low across enemy territory.

low.eng_def: at or to a low level
to have nearly finished a supply of something
low.eg: We're running low on milk - could you buy some more?

low.eng_def: to make the deep, long sound of a cow
a bad time in someone's life
low.eg: the highs and lows of an acting career

low.chi_def: 新低／有記錄以來的最低點
low.eg: The dollar has hit an all-time low against the Japanese yen.

lower.eng_def: to move something into a low position
lower.eg: They lowered the coffin into the grave.
Interest rates have been lowered again.

lower.eng_def: to make something worse than it was before
to behave in a way that makes people lose respect for you
lower.eg: I wouldn't lower myself to respond to his insults if I were you.

lower.eng_def: positioned below one or more similar things, or of the bottom part of something
lower.eg: the lower deck of a ship

loyal.eng_def: firm and not changing in your friendship with or support for a person or an organization, or in your belief in your principles
loyal.eg: Jack has been a loyal worker in this company for almost 50 years.

loyalty.eg: His loyalty was never in question.

loyalty.eng_def: your feelings of support or duty towards someone or something
loyalty.eg: My loyalties to my family come before anything else.

luck.eng_def: the force that causes things, especially good things, to happen to you by chance and not as a result of your own efforts or abilities
luck.eg: It was just luck that I asked for a job at the right time.
Have you had any luck with booking your flight?

lucky.eng_def: having good things happen to you by chance
lucky.chi_def: 幸運的，走運的，運氣好的

luggage.eng_def: the bags, suitcases, etc. that contain your possessions and that you take with you when you are travelling
luggage.eg: We bought some new luggage for our trip.

lullaby.eng_def: a quiet song that is sung to children to help them go to sleep

lumber.eg: In the distance, we could see a herd of elephants lumbering across the plain.

lumber.eng_def: wood that has been prepared for building

lump.eng_def: a piece of a solid substance, usually with no particular shape

lump.eg: I'll be getting the insurance money in two lumps.

lump.eng_def: a hard swelling found in or on the body, especially because of illness or injury
lump.chi_def: （尤指因疾病或傷害而出現的）腫塊
lump.eg: She found a lump in her breast.

lump.chi_def: 笨重的人，愚蠢的大塊頭
lump.eg: Come on, you great lump - get up from that sofa and do some work!

lump.eng_def: to accept a situation or decision although you do not like it
lump.chi_def: 無奈地接受，不得不接受
lump.eg: The decision has been made, so if Tom doesn't like it, he can lump it.

lunar.eng_def: of or relating to the moon

lunatic.eng_def: someone who behaves in a silly or dangerous way
a person who is mentally ill

lunch.eng_def: a meal that is eaten in the middle of the day

lung.eng_def: either of the two organs in the chest with which people and some animals breathe

lure.eng_def: the quality or power that something or someone has that makes it, him, or her attractive
an artificial insect or other small animal that is put on the end of a fishing line to attract fish
to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere by offering them something exciting
lure.eg: She was lured into the job by the offer of a high salary.

lush.eng_def: A lush area has a lot of green, healthy plants, grass, and trees.
lush.chi_def: （地區）鬱鬱蔥蔥的，植被茂盛的

lush.eng_def: very attractive to look at, taste, smell, etc.
lush.chi_def: 美味的；愉悅的，使感官愉快的
lush.eg: the lush sound of the orchestra

lush.eng_def: good or, of a person, attractive
lush.eg: We had a lush time on my birthday.

lush.eng_def: a person who regularly drinks too much alcohol
lush.eg: She's a lush by all accounts.

luxurious.eg: They have a very luxurious house.
The cat gave a long, luxurious stretch.

luxury.eng_def: great comfort, especially as provided by expensive and beautiful things
something expensive that is pleasant to have but is not necessary
luxury.eg: luxuries, such as champagne and chocolate

luxury.eng_def: something that gives you a lot of pleasure but cannot be done often
luxury.eg: A day off work is such a luxury.

lyric.eng_def: the words of a song, especially a pop song
lyric.eg: Paul Simon writes the lyrics for most of his songs.

lyric.eng_def: a short poem that expresses the personal thoughts and feelings of the person who wrote it
(especially of poetry and songs) expressing personal thoughts and feelings
lyric.eg: William Wordsworth wrote lyric poetry/was a lyric poet.

ma.eg: As my old ma used to say, you can't spend what you ain't got.

ma.eng_def: a title for an old woman
ma.chi_def: （對老年婦女的稱呼）大媽，大娘
ma.eg: Ma Johnson always used to bake the best cookies.

ma.chi_def: 文科碩士學位；文科碩士（Master of Arts的縮寫）

ma.eng_def: written abbreviation for the US state of Massachusetts: used in addresses
ma.chi_def: （美國）麻塞諸塞州，麻薩諸塞州（寫地址時Massachusetts的縮寫）

ma'am.eng_def: a polite way of talking to a woman
ma'am.chi_def: （用以禮貌地稱呼婦女）夫人，太太
ma'am.eg: How can I help you, ma'am?

ma'am.eng_def: in Britain, used to address the Queen, or a woman of high rank in particular organizations, such as the army or the police
ma'am.chi_def: （在英國對女王或軍隊、警隊等機構中職位較高婦女的稱呼）夫人

ma'am.eng_def: in the past, used when talking to a woman of higher social class
ma'am.chi_def: （舊時用於稱呼上層社會的婦女）夫人，女士

machine.eng_def: a piece of equipment with several moving parts that uses power to do a particular type of work
machine.eg: The different sizes of eggs are sorted by a machine.
You'll need a powerful machine for editing videos.
That's a mean (= powerful) machine you've got there, Bill.

machine.eng_def: a group of people who control and organize something
to sew cloth with a sewing machine
machine.eg: I've almost finished making the curtains - I just have to machine the hem.

machinery.eng_def: a group of large machines or the parts of a machine that make it work
machinery.chi_def: （大型的）機器；機械；（機器的）運轉部分

machinery.eng_def: the structure and systems of an organization or process

mad.eng_def: mentally ill, or unable to behave in a reasonable way
mad.chi_def: 瘋的，神經錯亂的，精神失常的
mad.eg: I think I must be going mad.
You're mad to walk home alone at this time of night.

mad.chi_def: 非常憤怒的，狂怒的；十分惱火的
mad.eg: He's always complaining and it makes me so mad.

mad.eng_def: hurrying or excited and not having time to think or plan
mad.eg: We made a mad dash for the train.
He's the first real boyfriend she's had and she's mad about him.

mad.eng_def: to want someone or something very much, or to be very interested in someone or something
mad.eg: Everyone's mad for him and I just don't see the attraction.

mad.eng_def: extremely interested in cars, clothes, sex, etc.

madam.eng_def: a formal and polite way of speaking to a woman
madam.chi_def: （對婦女正式而禮貌的稱呼）夫人，太太，女士
madam.eg: May I carry your suitcases for you, Madam?

madam.eng_def: the usual way of beginning a formal letter to a woman whose name you do not know
madam.chi_def: （正式信函開頭對未知姓名的婦女的尊稱）尊敬的女士

madam.eng_def: a young girl who behaves like an older woman, expecting others to obey her
madam.chi_def: 小婦人，喜歡使喚他人的年輕女孩
madam.eg: She's turning into a proper little madam.

madam.eng_def: a woman who is in charge of a group of prostitutes who live or work in the same house

magazine.eng_def: a type of thin book with large pages and a paper cover that contains articles and photographs and is published every week or month
magazine.eg: She has written articles for several women's magazines.

magazine.eng_def: a part of a gun in which cartridges are stored
a building in which explosives, weapons, and supplies are kept

magic.eng_def: the use of special powers to make things happen that would usually be impossible, such as in stories for children
magic.eg: The group is known for its belief in witchcraft and magic.

magic.eng_def: the skill of performing tricks to entertain people, such as making things appear and disappear and pretending to cut someone in half
magic.eg: He's a comedian who also does magic.

magic.eng_def: a special and exciting quality that makes something seem different from ordinary things
magic.eg: Although the film was made 50 years ago, it has lost none of its magic.
The witch put a magic spell on the prince and turned him into a frog.

magic.eng_def: happening in an unusual or unexpected way, or easily or quickly
magic.chi_def: 魔術般的；出乎意料的；容易的；迅速的
magic.eg: There's no magic solution to the problem.

magic.eng_def: used when you think something is very good and you like it a lot
magic.eg: "Kate's having a party on Saturday night." "Magic!"

magical.eg: Diamonds were once thought to have magical powers.

magical.eng_def: used for describing something with a special and exciting quality
magical.chi_def: 魔幻的，十分奇妙的（形容事物不可思議）
magical.eg: We walked home arm-in-arm in the magical moonlight.

magician.eng_def: a person who has magic powers in stories, or who performs tricks for entertainment
magician.eg: Merlin was the magician in the stories of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.

magnet.eng_def: an object that is able both to attract iron and steel objects and also push them away
a person, place, or thing that other people feel strongly attracted to
magnet.chi_def: 有吸引力的人（或地方、物）
magnet.eg: The United States has always acted as a magnet for people seeking fame and fortune.

magnetic.eng_def: with the power of a magnet
used to describe someone whose personality attracts a lot of people

magnificent.eng_def: very good, beautiful, or deserving to be admired
magnificent.chi_def: 極好的；壯麗的；令人羨慕的

magnify.eng_def: to make something look larger than it is, especially by looking at it through a lens
magnify.eg: Although our skin looks smooth, when magnified it is full of bumps and holes.

magnify.eng_def: to make a problem bigger or more important
magnify.eg: The hot summer magnified the racial tensions in the community.

magnitude.eng_def: the large size or importance of something
magnitude.eg: They don't seem to grasp the magnitude of the problem.

maid.eng_def: a woman who works as a servant in a hotel or in someone's home
maid.chi_def: （飯店的）女服務員；（家中的）女傭，女僕，侍女
maid.eg: In the beach resort, the apartments and villas have daily maid service.

maid.eng_def: a girl or young woman who is not married, or has not had sex
maid.chi_def: 女孩，少女，（未婚的）年輕女子

maiden.eg: In the story, the prince woos and wins the fair maiden.

maiden.eng_def: an over in cricket in which no runs are scored
being the first of its type
maiden.eg: The first hydrogen-powered airplane will make its maiden flight this year.

mail.eng_def: the letters, etc. that are sent to or from people, or the system for sending letters, etc. from place to place
mail.eg: She spent the morning reading and answering her mail.
I had almost 50 unread mails in my inbox.

mail.eng_def: to send a letter, etc. or to email something
mail.eg: She mailed it last week but it still hasn't arrived.

mail.eng_def: in the UK, used in the name of some newspapers
mail.chi_def: 郵報（用於某些報紙名稱中）

main.eng_def: larger, more important, or having more influence than others of the same type
main.chi_def: 主要的；最重要的；最大的
main.eg: The main thing is not to worry.

main.eng_def: a large pipe that carries water or gas, or a wire carrying electricity, from one place to another, to which a house can be connected
main.chi_def: （輸送水、煤氣的）主管道，總管；（輸送電力的）幹線

main.eng_def: the system of pipes or wires that carry water or electricity into a house, or the pipes that carry sewage away from a house
main.chi_def: （輸送水、電的）管道系統；下水道系統
main.eg: The house isn't on the mains.

main.eng_def: the place at which outside pipes or wires carrying water, electricity, etc. connect with the system inside a house or building
main.chi_def: 內外管道相接處；總閥門；總電源
main.eg: Switch off the electricity at the mains before starting work.
Her friends are teachers in the main.

mainland.eng_def: the main part of a country or continent, not including the islands around it
mainland.eg: They recently bulit a bridge between the mainland and the closest island.

mainstream.eng_def: considered normal, and having or using ideas, beliefs, etc. that are accepted by most people
mainstream.eg: This is the director's first mainstream Hollywood film.

mainstream.eng_def: the way of life or set of beliefs accepted by most people
mainstream.chi_def: 主流（多數人的生活方式或信仰）
mainstream.eg: The new law should allow more disabled people to enter the mainstream of American life.

mainstream.eng_def: to teach children with physical or mental problems in the same class as children without problems
mainstream.chi_def: 讓…融入主流教育（給身體或智力有缺陷的兒童與正常兒童同堂授課）

maintain.eng_def: to continue to have; to keep in existence, or not allow to become less
maintain.eg: The army has been brought in to maintain order in the region.

maintain.eng_def: to keep a road, machine, building, etc. in good condition
maintain.eg: A large house costs a lot to maintain.

maintain.eng_def: to express firmly your belief that something is true
maintain.eg: Throughout his prison sentence, Dunn has always maintained his innocence.

maintain.eng_def: to provide someone with food and whatever is necessary for them to live on
maintain.eg: They barely earn enough to maintain themselves and their four children.

maintenance.eng_def: the work needed to keep a road, building, machine, etc. in good condition
maintenance.chi_def: 維護，保養（保持道路、建築、機器設備等處於良好狀態的工作）
maintenance.eg: Old houses need a lot of maintenance.

maintenance.eng_def: money that a person must pay regularly by law in order to support their child or previous marriage partner after a divorce (= official end to a marriage)
maintenance.chi_def: （法律規定離婚後須定期支付用以供養孩子或前配偶的）撫養費，生活費
maintenance.eg: He refused to pay maintenance for his three children.

maintenance.eng_def: a situation in which something continues to exist or is not allowed to become less

majestic.eng_def: beautiful, powerful, or causing great admiration and respect
majestic.eg: The majestic Montana scenery will leave you breathless.

majesty.eng_def: If something has majesty, it causes admiration and respect for its beauty.
majesty.eg: This music has majesty, power, and passion.

majesty.eng_def: the title used to speak to or about a king or queen
majesty.chi_def: （對國王、女王或皇后的尊稱）陛下
majesty.eg: I was invited to tea with Her Majesty the Queen.

majesty.eng_def: used to describe a prison sentence (= time in prison) that does not have a fixed length
majesty.eg: She was sentenced to be detained at Her Majesty's pleasure.
He has had several spells at Her Majesty's pleasure.

major.eng_def: more important, bigger, or more serious than others of the same type
major.chi_def: 較重要的；主要的；重大的
major.eg: All of her major plays have been translated into English.

major.eng_def: belonging or relating to a musical scale that is generally thought to have a happy sound
an officer of middle rank in the British, US, and many other armed forces
major.chi_def: （英軍、美軍及其他軍隊中的）少校
major.eg: Her father was a major in the Scots Guards.

major.eng_def: the most important subject that a college or university student is studying, or the student himself or herself
major.chi_def: （大學生的）專業，主修課程；（大學專業的）主修學生
major.eg: What is your major, English or French?

major.eng_def: to study something as your main subject at college or university
major.eg: She majored in philosophy at Harvard.

majority.eng_def: the larger number or part of something
majority.eg: The majority of the employees have university degrees.

majority.eng_def: in an election, the difference in the number of votes between the winning person or group and the one that comes second
majority.chi_def: 多數票（選舉中勝者與第二名之間的選票差額）
majority.eg: The Democratic candidate won by a narrow/large majority.

majority.eng_def: the age when you legally become an adult

make.eng_def: to produce something, often using a particular substance or material
make.eg: Do you want me to make some coffee?

make.eng_def: To make a film or television programme is to direct, produce it, or act in it.
make.eg: John Huston made some great movies.
The kids made a real mess in the kitchen.

make.eng_def: to cause to be, to become, or to appear as
make.eg: It's the good weather that makes Spain such a popular tourist destination.

make.eng_def: to take action so that you are certain that something happens, is true, etc.
make.eg: I'll just make sure I've turned the oven off.
I have to make a phone call.

make.eng_def: If you make room/space/way for something or someone, you move your body or move other things, so that there is space for it, him, or her.
to pull up and tidy the covers on a bed after it has been slept in
make.eg: She hurried upstairs and quickly made the beds.

make.eng_def: to force someone or something to do something
make.eg: You can't make him go if he doesn't want to.

make.eng_def: to be forced to do something
make.eg: The prisoners are made to dig holes and fill them up again.

make.eng_def: to produce a total when added together

make.eg: How much do you make the total?
She makes $100,000 a year as a doctor.

make.eng_def: to arrive at or reach, especially successfully
make.eg: She made it to the airport just in time to catch her plane.

make.eng_def: to succeed in getting a place in a team
make.eg: She failed to make the Olympic squad.

make.eng_def: to appear as a story in the news
make.eg: His story made the papers back home.
Those little bows around the neck really make the dress!

make.eng_def: a type of product or the name of the company that made it

makeup.eng_def: coloured substances used on your face to improve or change your appearance
makeup.eg: I put on a little eye make-up.

makeup.eng_def: The make-up of something or someone is the combination of things that form it.
makeup.eg: They argue that the membership of the Council does not reflect the racial make-up of the city.

malaria.eng_def: a disease that you can get from the bite of a particular type of mosquito (= a small flying insect). Malaria causes periods of fever and makes you shiver and feel very cold. It is common in many hotter parts of the world.

male.eng_def: used to refer to men or boys, or the sex that fertilizes eggs, and does not produce babies or eggs itself
male.chi_def: 男（性）的；男子的；雄性的，公的

male.eng_def: used to refer to a piece of equipment that has a part that sticks out and can be fitted into a hollow part in another piece of equipment
a boy, man, or male animal
male.eg: The male of the species is less aggressive.

mall.eng_def: a large, usually covered, shopping area where cars are not allowed
mall.chi_def: （車輛不得入內的）商業街，購物中心
mall.eg: There are plans to build a new mall in the middle of town.

mama.eg: Can I have some more, Mama?

mama.eng_def: a woman, especially an attractive one
mama.eg: There's a good-looking mama sitting at the bar.

mammal.eng_def: any animal of which the female feeds her young on milk from her own body. Most mammals give birth to live young, not eggs.
mammal.eg: Humans, dogs, elephants, and dolphins are all mammals, but birds, fish, and crocodiles are not.

man.chi_def: （沒有明確職位或頭銜的）男性員工
man.eg: The gas company said they would send some men to fix the leak.

man.eng_def: male members of the armed forces who are not officers
man.eg: The military expedition was made up of 100 officers and men.
My man will show you to the door.

man.eng_def: a man typical of or involved in marketing, advertising, etc.
a husband or male sexual partner
man.eg: I hear she's got a new man.

man.eng_def: used when talking to someone, especially a man
man.chi_def: （用於稱呼，尤指對男子）老兄，老弟，小夥子，朋友
man.eg: Hey, man, how are you doing?

man.eng_def: If a man and a woman are man and wife, they are married to each other.
a person or group that has power or authority, for example the police

man.eg: Man is still far more intelligent than the smartest robot.
All men are equal in the sight of the law.

man.eng_def: any of the objects that are moved or played with in games such as chess
To man something such as a machine or vehicle is to be present in order to operate it.
man.eg: The phones are manned 24 hours a day.

man.eng_def: used to express a strong emotion
man.chi_def: （用作感歎詞，尤用於表示強烈的感情）啊，呀，哈，嘿
man.eg: Man, we had a good time - we drank all through the night!

man.eng_def: having the nationality or job mentioned, or (of a group or vehicle) containing the number of people mentioned
man.chi_def: …國人；做…職業的人；（團體）由…人組成的；（交通工具）可載…人的

manage.eng_def: to succeed in doing or dealing with something, especially something difficult
manage.chi_def: 成功做到，順利完成（尤指困難之事）
manage.eg: Did you manage to get any bread?

manage.eng_def: to succeed in living on a small amount of money
manage.chi_def: 勉強生活下去，勉強度日
manage.eg: After she lost her job, they had to manage on his salary.

manage.eng_def: to be able to attend or do something at a particular time
manage.chi_def: 能夠（在某個時候）做（或參加等等）
manage.eg: Let's meet tomorrow - I can manage 3.

manage.eng_def: to be responsible for controlling or organizing someone or something, especially a business or employees
manage.chi_def: 管理，掌管；經營（尤指企業）
manage.eg: Has she had any experience of managing large projects?

manageable.eng_def: easy or possible to deal with
manageable.chi_def: 易處理的；易辦的；可應付的
manageable.eg: The work has been divided into smaller, more manageable sections.

management.eng_def: the control and organization of something
management.eg: The company has suffered from several years of bad management.

management.eng_def: the group of people responsible for controlling and organizing a company
management.eg: Management has/have offered staff a three percent pay increase.

manager.eng_def: the person who is responsible for managing an organization
the person whose job is to organize and sometimes train a sports team
The manager of a singer, actor, or other performer is a person whose job is to arrange the business part of their work.
manager.chi_def: （歌手、演員或其他表演者的）經紀人

mango.eng_def: an oval tropical fruit with a smooth skin, orange-yellow flesh, and a large, hard seed in the middle

manifest.eng_def: to show something clearly, through signs or actions
manifest.eg: The workers chose to manifest their dissatisfaction in a series of strikes.

manifest.eng_def: a list of people and goods carried on a ship or plane
manifest.eg: He had been listed on the manifest for the flight but it could not be confirmed if he had boarded.

manipulate.eng_def: to control something or someone to your advantage, often unfairly or dishonestly
manipulate.chi_def: （常指以不正當手段）操縱，控制
manipulate.eg: Throughout her career she has very successfully manipulated the media.

manipulate.eng_def: to control something using the hands
manipulate.eg: The wheelchair is designed so that it is easy to manipulate.

manipulate.eng_def: to treat a part of the body, using the hands to push back bones into the correct position and put pressure on muscles
manipulate.eg: The doctor manipulated the base of my spine and the pain disappeared completely.

mankind.eng_def: the whole of the human race, including both men and women
mankind.eg: Mankind has always been obsessed by power.

manner.eng_def: the way in which something is done
manner.eg: She stared at me in an accusing manner.
Her latest film is a suspense thriller very much in the manner of Hitchcock.

manner.eng_def: the usual way in which you behave towards other people, or the way you behave on a particular occasion
manner.eg: She has a somewhat cold, unfriendly manner.

manner.eng_def: polite ways of treating other people and behaving in public
manner.eg: He needs to be taught some manners.
Very little is known about the new candidate - what manner of man is he?

manners.eng_def: the way in which something is done
manners.eg: She stared at me in an accusing manner.
Her latest film is a suspense thriller very much in the manner of Hitchcock.

manners.eng_def: the usual way in which you behave towards other people, or the way you behave on a particular occasion
manners.eg: She has a somewhat cold, unfriendly manner.

manners.eng_def: polite ways of treating other people and behaving in public
manners.eg: He needs to be taught some manners.
Very little is known about the new candidate - what manner of man is he?

mansion.eg: The street is lined with enormous mansions where the rich and famous live.

manual.eng_def: A manual machine is operated with the hands rather than by electricity or a motor.
manual.eg: He still works on an old manual typewriter.

manual.eng_def: involving physical work rather than mental work
a book that gives you practical instructions on how to do something or how to use something, such as a machine
a keyboard, especially on an organ, designed to be played with the hands rather than the feet
manual.chi_def: （尤指在風琴上）用手操作的鍵盤

manufacture.eng_def: to produce goods in large numbers, usually in a factory using machines
manufacture.chi_def: （通常指工廠利用機械大量）製造，（大批）生產
manufacture.eg: He works for a company that manufactures car parts.

manufacture.eng_def: to invent something, such as an excuse or story, in order to deceive someone
manufacture.eg: She insisted that every scandalous detail of the story had been manufactured.
Oil is used in the manufacture of a number of fabrics.

manufacturer.eng_def: a company that produces goods in large numbers
manufacturer.chi_def: 製造商，生產商（生產大批商品的企業）
manufacturer.eg: Germany is a major manufacturer of motor cars.

manuscript.eng_def: the original copy of a book or article before it is printed
manuscript.eg: He sent the 400-page manuscript to his publisher.

manuscript.eng_def: an old document or book written by hand in the times before printing was invented
manuscript.chi_def: （印刷術發明前的）手寫本，手抄本
manuscript.eg: It is thought that the manuscript is the work of a monk and dates from the twelfth century.

many.eng_def: used mainly in negative sentences and questions and with "too", "so", and "as" to mean "a large number of"
many.chi_def: 許多（主要用於否定句和疑問句中，或者帶有「too」、「so」和「as」 等的句子中）

map.eng_def: a drawing of the earth's surface, or part of that surface, showing the shape and position of different countries, political borders, natural features such as rivers and mountains, and artificial features such as roads and buildings
a drawing that gives you a particular type of information about a particular area
map.eg: He bought a map showing the population distribution of Scotland.

map.eng_def: something that shows the position of stars in the sky or the features on the surface of planets
map.chi_def: （標明恆星位置或行星表面特徵的）天體圖

map.eng_def: a very simple drawing that shows a direction of travel between one place and another
map.eg: I'll draw you a quick map if you're worried about finding the hotel.

map.eng_def: to represent an area of land in the form of a map
map.chi_def: 繪製…的地圖；在地圖上標示出
map.eg: Parts of the mountainous region in the north of the country have still not been mapped.

maple.eng_def: a type of large tree that grows in northern areas of the world, or the wood of this tree

mar.eng_def: to spoil something, making it less good or less enjoyable
mar.eg: Sadly, the text is marred by careless errors.

marathon.eng_def: a running race of slightly over 26 miles (42.195 kilometres)
an activity that takes a long time and makes you very tired
marathon.chi_def: 馬拉松式的活動，持久的活動
marathon.eg: The election broadcast, a nine-hour marathon, lasts until seven o'clock in the morning.

marathon.eng_def: used to describe something that takes a very long time and makes you very tired
marathon.chi_def: 馬拉松式的（形容一件事耗費很長時間，使人筋疲力竭）
marathon.eg: I had a marathon session marking 55 tests yesterday.

marble.eng_def: a type of very hard rock that has a pattern of lines going through it, feels cold, and can be polished to become smooth and shiny
a small ball, usually made of coloured or transparent glass, that is used in children's games
a children's game in which small, round glass balls are rolled along the floor

march.eng_def: an event in which a large number of people walk through a public place to express their support for something, or their disagreement with or disapproval of something
march.eg: She's going on a march on Saturday in protest over the closure of the hospital.

march.eng_def: a piece of music with a strong, regular beat, written for marching to
a walk, especially by a group of soldiers all walking with the same movement and speed
march.eg: It had been a long march and the soldiers were weary.

march.eng_def: If soldiers are on the march, they have started marching to a place.
the continuous development of a state, activity, or idea
march.eg: It is impossible to stop the forward march of progress/time.

march.eng_def: to walk somewhere quickly and in a determined way, often because you are angry
march.eg: She marched into my office and demanded to know why I hadn't written my report.

march.eng_def: to walk through a public place as part of a public event to express support for something, or disagreement with or disapproval of something
march.eg: Over four thousand people marched through London today to protest against the proposed new law.

march.eng_def: to walk with regular steps and keeping the body stiff, usually in a formal group of people who are all walking in the same way
march.eg: The band marched through the streets.

march.eng_def: to forcefully make someone go somewhere by taking hold of that person and pulling them there or going there together
march.eg: Without saying a word, she took hold of my arm and marched me off to the headmaster's office.

march.eng_def: the third month of the year, after February and before April
march.eg: The next meeting will be in March.

margin.eng_def: the amount by which one thing is different from another
margin.eg: The Senate approved the use of military force by a margin of 52 votes to 47.

margin.eng_def: the profit made on a product or service
margin.eg: Our increased profits are due to improved margins and successful cost control.

margin.eng_def: the empty space to the side of the text on a page, sometimes separated from the rest of the page by a vertical line
margin.eg: If I have any comments to make, I'll write them in the margin.

margin.eng_def: the outer edge of an area
margin.eg: The plant tends to grow in the lighter margins of woodland areas.

margin.eng_def: If someone is on the margins of a group of people, they are part of that group, but different in important ways, and if someone is on the margins of an activity, they are only slightly involved.
margin.chi_def: （某人）處於…的邊緣，對…稍有涉足
margin.eg: He spent the 1980s on the margins of British politics.

margin.eng_def: something that makes a particular thing possible, such as an extra amount of money, time, etc. allowed that makes it possible to deal with an emergency
margin.eg: There is not much margin for creativity in a job like this.

marginal.eng_def: very small in amount or effect
marginal.eg: The report suggests that there has only been a marginal improvement in women's pay over the past few years.

marginal.eng_def: of interest to only a few people
marginal.eg: articles about subjects of marginal interest

marginal.eng_def: A marginal political area or position in parliament can be won by only a small number of votes because support for the main parties is equally divided among the people voting.
marginal.chi_def: （選舉中僅以微弱多數取勝的）邊緣選區（或席位）
marginal.eg: The marginal Tory constituency was held by 2,200 votes.

marginal.eng_def: a marginal political area or position in parliament
marginal.chi_def: （議會的）邊緣席位；邊緣政治領域
marginal.eg: Labour lost two of the key marginals in London.

marine.eng_def: related to the sea or sea transport
marine.eg: The oil slick seriously threatens marine life around the islands.

marine.eng_def: a soldier who works closely with the navy and is trained especially for military operations on land that begin from the sea

mark.eng_def: a small area on the surface of something that is damaged, dirty, or different in some way
mark.eg: There were dirty marks on her trousers where she had wiped her hands.

mark.eng_def: a typical feature or one that allows you to recognize someone or something
mark.eg: Did your attacker have any distinguishing marks, such as a scar or a birthmark?

mark.eng_def: a symbol that is used for giving information
mark.eg: I've put a mark on the map where I think we should go for a picnic.

mark.eng_def: a judgment, expressed as a number or letter, about the quality of a piece of work done at school, college, or university
mark.eg: What mark did you get in the biology exam?
Sales have already passed the million mark.

mark.eng_def: an action that is understood to represent or show a characteristic of a person or thing or feeling
mark.eg: He took off his hat as a mark of respect for her dead husband.

mark.eng_def: to correct mistakes in and give points for a piece of work
mark.eg: I was up half the night marking exam papers.

mark.eng_def: to make a mark on something or someone
mark.eg: Make sure you don't mark the walls while you're moving the furniture around.

mark.eng_def: to represent or show a characteristic of a person or thing or feeling
mark.eg: The band's songs have always been marked by controversial lyrics.

mark.eng_def: to show respect for or commemorate
mark.eg: Tomorrow's parade will mark the 50th anniversary of the battle.

mark.eng_def: to show where something is by drawing or putting something somewhere
mark.eg: I've marked the route around the town's one-way system on the map.

mark.eng_def: to prevent a member of the opposing team from taking control of the ball by staying close to them all the time
used before a number to describe a particular version of a machine, especially one that is an improvement on the original version
mark.chi_def: （與數字連用表示機器改進後的）型號
mark.eg: The car has enjoyed modest success since its launch, but the Mark 2 version is expected to be far more popular.

mark.eng_def: used before a number to show what temperature you should use for cooking something in a gas oven
mark.chi_def: 溫度刻度（用於數字之前，顯示用煤氣爐烹飪某食物所需的溫度）

market.eng_def: the people who might want to buy something, or a part of the world where something is sold
market.eg: Are you sure there's a market for the product?

market.eng_def: the business or trade in a particular product, including financial products
market.chi_def: （金融等特定產品的）買賣，市場

market.eg: Thanks for the offer, but I'm not in the market for another car right now.
We put our house on the market as soon as house prices started to rise.

market.eng_def: a place or event at which people meet in order to buy and sell things
market.eg: Fruit and vegetables are much fresher from/at the market than in the supermarket.

market.eng_def: a shop that sells mainly food
to make goods available to buyers in a planned way that encourages people to buy more of them, for example by advertising
market.eg: Their products are very cleverly marketed.

marriage.eng_def: a legally accepted relationship between two people in which they live together, or the official ceremony that results in this
marriage.eg: They had a long and happy marriage.

marriage.eng_def: a marriage in which the partners have married, not because they love each other, but in order to get an advantage, such as the right to live in the other partner's country
marriage.chi_def: 基於利害關係的婚姻，權宜婚姻

marriage.eng_def: a combination of two or more things
marriage.chi_def: （兩個或以上事物的）融合物，結合體
marriage.eg: His music is a marriage of jazz, blues, and pop.

marry.eng_def: to become the legally accepted husband or wife of someone in an official or religious ceremony
marry.eg: Men tend to marry later than women.

marry.eng_def: to perform the ceremony of marriage as a priest or official
marry.chi_def: （牧師或官員）為…證婚，為…主持婚禮
marry.eg: The royal couple were married by the Archbishop of Canterbury .
a design which marries fun with function

marshal.eng_def: to bring together or organize people or things in order to achieve a particular aim
marshal.eg: The fighting in the city followed reports of the rebels marshalling their forces in the countryside.

marshal.eng_def: an official who is involved in the running of a public event
marshal.eg: Marshals struggled in vain to prevent spectators rushing onto the racetrack.

marshal.eng_def: someone who is involved in a public event, especially a famous person chosen to lead a parade
marshal.eg: The parade's grand marshal carried an elaborately carved staff.

marshal.eng_def: a government official who is responsible for putting the decisions of a law court into action
marshal.eg: US marshals specialize in finding fugitives and escapees.

marshal.eng_def: a title used for important officers in the armed forces of some countries
a title used for police or fire officers in some parts of the US
marshal.eg: The deputy state fire marshal led the arson investigation.

martial.eng_def: relating to soldiers, war, or life in the armed forces

marvel.eng_def: to show or experience great surprise or admiration
marvel.eg: We paused to marvel at the view.

marvel.eng_def: a thing or person that is very surprising or causes a lot of admiration
marvel.chi_def: 奇跡；令人感到驚奇的事物（或人）
marvel.eg: This miniature phone is the latest technological marvel from Japan.

marvelous.eg: He's done a marvellous job of the decorating.

masculine.eng_def: having characteristics that are traditionally thought to be typical of or suitable for men
masculine.chi_def: 男性的，男子氣概的；適於男子的

masculine.eng_def: belonging to the group of nouns, pronouns, etc. that are not feminine or neuter
masculine.eg: The French word for "sun"' is masculine but the German word is feminine.

mash.eng_def: to crush food, usually after cooking it, so that it forms a soft mass
mash.chi_def: 將（食物）搗成泥狀，把（食物）搗爛，搗碎
mash.eg: Mash the potatoes and then mix in the butter and herbs.

mash.eng_def: to violently crush part of a body or an object
mash.eg: His face was badly mashed up in the accident.

mask.eng_def: a covering for all or part of the face that protects, hides, or decorates the person wearing it
appearance or behaviour that hides the truth
mask.eg: The newspaper revealed the sordid truth behind his mask of respectability.

mask.eng_def: to prevent something from being seen or noticed
mask.eg: I've put some flowers in there to mask the smell.

mass.eng_def: having an effect on or involving a large number of people or forming a large amount
mass.chi_def: 大量的；大規模的；大批的

mass.eng_def: a large amount of something that has no particular shape or arrangement
mass.eg: The explosion reduced the church to a mass of rubble.
I've got masses to do at the weekend.

mass.chi_def: …的主要部分，…的主體；…的大多數
mass.eg: The mass of the people support the reforms.

mass.eng_def: a solid lump with no clear shape
mass.eg: The sauce was now a sticky mass at the bottom of the pan.

mass.eng_def: the ordinary people who form the largest group in a society
mass.eg: He was popular with the rich but failed to win the support of the masses.

mass.eng_def: the amount of matter in any solid object or in any volume of liquid or gas
mass.eg: The acceleration of a body equals the force exerted on it divided by its mass.

mass.eng_def: the total number of protons and neutrons in an atom
the difference between the mass of a nucleus (= central part of an atom) and the mass of the separate pieces that make up the nucleus
a religious ceremony in some Christian Churches based on Jesus' last meal with his disciples, or music written for parts of this ceremony
to come together in large numbers
mass.eg: Thousands of troops have massed along the border in preparation for an invasion.

massacre.eng_def: an act of killing a lot of people
massacre.eg: He ordered the massacre of 2,000 women and children.

massacre.eng_def: a bad defeat, especially in sport
massacre.eg: The manager resigned after the team's 7–2 massacre in the final.

massacre.eng_def: to kill many people in a short period of time
massacre.eg: Hundreds of civilians were massacred in the raid.

massacre.eng_def: to defeat an opponent very badly in a competition or election
massacre.eg: England was massacred 5–0 by France in the semifinal.

massage.eng_def: to rub and press someone's body with regular repeated movements, in order to relax them or to reduce stiffness or pain in the joints (= places where two bones are connected) or muscles
to try to make facts or numbers appear better than they really are in order to deceive someone
massage.eg: Television companies have been massaging their viewing figures in order to attract more advertising revenue.

massage.eng_def: the activity of rubbing or pressing parts of someone's body in order to make them relax or to stop their muscles hurting

massive.eng_def: very large in size, amount, or number

master.eng_def: the person who owns, cares for, and controls an animal
master.eg: With careful training, a dog will obey its master completely.

master.eng_def: a person who employs a servant or owns a slave
master.eg: Servants had to obey their masters.

master.eng_def: a person who has control over a particular situation
master.eg: She was the victim of her circumstances rather than the master of her fate.

master.eng_def: the captain of a ship that carries goods
master.eg: Ship's masters are in charge of a ship, its crew and any cargo it is carrying, at sea and in port.

master.eng_def: a person who is very skilled in a particular job or activity
master.eg: He was a master of disguise.

master.eng_def: a famous and very skilled painter
master.eg: This painting is clearly the work of a master.
Mr Wells was my Latin master at school.

master.eng_def: (in the UK) the head of some schools or university colleges
master.chi_def: （英國）學校的校長；大學學院的院長
master.eg: The Master of St. John's College will be launching the appeal.

master.eng_def: used before the name of a boy who is too young to be called "Mr"
master.chi_def: （稱呼年紀尚幼、不能被稱為「先生」的男孩時，置於名字之前）少爺
master.eg: the letter was addressed to Master John Owen.

master.eng_def: an original version of something from which copies can be made
master.eg: I sent her a copy and kept the master.

master.eng_def: to learn to control an emotion or feeling
master.eg: I finally mastered my fear of flying.

master.eng_def: to learn how to do something well

master.chi_def: 技術熟練的；技藝精湛的

masterpiece.eng_def: a work of art such as a painting, film, or book that is made with great skill
masterpiece.chi_def: 傑作；（個人）最傑出的作品
masterpiece.eg: Leonardo's "Last Supper" is widely regarded as a masterpiece.

masterpiece.eng_def: a skilful or impressive example of something
masterpiece.eg: Her press conference was a masterpiece of media manipulation.

mastery.eng_def: If someone has a mastery of something, they are extremely skilled at it.

mat.eng_def: a small piece of strong material that covers and protects part of a floor
mat.eg: Wipe your feet on the mat before you come inside.

mat.eng_def: a small piece of cloth, cardboard, or plastic that is put on a surface such as a table to protect it
a piece of thick rubber or other soft material used in some sports for people to lie on or fall onto
mat.eg: Please remember to bring a mat and a towel with you to the next aerobics class.

mat.eng_def: a thick layer of something, such as grass or hair, that is twisted together untidily
mat.chi_def: 一厚層（玻璃、毛髮等）；（結纏的）一團，一簇
mat.eg: The top few buttons on his shirt were open, revealing a mat of dark hair on his chest.

mat.eng_def: abbreviation for medication assisted treatment: the use of drugs such as methadone together with therapy in order to treat drug addiction
mat.chi_def: 藥物輔助治療（medication assisted treatment 的縮寫）
mat.eg: Pregnant patients in MAT can and do deliver healthy babies.

match.eng_def: a sports competition or event in which two people or teams compete against each other
the person who has scored the most points or played the best in a match
match.chi_def: 比賽中得分最多的人；比賽中表現最出色的人

match.eng_def: a short, thin stick made of wood or cardboard and covered with a special chemical at one end that burns when rubbed firmly against a rough surface
a person or thing that is equal to another person or thing in strength, speed, or quality
match.chi_def: 旗鼓相當的人（或物）；敵手

match.eng_def: to be less powerful or effective than someone or something else
match.eg: Gibson ran well but was no match for the young Italian.

match.eng_def: something that is similar to or combines well with something else
match.eg: The curtains look great - they're a perfect match for the sofa.

match.eng_def: If two people who are having a relationship are a good match, they are very suitable for each other.
match.chi_def: 般配的一對；相配的兩個人
match.eg: Theirs is a match made in heaven (= a very good relationship).

match.eng_def: to be as good as someone or something else
match.eg: It would be difficult to match the service this airline gives its customers.

match.eng_def: If two colours, designs, or objects match, they are similar or look attractive together.
match.eg: Do you think these two colours match?

match.eng_def: to choose someone or something that is suitable for a particular person, activity, or purpose
match.eg: In the first exercise you have to match each capital city to its country.

mate.eg: Peacocks use their beautiful tails to attract mates.
We've been mates since our school days.

mate.eng_def: used as a friendly way of talking to someone, especially a man
mate.chi_def: （尤用作男人間的友善稱呼）老兄，老弟，夥計
mate.eg: Have you got the time, mate?

mate.eng_def: a person who is employed to help a skilled worker
a type of officer on a trading ship rather than a military ship
mate.eg: He had worked as a ship's mate for ten years.

mate.eng_def: to have sex and produce young, or to make animals do this
mate.eg: Tigers mate repeatedly over a period of several days.

mate.eng_def: used to show that two people share a space or are involved in the same activity

material.eng_def: a physical substance that things can be made from
information used when writing something such as a book, or information produced in various forms to help people or to advertise products
material.eg: I'm in the process of collecting material for an article that I'm writing.

material.eng_def: cloth that can be used to make things such as clothes
material.eg: How much material will you need to make the skirt?

material.eng_def: equipment that you need for a particular activity
material.eg: "Do we need any writing materials?" "Only a pen and a pencil."

material.eng_def: relating to physical objects or money rather than emotions or the spiritual world
important or having an important effect
material.chi_def: 重要的，重大的；實質性的
material.eg: If you have any information that is material to the investigation, you should state it now.

materialism.eng_def: the belief that having money and possessions is the most important thing in life
materialism.eg: So have we become a self-centred society, preoccupied with materialism?

materialism.eng_def: the belief that only physical matter exists and the spiritual world does not

math.eng_def: the study of numbers, shapes, and space using reason and usually a special system of symbols and rules for organizing them

mathematics.eng_def: the study of numbers, shapes, and space using reason and usually a special system of symbols and rules for organizing them

matter.eng_def: a situation or subject that is being dealt with or considered
matter.eg: Could I talk to you about a personal matter?

matter.eng_def: the situation being dealt with or being discussed
matter.eg: Her resignation is not going to help matters.

matter.eng_def: used to say that something has made a bad or difficult situation worse
matter.eg: Three of our players were ill, and to make matters worse, our main scorer had broken his ankle.

matter.eng_def: If something is a matter of confidence, luck, waiting, etc. that is all you need for it to happen.
matter.eg: Baking a cake isn't difficult - it's just a matter of following the recipe.

matter.eng_def: to be very serious and not a situation that people should joke about
matter.chi_def: 須嚴肅對待的事，不是鬧著玩的
matter.eg: Being arrested by the police is no laughing matter.

matter.eng_def: the reason for pain, worry, or a problem
matter.eg: What's the matter? Why are you crying?
Some scientists believe that there is about ten times as much matter in the universe as astronomers have observed.

matter.eng_def: a substance of a particular kind
a substance or things of a particular type
used in expressions describing how small an amount or period of time is
matter.chi_def: （表示數量或時間之少）大約，左右
matter.eg: The interview was over in a matter of minutes.

matter.eng_def: to be important, or to affect what happens
matter.eg: We were late but it didn't seem to matter.

mattress.eng_def: the part of a bed, made of a strong cloth cover filled with firm material, that makes the bed comfortable to lie on

mature.eng_def: Mature people behave like adults in a way that shows they are well developed emotionally.
mature.eg: He's very mature for his age.

mature.eng_def: A mature decision is one that is made after a lot of careful thought.
mature.eg: Upon mature reflection, we find the accused guilty.

mature.eng_def: having a flavour that is completely developed
mature.eg: Do you prefer mild or mature cheddar?

mature.eng_def: A mature investment is ready to be paid.
to become more developed mentally and emotionally and behave in a responsible way
mature.eg: Girls are said to mature faster than boys.

mature.eng_def: If ideas, opinions, etc. mature, they reach an advanced or developed state.
mature.eg: It took several years for her ideas to mature.
Humans take longer to mature than most other animals.

mature.eng_def: to allow food and wine to become old enough for the flavour to develop completely
mature.eg: The wine has been matured in oak vats.

mature.eng_def: If an insurance agreement or an investment matures, it becomes ready to be paid.
mature.chi_def: （保險協議）期滿；（投資）獲得回報

maturity.eng_def: the quality of behaving mentally and emotionally like an adult
a very advanced or developed form or state
the state of being completely grown physically
maturity.eg: How long does it take for the chicks to grow to maturity?

maturity.eng_def: the time when an insurance agreement or investment becomes ready to be paid
maturity.chi_def: （保險合同或投資）到期，開始有回報
maturity.eg: The investment reaches maturity after ten years.

maximum.eng_def: being the largest amount or number allowed or possible
the largest amount allowed or possible
maximum.chi_def: 最大限度；最大量；最大值
maximum.eg: The temperature will reach a maximum of 27°C today.

may.eg: There may be other problems that we don't know about.

may.eng_def: used to ask or give permission
may.chi_def: （用於請求許可或表示允許）可以
may.eg: A reader may borrow up to six books at any one time.

may.eng_def: used to introduce a wish or a hope
may.eg: May you have a long and fruitful marriage.

may.eng_def: the flowers of the hawthorn tree
the fifth month of the year, after April and before June
may.eg: My mother's birthday is in May.

maybe.eng_def: used to show that something is possible or that something might be true
used to show that a number or amount is approximate
maybe.eg: There were 200, maybe 300, refugees on the boat.

maybe.eng_def: used to politely suggest or ask for something
maybe.eg: Maybe Ted would like to go.

maybe.eng_def: used to avoid giving a clear or certain answer to a question
maybe.chi_def: （用於不確定的回答）可能，也許

maybe.eng_def: used to mean that something is a possible explanation for why something else happened
maybe.eg: "Why were you chosen for the team and not me?" "Maybe it's because I've been to more practices than you."

mayonnaise.eng_def: a thick, white sauce made from oil, vinegar, and the yellow part of eggs, usually eaten cold
mayonnaise.chi_def: （油、醋和蛋黃調製而成的）蛋黃醬

mayor.eng_def: a person who is elected or chosen to lead the group who governs a town or city

meadow.eng_def: a field with grass and often wild flowers in it
meadow.eg: There was a path through the meadow to the village.

meal.eng_def: an occasion when food is eaten, or the food that is eaten on such an occasion
a substance that has been crushed to make a rough powder, especially plant seeds crushed to make flour or for animal food

mean.eng_def: to express or represent something such as an idea, thought, or fact
used to add emphasis to what you are saying
mean.eg: I want you home by midnight. And I mean midnight.
I'm sorry if I offended you - I didn't mean any harm.
These batteries are meant to last for a year.

mean.eng_def: to have an important emotional effect on someone
mean.chi_def: 對…具有意義，對…具有重大影響
mean.eg: It wasn't a valuable picture but it meant a lot to me.

mean.eng_def: not willing to give or share things, especially money
mean.eg: He's too mean to buy her a ring.
Stop being so mean to me!

mean.eng_def: frightening and likely to become violent
poor, dirty, and of bad quality
mean.eg: He was born in the mean streets of Detroit in 1945.

mean.eng_def: a mean number is an average number
the result you get by adding two or more amounts together and dividing the total by the number of amounts
a quality or way of doing something that is in the middle of two completely different qualities or ways of doing something
mean.eg: We need to find a mean between test questions that are too difficult and those that are too easy.

meaning.eng_def: The meaning of something is what it expresses or represents.
meaning.eg: The word "flight" has two different meanings: a plane journey, and the act of running away.
The birth of her first grandchild gave new meaning to her life.

meaningful.eng_def: intended to show meaning, often secretly
meaningful.chi_def: 富有意義的，意味深長的

meaningful.eg: She seems to find it difficult to form meaningful relationships.

means.eng_def: a method or way of doing something
means.eg: They had no means of communication.

means.eng_def: money, for example from an income, that allows you to buy things
means.eg: He has the means to buy half the houses in the street if he wanted to.

means.eng_def: to spend more money than you receive as income
to spend less money than you receive as income

meantime.eng_def: until something expected happens, or while something else is happening
meantime.eg: Your computer won't arrive till Thursday. In the meantime, you can use Jude's.

meanwhile.eng_def: until something expected happens, or while something else is happening
meanwhile.eg: Carl's starting college in September. Meanwhile, he's travelling around Europe.

measurable.eng_def: able to be measured, or large enough to be noticed
measurable.eg: The service produces clear, measurable benefits to people's health.

measure.eng_def: to discover the exact size or amount of something
measure.eg: "Will the table fit in here?" "I don't know - let's measure it."
The area, measuring/which measures five kilometres by three kilometres, has been purchased by the army.

measure.eng_def: to judge the quality, effect, importance, or value of something
measure.eg: There is no way of measuring the damage done to morale.

measure.eng_def: a way of achieving something, or a method for dealing with a situation
measure.eg: What further measures can we take to avoid terrorism?

measure.eng_def: a unit used for stating the size, weight, etc. of something, or a way of measuring

measure.eg: There was a large measure of agreement between the candidates.

measure.eng_def: an exact amount, especially of alcohol
measure.eg: One unit of alcohol is equal to half a pint of beer or a standard measure of spirits.

measure.chi_def: 小節；樂譜的小節線（同 bar）

measure.eg: Record sales are not always a measure of a singer's popularity.

measurement.eng_def: the act or process of measuring
measurement.eg: The test is based on the measurement of blood levels.

measurement.eng_def: a value, discovered by measuring, that correponds to the size, shape, quality, etc. of something
measurement.eg: The measurements of both rooms were identical.

measurement.eng_def: Your measurements are the sizes of various parts of your body, especially your chest, waist, and hips, that you refer to when you want to buy clothes.

meat.eng_def: the flesh of an animal when it is used for food

meat.eg: a buffet of cold meats and cheeses

meat.eng_def: important, valuable, or interesting ideas or information
meat.chi_def: 要點，實質；令人感興趣的內容
meat.eg: It was a nicely written article and quite amusing but there wasn't much meat to it.
