napkin.eng_def: a small square piece of cloth or paper, used while you are eating to protect your clothes or to clean your mouth or fingers

narrate.eng_def: to tell a story, often by reading aloud from a text, or to describe events as they happen
narrate.eg: Documentaries are often narrated by well-known actors.

narrative.eng_def: a story or a description of a series of events
narrative.eg: It's a moving narrative of wartime adventure.

narrative.eng_def: a particular way of explaining or understanding events
narrative.eg: There was pressure on academics to construct narratives of the period that were positive.

narrator.eng_def: the character who tells you what is happening in a book or film
narrator.chi_def: （書或電影中的）敘述者，講述者，旁白者

narrow.eng_def: having a small distance from one side to the other, especially in comparison with the length
limited to a small area of interest, activity, or thought
narrow.chi_def: （興趣、活動或思想）狹隘的，有侷限性的
narrow.eg: They are unable to see beyond the narrow world of the theatre.

narrow.eng_def: A narrow result is one that could easily have been different because the amount by which someone failed or succeeded was very small.
narrow.eg: The election was won by the very narrow margin of only 185 votes.

narrow.eng_def: a situation in which you avoid danger although you very nearly do not
narrow.eg: We got out in time but it was a narrow escape.

narrow.eng_def: to become less wide or to make something less wide
narrow.eg: The road narrows after the bridge.
The retailer's loss narrowed to $3 million from $10 million a year earlier.

nasty.chi_def: 糟糕的；令人不快的，讓人討厭的

nasty.eg: Don't be so nasty to your brother - he's four years younger than you!
In an emergency you could get out through a window, but it would be a nasty drop.
She said some really nasty things about him.

nasty.eng_def: to think that something bad is likely to happen or to be true
nasty.eg: I've got a nasty feeling that I forgot to tell Joe I couldn't come.

nation.eng_def: a country, especially when thought of as a large group of people living in one area with their own government, language, traditions, etc.
nation.eg: All the nations of the world will be represented at the conference.

nation.eng_def: a large group of people of the same race who share the same language, traditions, and history, but who might not all live in one area

national.eng_def: relating to or typical of a whole country and its people, rather than to part of that country or to other countries
someone who officially belongs to a particular country
national.eg: 30 people, including six Mexican nationals, were killed in yesterday's plane crash.

nationalism.eng_def: a nation's wish and attempt to be politically independent
a great or too great love of your own country
nationalism.chi_def: 愛國心；民族自豪感；民族優越感
nationalism.eg: The book documents the rise of the political right with its accompanying strands of nationalism and racism.

nationality.eng_def: the official right to belong to a particular country
a group of people of the same race, religion, traditions, etc.
nationality.eg: At the International School they have pupils of 46 different nationalities.

native.eng_def: relating to or describing someone's country or place of birth or someone who was born in a particular country or place
native.chi_def: 出生國的；出生地的；土生土長的
native.eg: She returned to live and work in her native Japan.

native.eng_def: used to refer to plants and animals that grow naturally in a place, and have not been brought there from somewhere else
native.chi_def: （動植物）原產於（某地）的，土生的
native.eg: Henderson Island in the Pacific has more than 55 species of native flowering plants.

native.eng_def: relating to the first people to live in an area
native.eg: The Aborigines are the native inhabitants of Australia.

native.eng_def: the first language that you learn
A native ability or characteristic is one that a person or thing has naturally and is part of their basic character.
a person who was born in a particular place, or a plant or animal that lives or grows naturally in a place and has not been brought from somewhere else
native.chi_def: 本地人；土生植物；本地的動物

native.eng_def: someone who lived in a country, especially in Africa, before Europeans went there

natural.eng_def: as found in nature and not involving anything made or done by people
natural.chi_def: 天然的，非人為的；非人造的

natural.eng_def: A natural ability or characteristic is one that you were born with.
Natural food or drink is pure and has no chemical substances added to it and is therefore thought to be healthy.
natural.chi_def: （食物或飲品）天然的，純的，無添加劑的

natural.eng_def: a parent who caused someone to be born, although possibly not their legal parent or the parent who raised them
natural.chi_def: 某人的親生母親／父親／父母

natural.eg: Of course you're upset - it's only natural.

natural.eng_def: (of a musical note) not sharp or flat
someone who was born with the right characteristics or abilities for doing a particular thing
natural.chi_def: 天生具有…才能的人，有…天賦的人
natural.eg: She won't have any troubles learning to ride a horse - you can see she's a natural.

naturalist.eng_def: a person who writes, paints, etc. in the style of naturalism
naturalist.chi_def: （文學、藝術等領域的）自然主義者

naturalist.eng_def: a person who studies and knows a lot about plants and animals

nature.eng_def: all the animals, plants, rocks, etc. in the world and all the features, forces, and processes that happen or exist independently of people, such as the weather, the sea, mountains, the production of young animals or plants, and growth
the force that is responsible for physical life and that is sometimes spoken of as a person
nature.eg: Feeling tired-out is Nature's way of telling you to rest.

nature.eng_def: the type or main characteristic of something
nature.eg: What was the nature of his inquiry?

nature.chi_def: 是正常的，是理所當然的
nature.eg: There are problems in every relationship - it's in the nature of things.
As a child, Juliana had a very sensitive nature.

naughty.eng_def: When children are naughty, or their behaviour is naughty, they behave badly or do not do what they are told to do.
naughty.chi_def: （兒童）淘氣的，調皮的，不聽話的
naughty.eg: Now that's naughty - don't throw food on the floor!

naughty.eng_def: used slightly humorously to describe an adult who has behaved badly or an adult's bad action
naughty.chi_def: （用於成人時略顯幽默）不守規矩的
naughty.eg: "I'm afraid I borrowed your car without asking." "Yes, that was very naughty of you - I needed it at the weekend!"
The film was shown on television but they cut out all the naughty scenes.

naval.eng_def: belonging to a country's navy, or relating to military ships

navel.eng_def: the small round part in the middle of the stomach that is left after the umbilical cord (= the long tube of flesh joining the baby to its mother) has been cut at birth

navigate.eng_def: to direct the way that a ship, aircraft, etc. will travel, or to find a direction across, along, or over an area of water or land, often by using a map
navigate.chi_def: （常指借助地圖）導航，確定…的方向
navigate.eg: Sailors have special equipment to help them navigate.

navigate.eng_def: to move around a website or computer screen, or between websites or screens
navigate.eg: Their website is fairly plain, but very easy to navigate.

navigation.eng_def: the act of directing a ship, aircraft, etc. from one place to another, or the science of finding a way from one place to another
navigation.eg: In the past, navigation depended on a knowledge of the positions of the stars.

navigation.eng_def: the act of moving around a website or computer screen, or between websites or screens
navigation.eg: We have streamlined our website for easier navigation.

navy.eng_def: the part of a country's armed forces that is trained to operate at sea
navy.eg: My brother is an officer in the Navy.
He was wearing a navy sweater.

near.eg: Is there a restaurant near here?
As the date of his operation drew near, he became more and more anxious.

near.eng_def: almost in a particular state, or condition
not close in distance, time, amount, or quality
near.chi_def: （距離、時間、數量或質量）遠遠沒有，遠非
near.eg: The house was nowhere near the beach.
They're the same age or near enough.

near.eng_def: not far away in distance, time, characteristics, or quality
near.chi_def: （距離、時間、特性或質量）近的，接近的

near.eng_def: Your near relatives are people who are closely related to you, such as your parents, brothers, or sisters.
at a time that is not far away
near.eg: All our computer equipment will be replaced in the near future.

near.eng_def: to get close to something in distance, time, or state
near.eg: I'm pleased to say the project is nearing completion.

near.eng_def: combines with adjectives and nouns to mean "almost"
near.chi_def: （與形容詞和名詞連用）幾乎，差不多
near.eg: We had a near-disaster this morning in the car!

nearby.eg: If there's a café nearby, we could stop for a snack.

nearly.eg: It's been nearly three months since my last haircut.
She's not nearly as beautiful as you said she was.

nearly.eng_def: much less than you want or need
nearly.eg: There's not nearly enough food for all these people!

nearsighted.eng_def: Someone who is nearsighted cannot see objects clearly that are far away.

neat.eng_def: tidy, with everything in its place
neat.eg: Your house is always so neat - how do you manage it?

neat.eng_def: Neat people like to keep themselves, their house, and their possessions tidy and in good order
neat.eg: Hassan is the neatest child I've ever met - even his shoes are clean!
That video game is really neat!
It would be a neat solution to the problem.

neat.eng_def: (of a strong alcoholic drink) without anything, such as water or ice or another drink, added to it
neat.eg: I'll have a neat gin, please.

necessary.eng_def: needed in order to achieve a particular result
necessary.eg: He lacks the necessary skills for the job.

necessary.eng_def: used in negatives and questions to show that you disapprove of something and do not think it should be used or done
necessary.chi_def: （用於否定句和疑問句表示不贊同）必要的，應該的
necessary.eg: I don't think that kind of language is necessary in a show that kids could be watching.

necessity.eg: You can come early if you want to, but there's no necessity for it.

necessity.eng_def: something that you need, especially in order to live
necessity.chi_def: 必需的東西；（尤指）生活必需品
necessity.eg: We brought only the bare necessities with us.

neck.eng_def: the part of the body that joins the head to the shoulders
neck.eg: He had the thickest neck I'd ever seen.

neck.eng_def: the part of a piece of clothing that goes around a person's neck
neck.eg: This sweater's too tight in the neck.

neck.eng_def: part of a hollow object that is at the top and is narrower than the part below it
a narrow part of a body part
neck.eg: cancer of the neck of the uterus

neck.eng_def: to kiss and hold a person in a sexual way

necklace.eng_def: a piece of jewellery worn around the neck, such as a chain or a string of decorative stones, beads, etc.
to kill someone by putting a burning rubber tyre around their neck
necklace.chi_def: 給（某人）戴火項鏈（把燃燒的橡皮輪胎套在脖子上將其燒死）

need.eng_def: to have to have something, or to want something very much
If you say that someone or something needs something else, you mean that they should have it, or would get an advantage from having it.
need.eg: What you need is a nice hot bowl of soup.
He needs to lose some weight.

need.eng_def: there is no reason for someone or something to do a particular thing
need.eg: You needn't worry - I'm not going to mention it to anyone.

need.eng_def: used, often when you are angry with someone, to say that they should not do a particular thing or that they have no right to do it
need.chi_def: （常用於表示氣憤） （某人）不該或（無權）做
need.eg: He needn't think I'm driving him all the way there!

need.eng_def: used to say either that someone did a particular thing although they did not have to, or that someone did not do it because they did not have to
need.eg: I gave her some extra money - I know I didn't need to but I thought it would be kind.

need.eng_def: it was not necessary for someone to have done a particular thing, although they did do it
need.eg: You needn't have washed all those dishes, you know - I'd have done them myself when I got home.

need.eng_def: the state of having to have something that you do not have, especially something that you must have so that you can have a satisfactory life
need.chi_def: 需求，需要；（尤指）生活需求
need.eg: Are you in need of help?

need.eng_def: the things that a person must have in order to have a satisfactory life
need.eg: Housing and education are basic needs.

need.eng_def: a feeling or state of strongly wanting something
need.eg: He seems to have a desperate need to be loved by everyone.

need.eng_def: not having enough money or food
need.eg: You just hope that the money goes to those who are most in need.
Help yourself to stationery as the need arises.

need.eng_def: If there is no need to do something, it is not necessary or it is wrong.
need.eg: There's no need to buy more food - there's plenty in the fridge.

needle.eng_def: a thin metal pin, used in sewing, that is pointed at one end and has a hole called an eye at the other end for thread
a very thin, hollow, pointed piece of metal that is connected to a syringe and used to take blood from the body or to put drugs or medicine in
on a compass or measuring device, the thin moving part that points in a particular direction or points to a particular measurement
needle.chi_def: （指南針或測量儀器上的）指針
needle.eg: The needle on a compass always points to magnetic north.

needle.eng_def: a thin, hard, pointed leaf of a pine tree
the part of a record player that touches the record as it turns around, usually made of a very hard material, such as a diamond
needle.eg: It sounds like the needle on your record player needs to be replaced.

needle.eng_def: to annoy someone, especially by repeated criticism
needle.chi_def: 惹惱，激怒；（尤指）不斷地數落
needle.eg: His mother was always needling him about getting a job.

needy.eng_def: poor and not having enough food, clothes, etc.
needy.chi_def: 貧窮的，缺乏生活必需品的
needy.eg: The proceeds from the sale go to help needy people in the area.

needy.eng_def: wanting too much attention and love
needy.eg: Sybil was very insecure and needy.
Let us pray for those who are not so fortunate as ourselves - the sick, the old, and the needy.

negative.eg: We received a negative answer to our request.

negative.eng_def: A negative sentence or phrase is one that contains a word such as "not", "no", "never", or "nothing".
negative.chi_def: （句子或片語）否定的，否定式的
negative.eg: "I've never seen him in my life" is a negative sentence.

negative.eng_def: not expecting good things, or likely to consider only the bad side of a situation

negative.eg: The warm winter has had a very negative effect/impact on the ski industry.

negative.eng_def: of the type of electrical charge that is carried by electrons
(of a medical test) showing that the patient does not have the disease or condition for which he or she has been tested
negative.chi_def: （醫學檢驗）結果為陰性的，結果為否定的

negative.eng_def: (of a number or amount) less than zero
not having the rhesus factor in the blood
negative.eg: Her blood type is O negative.

negative.eng_def: a piece of film from which a photograph can be produced, and in which light and dark areas appear the opposite to the way in which they appear in the photograph
a word or statement that expresses "no"
negative.eg: I didn't hear your answer, Ed - was that a negative?
He always looks for the negatives in any situation.

neglect.eng_def: to not give enough care or attention to people or things that are your responsibility
to not do something, often because you forget
neglect.eg: I'd neglected to give him the name of the hotel where I'd be staying.

neglect.eng_def: a situation in which you do not give enough care or attention to someone or something, or the state of not receiving enough care or attention
neglect.eg: Both parents were found guilty of neglect and their child was taken away from them.

negotiate.eng_def: to have formal discussions with someone in order to reach an agreement with them
negotiate.eg: The government has refused to negotiate with the strikers.

negotiate.eng_def: to manage to travel along a difficult route
negotiate.chi_def: 設法穿過，越過（難走的路段）
negotiate.eg: The only way to negotiate the muddy hillside is on foot.
The company's had some tricky problems to negotiate in its first year in business.

negotiate.eng_def: to get or give an amount of money in exchange for a financial document of the same value

negotiation.eng_def: the process of discussing something with someone in order to reach an agreement with them, or the discussions themselves
negotiation.eg: The agreement was reached after a series of difficult negotiations.

neighbor.eng_def: someone who lives very close to you
neighbor.eg: Some of the neighbours have complained about the noise from our party.

neighbor.eng_def: a country that is next to another country
neighbor.eg: The relationship between Scotland and its southern neighbour (= England) has not always been peaceful.

neighborhood.eng_def: the area of a town that surrounds someone's home, or the people who live in this area
neighborhood.chi_def: 鄰近地區；住宅區，街區；街坊，四鄰
neighborhood.eg: There were lots of kids in my neighbourhood when I was growing up.

neither.eng_def: not either of two things or people
neither.eg: We've got two TVs, but neither works properly.

neither.eng_def: used when you want to say that two or more things are not true
neither.eg: Neither my mother nor my father went to university.

neon.eng_def: a chemical element that is a gas with no smell or colour, does not react with other chemicals, and shines red when an electric current goes through it

nephew.eng_def: a son of your sister or brother, or a son of the sister or brother of your husband or wife

nerve.eng_def: a group of long, thin fibres (= structures like threads) that carry information or instructions between the brain and other parts of the body
the courage or confidence necessary to do something difficult, unpleasant, or rude
nerve.eg: It takes a lot of nerve to be a bomb disposal expert.

nerve.eng_def: worry or anxiety about something that is going to happen
nerve.eg: I never suffer from nerves when I'm speaking in public.
We really got on each other's nerves when we were living together.

nerve.eng_def: the ability to be calm in difficult situations
nerve.chi_def: 在困難的局面下保持冷靜的能力
nerve.eg: You need a cool head and steady nerves for this job.

nerve.eng_def: the rudeness to do something that you know will upset other people
nerve.eg: She's late for work every day, but she still has the nerve to lecture me about punctuality.

nerve.eng_def: to make yourself brave enough to do something
nerve.eg: It took her several months before she eventually nerved herself (up) to invite him to her house.

nervous.eg: Do you feel/get nervous during exams?
He suffers from a nervous disorder.

nest.eng_def: a structure built by birds or insects to leave their eggs in to develop, and by some other animals to give birth or live in
nest.chi_def: （鳥類或昆蟲的）窩，巢；（某些動物的）穴

nest.eg: One day the children grow up and leave the nest.

nest.eng_def: a place where something unpleasant or unwanted has developed
nest.eg: The diplomats have been sent home because their embassy has become a nest of spies.

nest.eng_def: a set of things that are similar but different in size and have been designed to fit inside each other
nest.eg: I'd like a nest of tables for the living room.

nest.eng_def: to build a nest, or live in a nest
nest.eg: We've got some swallows nesting in our roof at the moment.

net.eng_def: material made of threads of rope, string, wire, or plastic with spaces between them, allowing gas, liquid, or small objects to go through, or an object made with this material that is used to limit the movement of something
a rectangular piece of material made from string, used to separate the two sides in various sports
net.chi_def: （分隔開體育比賽中雙方的）球網
net.eg: If the ball touches the net during a serve in a game of tennis, you have to serve again.

net.eng_def: the area surrounded by a piece of material made from string into which a ball or puck is put in order to score points in various sports
net.eg: His penalty kick placed the ball decisively in the back of the net.

net.eng_def: to catch something using a net
net.eg: How many fish did you net this afternoon?

net.eng_def: to get something good or to earn a lot of money from something
net.eg: She netted herself a fortune when she sold her company.

net.eng_def: If you net the ball during a game such as football, you score a goal.
net.chi_def: 擊（球）入網，把（球）射入球門
net.eg: He secured a dramatic victory for England by netting the ball half a minute before the end of the game.

net.eng_def: left when there is nothing else to be taken away
net.eg: I earn $50,000 gross, but my net income (= income that is left after tax has been paid) is about $36,000.
I found a really useful website about allergies on the Net.

net.eng_def: network: the part of an internet address that shows it belongs to a network or a business
net.chi_def: （網際網路地址的一部分，表明其屬於一個網路或一家企業）

network.eng_def: a large system consisting of many similar parts that are connected together to allow movement or communication between or along the parts, or between the parts and a control centre
a number of computers that are connected together so that they can share information
network.eg: We've just spent £1.9 million on improving our computer network.

network.eng_def: to connect computers together so that they can share information
network.eg: Our computer system consists of about 20 personal computers networked to a powerful file-server.

network.eng_def: to meet people who might be useful to know, especially in your job
network.chi_def: （尤指工作中）建立關係網，建立人脈
network.eg: I don't really enjoy these conferences, but they're a good opportunity to network.

neutral.eng_def: not saying or doing anything that would encourage or help any of the groups involved in an argument or war
neutral.eg: If there's an argument between my daughter and her mother, it's important that I remain neutral.

neutral.eng_def: A neutral ground or field is a sports stadium that does not belong to either of the two teams taking part in a competition or game.
neutral.eg: The final will, of course, be played at a neutral ground.

neutral.eng_def: having features or characteristics that are not easily noticed
neutral.eg: Kelly wants dark red walls, but I'd like a more neutral colour like cream.

neutral.eng_def: A neutral chemical substance is neither an acid nor an alkali.
neutral.chi_def: （化學物質）中性的，既非酸性又非鹼性的
neutral.eg: Pure water is neutral and has a pH of 7.

neutral.eng_def: A neutral object in physics has no electrical charge.
neutral.eg: Atoms consist of positively-charged protons, negatively-charged electrons and neutral particles called neutrons.

neutral.eng_def: the position of the gears in a vehicle when they are not connected to the engine
neutral.eg: to leave the car in neutral

neutral.eng_def: a state of no activity or development
neutral.eg: After two years in neutral, the economy is finally moving forward again.
Sweden and Switzerland were neutrals during the war.

never.eng_def: not at any time or not on any occasion

nevertheless.eng_def: despite what has just been said or referred to
nevertheless.eg: I knew a lot about the subject already, but her talk was interesting nevertheless.

new.eng_def: recently created or having started to exist recently
different from one that existed earlier
new.eg: Have you met the new secretary?
to be new to the area
Used car sales have risen because of the increased cost of new cars.
This new cancer treatment offers hope to many sufferers.
Out with the old and in with the new.
The government's new-found enthusiasm for green issues has been welcomed by environmentalists.

newlywed.eg: The hotel has a special discount rate for newlyweds.

news.eng_def: information or reports about recent events
news.eg: That's the best (piece of) news I've heard for a long time!

news.eng_def: a television or radio programme consisting of reports about recent events
news.eg: Was there anything interesting on the news tonight?

news.eng_def: to tell someone about something bad that has just happened and may have an effect on them
news.eg: I was devastated when the doctor broke the news to me.

news.eng_def: to be someone or something that will affect a person or situation well/badly
news.eg: He's bad news for the company. He should never have been given the job.
They've been in the news a lot recently because of their marital problems.

newscast.eng_def: a radio or television programme that consists of news reports

newscaster.eng_def: someone who reads out the reports on a television or radio news programme

newspaper.eng_def: a regularly printed document consisting of large sheets of paper that are folded together, or a website, containing news reports, articles, photographs, and advertisements
newspaper.eg: Do you read a newspaper regularly?

newspaper.eng_def: an organization that publishes a newspaper
newspaper.eg: He wants to work for a newspaper when he graduates.
You'd better wrap that mirror up in newspaper before you put it in the car.

next.eng_def: being the first one after the present one or after the one just mentioned
next.chi_def: 下一個的；其次的；緊接著的
next.eg: Who works in the office next to yours?

next.eng_def: The time when you next do something is the first time you do it again
next.eg: When are you next going to Toronto?

next.eng_def: used when describing two people or things that are very close to each other with nothing between them
next.eg: Can I sit next to the window?

next.eng_def: used to mean `after' when making a choice or a comparison
next.chi_def: （用於作出選擇或比較時）僅次於，在…之後
next.eg: Cheese is my favourite food and, next to that, chocolate. (= Cheese is the only food that I like more than chocolate.)
They pay me next to nothing (= very little) but I really enjoy the work.

next.eng_def: next in order to appear or happen, often in some form of entertainment
next.eg: Next up is the latest news from the presidential campaign .

nibble.eng_def: to eat something by taking a lot of small bites
nibble.eg: Do you have some peanuts for us to nibble while the party warms up?

nibble.eng_def: to bite something gently and repeatedly

nibble.eg: Just take/have a nibble to see if you like the taste.

nibble.eng_def: small pieces of food that are eaten between or before meals, often with alcoholic drinks
nibble.chi_def: （在兩餐之間或餐前搭配酒精飲料吃的）點心，小吃
nibble.eg: I bought some crisps, nuts, and other nibbles.

nibble.eng_def: an expression of interest in something
nibble.eg: Our house was on the market for six months and there wasn't a single nibble.

nice.eg: Did you have a nice trip?
This orange is nice and juicy.

nice.chi_def: 好心的；友善的；有禮貌的
nice.eg: Jane's new boyfriend is a really nice guy.
I wasn't convinced by his nice distinction between a lie and an untruth.

nickel.eng_def: a chemical element that is a silver-white metal
a US or Canadian coin worth five cents

nickname.eng_def: an informal name for someone or something, especially a name that you are called by your friends or family, usually based on your real name or your character
nickname.eg: We always use the nickname Beth for our daughter Elizabeth.

niece.eng_def: a daughter of your brother or sister, or a daughter of your husband's or wife's brother or sister

night.eng_def: the part of every 24-hour period when it is dark because there is very little light from the sun
the period of time between the late afternoon and going to bed; the evening
night.chi_def: 晚上（指傍晚至就寢前的時段）
night.eg: Let's go out on Saturday night.

night.eng_def: the evening on which a special event happens
night.eg: When's the last night of your show?

night.eng_def: used as another way of saying good night, usually by or to children
night.chi_def: （通常為兒語或對孩子說的）晚安

night.eg: I saw Naomi at the gym the other night.

night.eng_def: an evening spent at a restaurant, theatre, etc. rather than staying at home
night.eg: I need a night out with the girls this weekend.

night.eng_def: a friendly way of saying goodbye when you leave someone in the evening or before going to bed or to sleep
night.chi_def: （晚上與人分別時禮貌地道別用語）晚安

nightingale.eng_def: a small, brown European bird known especially for the beautiful song of the male, usually heard during the night

nightmare.eng_def: a very upsetting or frightening dream
an extremely unpleasant event or experience or possible event or experience
nightmare.chi_def: 極不愉快的事情，可怕的經歷；可能發生的壞事
nightmare.eg: The whole journey was a nightmare - we lost our luggage and both flights were delayed.

nine.eg: The children go to bed at nine (o'clock).

nine.eng_def: describing or relating to work that begins at nine o'clock in the morning and finishes at five, the hours worked in many offices from Monday to Friday
nine.chi_def: （早九點到晚五點的）正常辦公時間的；朝九晚五的

nineteen.eg: Simson, aged nineteen, was convicted on two charges of burglary.

no.eng_def: not any; not one; not a
used in signs and on notices to show that something is not allowed

no.eg: "Did you feed the cat?" "No, I forgot."
The exam is no more difficult than the tests you've been doing in class.
"Did you get any replies about the camping weekend?" "So far we have two yeses, a no, and a maybe."

no.eng_def: a vote against a suggestion, idea, law, etc., or a person who votes no
no.eg: 14 ayes to 169 noes - the noes have it (= have won).

no.chi_def: 唐寧街十號，英國首相官邸（Number Ten的縮寫）

noble.eng_def: moral in an honest, brave, and kind way
belonging to a high social rank in a society, especially by birth
causing admiration because of a particular appearance or quality
a person of the highest social group in some countries

nobody.eg: Is there nobody here who can answer my question?
He's just some nobody trying to get noticed by the press.

nod.eng_def: to move your head down and then up, sometimes several times, especially to show agreement, approval, or greeting, or to show something by doing this
nod.chi_def: 點頭；（尤指）點頭贊同，點頭致意，點頭示意
nod.eg: Many people in the audience nodded in agreement.

nod.eng_def: a movement up and down with the head
nod.eg: Chen gave her a nod of recognition across the crowded room.

noise.eng_def: a sound or sounds, especially when it is unwanted, unpleasant, or loud
noise.chi_def: 噪聲；雜音；嘈雜聲；喧鬧聲
noise.eg: The noise out in the street was deafening.

noise.eng_def: any bad change in a signal, especially in a signal produced by an electronic device
noise.chi_def: （尤指電子設備的）干擾，干擾訊號
noise.eg: Using a single chip reduces (the) noise on the output signal by 90 percent.

noisy.eng_def: having an unwanted change in signal, especially of an electronic device
noisy.chi_def: （尤指電子設備的）干擾的，干擾信號的

nominate.eng_def: to officially suggest someone for an election, job, position, or honour
nominate.chi_def: （為選舉、工作、職位或榮譽）提名，推薦
nominate.eg: He's been nominated by the Green Party as their candidate in the next election.

nominate.eng_def: to say officially that a film, song, programme, etc. will be included in a competition for a prize
nominate.eg: The film was nominated for an Academy Award.

nominate.eng_def: to officially choose someone for a job or to do something
nominate.eg: She was nominated as the delegation's official interpreter.

nomination.eng_def: the act of officially suggesting someone or something for a job, position, or prize
nomination.eg: There have been two nominations for the new job.

nomination.eng_def: the act of officially choosing someone for a job or position
nomination.eg: the nomination of Elena Kagan to the Supreme Court

nominee.eng_def: someone who has been nominated for something
nominee.eg: All nominees for Treasurer will be considered.

nominee.eng_def: a person who is officially chosen for a position or job

none.eng_def: not one (of a group of people or things), or not any
none.chi_def: 沒有一個（人或事物）；全無
none.eg: None of my children has/have blonde hair.

nonetheless.eng_def: despite what has just been said or done
nonetheless.eg: There are serious problems in our country. Nonetheless, we feel this is a good time to return.

nonsense.eng_def: an idea, something said or written, or behaviour that is silly or stupid
nonsense.chi_def: 愚蠢的想法；謬論；胡扯；胡鬧
nonsense.eg: This report is nonsense and nothing but a waste of paper.

nonsense.eng_def: language that cannot be understood because it does not mean anything
nonsense.eg: The translation of the instructions was so poor they were just nonsense.

noodle.eng_def: a food in the form of long, thin strips made from flour or rice, water, and often egg, cooked in boiling liquid
the head or brain of a person
noodle.eg: Did that hit you on the noodle?

noodle.eng_def: to play a musical instrument without giving it full or serious attention
noodle.eg: I just sat at the piano noodling.

noon.eng_def: twelve o'clock in the middle of the day, or about that time
noon.eg: We used to ski before noon and then have a long lunch.

nor.eng_def: used before the second or last of a set of negative possibilities, usually after "neither"
nor.chi_def: 也不（通常與 neither 連用）
nor.eg: We can neither change nor improve it.
"I've never been to Iceland." "Nor have I."

norm.eng_def: an accepted standard or a way of behaving or doing things that most people agree with
norm.eg: Europe's varied cultural, political and ethical norms

norm.eng_def: a situation or type of behaviour that is expected and considered to be typical
norm.eg: One child per family is fast becoming the norm in some countries.

normal.eng_def: ordinary or usual; the same as would be expected

north.eng_def: the direction that goes towards the part of the earth above the equator, opposite to the south, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction
north.eg: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.

north.eng_def: the rich industrial countries of the world, most of which are above the equator
north.chi_def: （大多位於北半球的）北方發達國家

north.eng_def: the northern states of the middle and eastern part of the US
north.eg: The North defeated the South in the American Civil War.

north.eng_def: in or forming the north part of something
a wind coming from the north

north.eg: Go due (= directly) north for two miles.

north.eng_def: to or in the north of the country or region
north.eg: I live in London, but my relatives live up north, in Manchester.

northern.eng_def: in or from the north part of an area

nose.eng_def: the part of the face that sticks out above the mouth, through which you breathe and smell
the particular smell of a wine
nose.eg: a wine praised for its smoky nose

nose.eng_def: the front of a vehicle, especially an aircraft
nose.chi_def: （車輛的）前端突出部；（尤指飛機）機頭
nose.eg: The symbol was painted on each side of the plane's nose.

nose.eng_def: to look around or search in order to discover something, especially something that other people do not want you to find
nose.chi_def: 窺探，打探（尤指他人不欲公開的事）；搜尋
nose.eg: There were some reporters nosing about/around.

nose.eng_def: to (make a vehicle) move forwards slowly and carefully
nose.eg: The car nosed out of the side street, its driver peering anxiously around.

nostril.eng_def: either of the two openings in the nose through which air moves when you breathe
nostril.eg: The horses came to a halt, steam streaming from their nostrils.

not.eng_def: used to form a negative phrase after verbs like "be", "can", "have", "will", "must", etc., usually used in the short form "n't" in speech
not.chi_def: （用於 be，can，have，will，must 等動詞後構成否定表達，在口語中常簡略為n't）不

not.eng_def: used to give the next word or group of words a negative meaning
not.chi_def: （用於否定其後的單詞或詞組）不，沒有
not.eg: I told you not to do that.

not.eng_def: used after verbs like "be afraid", "hope", "suspect", etc. in short, negative replies
not.chi_def: （用於 be afraid， hope， suspect 等動詞後構成簡略的否定回答）不，沒有
not.eg: "Is he coming with us?" "I hope not."

not.eng_def: used to say what the situation will be if something does not happen
not.eg: I hope to see you there but, if not, I'll call you.

not.eng_def: used to express the possibility that something might not happen
not.chi_def: （用於表示某事也許不會發生）否，或許不
not.eg: Are you going to reply or not?

not.eng_def: sometimes used at the end of a statement to show that you did not mean what you have said
not.chi_def: （有時用於句末，表示所說非所想）才不是呢
not.eg: That was the best meal I've ever had - not!

notable.eng_def: important and deserving attention, because of being very good or interesting
notable.chi_def: 顯要的；顯著的；值得注意的
notable.eg: a notable collection of rare plants
Other notables among his pupils were the kings of Saudi Arabia and Thailand.

note.eg: He left a note to say he would be home late.

note.eng_def: a short explanation or an extra piece of information that is given at the bottom of a page, at the back of a book, etc.
note.chi_def: （頁底）注釋，說明；（書的）封底介紹

note.eg: The wind blew my notes all over the room.

note.eng_def: a single sound at a particular level, usually in music, or a written symbol that represents this sound
an emotion or a way of expressing something
note.eg: There was a note of caution in her letter.

note.eng_def: importance, or the fact that something deserves attention
note.eg: There was nothing of note in the latest report.
They noted the consumers' growing demand for quicker service.

note.eng_def: to give your attention to something by discussing it or making a written record of it
note.eg: He said the weather was beyond our control, noting that last summer was one of the hottest on record.

notebook.eng_def: a book of plain paper or paper with lines, for writing on
notebook.eg: She was jotting things down in a little notebook.

notebook.eng_def: a very small computer that you can carry easily

nothing.eg: There's nothing in the drawer - I took everything out.

nothing.eng_def: to be a matter or subject that someone has no good reason to know about or be involved with
nothing.eg: I wish he wouldn't offer advice on my marriage - it's nothing to do with him.

nothing.eng_def: to have no connection or influence with someone or something
nothing.chi_def: 與…毫不相干；對…無關重要
nothing.eg: We are nothing to do with the firm that has the offices next door.

nothing.eng_def: to have no importance or value

nothing.eg: I got this painting for nothing from a friend.

nothing.eng_def: with no good result or for no purpose
nothing.eg: He queued for two hours and (all) for nothing - there were no seats left.

nothing.chi_def: 未穿衣的，裸體的，一絲不掛的

nothing.eng_def: no arrangements for a stated period
nothing.chi_def: （在某時間段內）沒有安排的，有空的
nothing.eg: I checked my calendar and I have nothing on on Tuesday afternoon.
He had two letters of refusal but, nothing daunted (= not discouraged), he tried again.

nothing.eng_def: someone of no value or importance
nothing.eg: He's a nothing, a low-down, useless nobody.

notice.eng_def: to see or become conscious of something or someone
notice.eg: I noticed a crack in the ceiling.

notice.eng_def: to bring someone to the attention of the public, usually because of an unusual skill, etc.
notice.chi_def: （以出眾的才華）引起（公眾）關注
notice.eg: She was first noticed by the critics at the age of twelve, and went on to become a world-famous violinist.

notice.eng_def: (a board, piece of paper, etc. containing) information or instructions
notice.chi_def: 告示，佈告；啟事；公告牌，警示牌
notice.eg: There was a large notice on the wall saying "No Parking".

notice.eng_def: printed statements of opinion in the newspapers about plays, films, books, etc.
notice.chi_def: （報紙上關於戲劇、電影、圖書等的）評論
notice.eg: The musical has received wonderful notices.

notice.eng_def: information or a warning given about something that is going to happen in the future
notice.chi_def: 預告；事先通知；事前警告
notice.eg: The next time you visit, can you give me more notice?

notice.eng_def: the period of time that you must work after you have said that you are leaving your job, or after you have been asked to leave
notice.chi_def: （因辭職或解雇而終止雇傭合約的）通知期
notice.eg: Do I have to work out my notice?

notice.eng_def: to ask someone who works for you to leave their job, usually after a particular period of time
notice.chi_def: （通常指提前）向（某人）發出解僱通知
notice.eg: My boss gave me a month's notice.

notice.eng_def: to tell your employer that you intend to leave your job after a particular period of time
notice.chi_def: （事先）提出離職通知；遞交辭呈
notice.eg: I handed in my notice yesterday.
It has come to/been brought to my notice (= I have been told) that you have been late for work every day this week.
I asked him to drive more slowly, but he didn't take any notice.

noticeable.chi_def: 顯而易見的，明顯的，顯著的
noticeable.eg: There has been a noticeable improvement in Tim's cooking.

notify.eng_def: to tell someone officially about something
notify.eg: The school is required to notify parents if their children fail to come to school.

notion.eg: The show's director rejects the notion that seeing violence on television has a harmful effect on children.

notion.eng_def: cloth, pins, thread, etc. used for sewing, or a shop or a department of a large store that sells these
notion.chi_def: 縫紉用品；縫紉用品店；縫紉用品部

notorious.chi_def: 臭名昭著的，聲名狼藉的
notorious.eg: one of Mexico's most notorious criminals

noun.eng_def: a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality

nourish.eng_def: to provide people or living things with food in order to make them grow and keep them healthy
nourish.eg: Children need plenty of good fresh food to nourish them.

nourish.eng_def: If you nourish a feeling, belief, or plan, you think about it a lot and encourage it.
nourish.eg: Lisa has long nourished the hope of becoming a famous writer.

nourishment.eng_def: food that you need to grow and stay healthy
nourishment.eg: Young babies obtain all the nourishment they need from their mother's milk.

novel.eng_def: a long printed story about imaginary characters and events
new and original, not like anything seen before

novice.eng_def: a person who is not experienced in a job or situation
novice.eg: I've never driven a car before - I'm a complete novice.

novice.eng_def: a person who is training to be a monk or a nun

now.eng_def: at the present time, not in the past or future
now.eg: She used to be a teacher, but now she works in publishing.
I don't want to wait until tomorrow, I want it now!

now.eng_def: used to express how long something has been happening, from when it began to the present time
now.eg: She's been a vegetarian for ten years now.

now.eng_def: used in stories or reports of past events to describe a new situation or event
now.chi_def: （用於描述過去的新情況或新事件）此刻，這時候
now.eg: It was getting dark now, and we were tired.

now.eng_def: used when describing a situation that is the result of what someone just said or did
now.chi_def: （用於描述剛剛所說或所做之事的結果）這樣一來
now.eg: Oh yes, now I know who you mean.
The guests are coming any minute now, and the house is still a mess.

now.eng_def: used to introduce a new subject
now.eg: And now for what we're going to do tomorrow.

now.eng_def: used in statements and questions to introduce or give emphasis to what you are saying
now.chi_def: （用於陳述句和疑問句，引導後面的話或對其加以強調）
now.eg: Now, where did I put my hat?
Now isn't a good time to speak to him.

now.eng_def: from this moment and always in the future
now.eg: From now on the gates will be locked at midnight.

now.eng_def: used to give an explanation of a new situation
now.eg: Now I have my car, I don't get as much exercise as I used to.

nowadays.eng_def: at the present time, in comparison to the past

nowhere.eng_def: in, at, or to no place; not anywhere
nowhere.eg: These young people have nowhere (else) to go.

nowhere.eng_def: not in a successful or winning position
nowhere.eg: The horse I bet on finished nowhere.

nuclear.eng_def: being or using the power produced when the nucleus of an atom is divided or joined to another nucleus
relating to weapons, or the use of weapons, which use the power produced when the nucleus of an atom is divided or joined to another nucleus
nuclear.chi_def: 核武器的；使用核武器的

nuclear.eng_def: relating to the nucleus of an atom

nucleus.eng_def: the central part of an atom, usually made up of protons and neutrons
the part of a cell that controls its growth
nucleus.eg: DNA is stored in the nucleus of a cell.

nucleus.eng_def: the group of people or things that are the most important part of something
nucleus.eg: These three players will form the nucleus of a revised and stronger team.

nude.eg: She once posed nude for a magazine.

nude.eng_def: a picture or other piece of art showing a person who is not wearing any clothes
nude.eg: The exhibition includes several superb nudes.
The toddlers were running around the garden in the nude.

nuisance.eng_def: something or someone that annoys you or causes trouble for you
nuisance.chi_def: 惱人的事物（或人）；麻煩的事物（或人）
nuisance.eg: I've forgotten my umbrella - what a nuisance!

nuisance.eng_def: to cause trouble or to annoy other people

number.eng_def: (a sign or symbol representing) a unit that forms part of the system of counting and calculating
number.eg: 25, 300, and a billion are all numbers.

number.eng_def: a number that is used to mark a particular example of something
number.eg: They live at number 34 Orchard Street.
The number of people killed in traffic accidents fell last month.

number.eng_def: a number of a particular description
number.eg: Small numbers of children are educated at home.

number.eng_def: several of a particular type of thing
number.eg: I decided not to go, for a number of reasons.
On the trip, one of our number fell ill.

number.eng_def: a particular copy of a magazine
number.eg: Do you have last week's number of the New Yorker?

number.eng_def: a piece of clothing, especially a dress, that you admire
number.chi_def: （令人欣賞的）衣服，（尤指）連衣裙
number.eg: She was wearing a stylish Dior number.

number.eng_def: a person with a particular characteristic
number.eg: He's a real sexy number, don't you think?
Sing one of those romantic numbers.
He tried the usual/that old number about how his wife didn't understand him.

number.eng_def: to give something a number in a series and usually to write this number on it
number.eg: All the folders have been carefully numbered and filed away.

number.eng_def: If people or things number a particular amount, there are this many of them.
number.eg: After the hurricane the homeless numbered over 200,000.

numerous.eg: We have discussed these plans on numerous occasions.

nun.eng_def: a member of a female religious group that lives in a convent
nun.eg: a convent school run by Catholic nuns

nurse.eng_def: (the title given to) a person whose job is to care for people who are ill or injured, especially in a hospital
nurse.eg: He worked as a nurse in a psychiatric hospital.

nurse.eng_def: a woman employed to take care of a young child or children
to care for a person or an animal while they are ill
nurse.chi_def: 照顧，照料（患病的人或動物）
nurse.eg: He gave up his job so that he could nurse his mother at home.

nurse.eng_def: to spend a lot of time taking care of something as it grows or develops
nurse.eg: These young trees were carefully nursed by the head gardener.

nurse.eng_def: If you nurse an illness or injury, you rest until it gets better.
nurse.eg: Robert's in bed nursing a back injury.

nurse.eng_def: to hold a small child in your arms as a way of making them feel better
nurse.eg: She nursed the crying child on her lap.

nurse.eng_def: When a woman nurses a baby, she feeds it with milk from her breasts.
nurse.chi_def: 給（嬰兒）哺乳；給（嬰兒）餵奶

nurse.eng_def: to have a strong feeling or an emotion for a long time
nurse.eg: She had long nursed a passion for Japanese art.

nurse.eng_def: to hold a drink for a long time without drinking it
nurse.eg: Mark was sitting in the corner nursing an almost empty bottle of beer.

nursery.eng_def: a place where young children and babies are taken care of while their parents are at work
nursery.eg: Does Jake go to a nursery or a childminder?

nursery.eng_def: a room in a house where small children sleep and play
a place where plants and trees are grown, especially for sale
nursery.chi_def: （尤指商業目的的）苗圃，育苗場

nursery.eng_def: relating to the teaching of children who are between the ages of two or three to five years old
nursery.eg: Do you think the state should provide free nursery education?

nurture.eng_def: to take care of, feed, and protect someone or something, especially young children or plants, and help him, her, or it to develop
nurture.chi_def: 養育，培育（尤指幼兒或植物）
nurture.eg: She wants to stay at home and nurture her children.

nurture.eng_def: to help a plan or a person to develop and be successful
nurture.eg: As a record company executive, his job is to nurture young talent.

nurture.eng_def: to have a particular emotion, plan, or idea for a long time
nurture.eg: Winifred nurtured ambitions for her daughter to be a surgeon.

nurture.eng_def: the way in which children are treated as they are growing, especially as compared with the characteristics they are born with
nurture.chi_def: 教育，培養；（尤指）後天養育
nurture.eg: Which do you believe has the strongest influence on how children develop - nature or nurture?

nut.eng_def: the dry fruit of particular trees that grows in a hard shell and can often be eaten
a small piece of metal with a hole in it through which you put a bolt
nut.eg: Nuts and bolts are used to hold pieces of machinery together.

nut.eng_def: a person who behaves in a very silly, stupid, or strange way or an offensive term for a person who is mentally ill
nut.eg: What kind of nut would leave a car on a railway track?

nut.eng_def: someone who is extremely enthusiastic about a particular activity or thing
nut.eg: James is a tennis nut - he plays every day.
Come on, use your nut (= think clearly)!

nut.eng_def: the amount of money necessary to operate a business or cover your costs
nut.eg: With two houses, three cars and child-support payments, he just couldn't meet his nut, even with a second job.

nut.eng_def: to hit someone or something with your head
nut.eg: The guy turned round and nutted him.

nutrient.eng_def: any substance that plants or animals need in order to live and grow
nutrient.eg: It's good soil - full of nutrients.

nutrition.eng_def: the substances that you take into your body as food and the way that they influence your health
nutrition.eg: Good nutrition is essential if patients are to make a quick recovery.

nutrition.eng_def: the process of taking in and using food, or the scientific study of this
nutrition.eg: She's a professor of nutrition at Columbia University.

nutritious.eng_def: containing many of the substances needed for life and growth
nutritious.chi_def: 營養豐富的，營養價值高的

nylon.eng_def: an artificial substance used especially to make clothes, ropes, and brushes
women's nylon tights or stockings (= leg coverings)

o'clock.eng_def: used after a number from one to twelve to say the time when it is exactly that hour
o'clock.chi_def: （用於數字1至12後表示整點）…點鐘

oak.eng_def: a large tree that is common in northern countries, or the hard wood of this tree

oar.eng_def: a long pole with a wide, flat part at one end, used for rowing a boat

oasis.eng_def: a place in a desert where there is water and therefore plants and trees and sometimes a village or town
a calm, pleasant place in the middle of somewhere busy and unpleasant
oasis.chi_def: （繁忙、令人不適環境之中的）寧靜宜人之地
oasis.eg: Her office was an oasis of peace and sanity amid the surrounding chaos.

oath.eng_def: a promise, especially that you will tell the truth in a law court
oath.chi_def: （尤指法庭上的）誓言，誓約，宣誓
oath.eg: Medieval knights took an oath of allegiance/loyalty to their lord.

oath.eng_def: to have formally promised to tell the truth
oath.eg: The judge reminded the witness that she was under oath.

oath.eng_def: an offensive word, especially one that uses a name for God

oatmeal.eng_def: a type of flour made from oats
a thick, soft food made from oats boiled in milk or water, eaten hot for breakfast

obedience.eng_def: the fact that people or animals do what they are told to do
obedience.eg: He demands unquestioning obedience from his soldiers.

obedient.eng_def: doing, or willing to do, what you have been told to do by someone in authority
obedient.eg: Students are expected to be quiet and obedient in the classroom.

obey.eng_def: to act according to what you have been asked or ordered to do by someone in authority, or to behave according to a rule, law, or instruction
to behave according to a scientific principle
obey.eg: Falling objects obey the law of gravity.

obey.eng_def: If your body or part of your body does not obey you, it does not work in the way it should.
obey.chi_def: （身體或身體某部位）聽從使喚
obey.eg: She was so tired her legs just wouldn't obey her any longer.

object.eng_def: a thing that you can see or touch but that is not usually a living animal, plant, or person
object.chi_def: （可看見或可觸摸到的）實物，物體

object.eng_def: a noun or noun phrase that is affected by the action of a verb or that follows a preposition
object.eg: In the sentence "I like ice cream", "ice cream" is the object of the verb "like".

object.eng_def: a reason for doing something, or the result you wish to achieve by doing it
object.eg: The object of their expedition was to discover the source of the River Nile.

object.eng_def: the result that is wanted from an activity
object.eg: In today's session, the object of the exercise is to improve your interpersonal skills.

object.eng_def: someone or something that causes particular feelings in or actions by others
object.chi_def: （引發某種情感或行為的）對象
object.eg: He became an object of ridicule among the other workers.

object.eng_def: to feel or express opposition to or dislike of something or someone
object.eg: Would anyone object if we started the meeting now?

objection.eng_def: the act of expressing or feeling opposition to or dislike of something or someone
objection.eg: Her objection to/against the plan is based on incorrect facts.

objective.eng_def: something that you plan to do or achieve
objective.eg: Her main/prime objective now is simply to stay in power.

objective.eng_def: based on real facts and not influenced by personal beliefs or feelings
objective.chi_def: 客觀的；如實的；不帶個人感情的

obligation.eng_def: the fact that you are obliged to do something
obligation.eg: If you have not signed a contract, you are under no obligation to (= it is not necessary to) pay them any money.
I don't have time to do his work for him - I have too many obligations as it is.

oblige.eng_def: to force someone to do something, or to make it necessary for someone to do something
oblige.eg: The law obliges companies to pay decent wages to their employees.

oblige.eng_def: to please or help someone, especially by doing something they have asked you to do
oblige.chi_def: （尤指按別人要求的去做以）討好，幫助，為…效勞
oblige.eg: We only went to the party to oblige some old friends who asked us to be there.

oblong.eng_def: a flat shape with four sides and four angles of 90° and opposite sides of equal length
any object or shape that is longer than it is wide

obscure.chi_def: 無名的；鮮為人知的；默默無聞的
obscure.eg: an obscure island in the Pacific

obscure.eng_def: not clear and difficult to understand or see
obscure.chi_def: 費解的，晦澀的；模糊的，朦朧的；不清楚的
obscure.eg: Official policy has changed, for reasons that remain obscure.

obscure.eng_def: to prevent something from being seen or heard
obscure.eg: Two new skyscrapers had sprung up, obscuring the view from her window.

obscure.eng_def: to make something difficult to discover and understand
obscure.chi_def: 隱藏，掩蓋；使難理解，使晦澀
obscure.eg: Managers deliberately obscured the real situation from federal investigators.

observation.eng_def: the act of observing something or someone
observation.eg: close observation of nature/human nature/animal behaviour

observation.eng_def: the fact that you notice or see something
observation.eg: She has remarkable powers of observation (= is very good at noticing things).

observation.eng_def: a remark about something that you have noticed
observation.eg: The book is full of interesting observations on/about the nature of musical composition.

observe.eng_def: to watch carefully the way something happens or the way someone does something, especially in order to learn more about it
observe.eg: The role of scientists is to observe and describe the world, not to try to control it.
Jack observed a look of anxiety on his brother's face.

observe.eng_def: to make a remark about something
observe.eg: "I've always found German cars very reliable," he observed.

observe.eng_def: to obey a law, rule, or custom
observe.chi_def: 遵守，奉行（法律、規則或習俗）
observe.eg: People must observe the law. Nobody should be an exception.

observer.eng_def: a person who watches what happens but has no active part in it
observer.eg: observers of the political situation/political observers

obstacle.eng_def: something that blocks you so that movement, going forward, or action is prevented or made more difficult
obstacle.eg: The biggest obstacle in our way was a tree trunk in the road.

obstinate.eng_def: unreasonably determined, especially to act in a particular way and not to change at all, despite what anyone else says
obstinate.eg: He can be very obstinate at times.

obstinate.eng_def: used to describe a problem, situation, or thing that is difficult to deal with, remove, or defeat
obstinate.chi_def: 棘手的；難以清除的；難以克服的

obtain.eng_def: to get something, especially by asking for it, buying it, working for it, or producing it from something else

obtain.eg: Conditions of extreme poverty now obtain in many parts of the country.

obvious.eng_def: easy to see, recognize, or understand
obvious.chi_def: 清楚的；顯然的，明顯的；明白的
obvious.eg: It's obvious (that) she doesn't like him.

occasion.eng_def: a particular time, especially when something happens or has happened
occasion.eg: We met on several occasions to discuss the issue.

occasion.chi_def: 特殊場合；重大活動；盛會
occasion.eg: Sara's party was quite an occasion - there were over a hundred people there.

occasion.eng_def: an opportunity or reason for doing something or for something to happen
occasion.eg: The 200th anniversary of Mozart's death was the occasion for hundreds of special films, books and concerts.
He has, on occasion, made a small mistake.
Her refusal occasioned a lot of trouble.

occasional.eng_def: not happening or done often or regularly
occasional.eg: I play the occasional game of tennis.

occupation.eg: In the space marked "occupation" she wrote "police officer".
It seems to me his favourite occupation is eating.

occupation.eng_def: a situation in which an army or group of people moves into and takes control of a place

occupy.eng_def: to fill, exist in, or use a place or period of time
occupy.chi_def: 佔有，佔用，佔據（空間或時間）
occupy.eg: The rest of the time was occupied with writing a report.

occupy.eng_def: to keep someone busy or interested
occupy.chi_def: 使（某人）忙於；使（某人）感興趣
occupy.eg: On long journeys I occupy myself with solving maths puzzles.

occupy.eng_def: (of an army or group of people) to move into and take control and/or possession of a place

occur.eng_def: (especially of accidents and other unexpected events) to happen
occur.chi_def: （尤指事故及其他意外事件）發生
occur.eg: An accident involving over ten vehicles has occurred in the east-bound lane.

occur.eng_def: to exist or be present in, among, etc.
occur.eg: Violence of some type seems to occur in every society.

occurrence.eg: Street-fights are an everyday occurrence in this area of the city.

occurrence.eng_def: the fact of something existing, or how much of it exists
occurrence.eg: The study compares the occurrence of heart disease in various countries.

ocean.eng_def: a very large area of sea
ocean.eg: These mysterious creatures live at the bottom of the ocean.

ocean.eng_def: used in the name of each of the world's five main areas of sea
ocean.chi_def: （用於世界五大海域的名稱中）洋

octopus.eng_def: a sea creature with a soft, oval body and eight tentacles (= long parts like arms)

odd.chi_def: 奇怪的，古怪的；異常的；出人意料的
odd.eg: Her father was an odd man.
She does the odd teaching job but nothing permanent.

odd.eng_def: (of numbers) not able to be divided exactly by two
(of something that should be in a pair or set) separated from its pair or set
odd.chi_def: （指一對或一組事物中）單個的，單只的，不成對的
odd.eg: He's got a whole drawer full of odd socks.

odd.eng_def: used after a number, especially a number that can be divided by ten, to show that the exact number is not known
odd.chi_def: （尤用於可被10整除的數字後）大約，…多一點

odds.eng_def: the probability (= how likely it is) that a particular thing will or will not happen
odds.eg: If you drive a car all your life, the odds are that you'll have an accident at some point.

odds.eng_def: in gambling (= the activity of risking money guessing the result of something), a probability expressed as a number
odds.eg: The odds against my horse winning (= that it will not win)/on my horse winning (= that it will win) are a hundred to one.

odor.eng_def: a smell, often one that is unpleasant
odor.eg: Inside the room there was the unmistakable odour of sweaty feet.

of.eng_def: used to show possession, belonging, or origin
of.chi_def: （用於表示歸屬或來歷）…的，屬於

of.eng_def: used after words or phrases expressing amount, number, or a particular unit
of.chi_def: （用於表示數量、數字或某一單位的詞或片語之後）

of.eg: She has the face of an angel.

of.eng_def: used to refer to a particular date in a month

of.chi_def: 由…製成的；由…組成的；含有…的

of.eng_def: used to connect particular adjectives and verbs with nouns
of.chi_def: （用於連接特定的形容詞和名詞）

of.eng_def: used after an adjective when judging someone's behaviour
of.chi_def: （用於形容詞後表示對某人行為的評判）
of.eg: It was mean of you to mention her weight.
Speaking of Elizabeth, here she is.
the massacre of hundreds of innocent people
I liked the green one best of all .

of.eng_def: used in saying what the time is
of.eg: It's ten (minutes) of five (= ten minutes before five o'clock).

of.eng_def: used in expressions showing distance from something in place or time
of.chi_def: （表示空間或時間上的距離）離，距
of.eg: We live within a mile of the school.
They were robbed of all their savings.
I like to relax with a pipe of an evening.

off.eng_def: away from a place or position, especially the present place, position, or time
off.chi_def: （尤指離開當前所在地點或位置）離開，遠離
off.eg: He drove off at the most incredible speed.

off.eng_def: used with actions in which something is removed or removes itself from another thing
off.chi_def: （與表示動作的詞連用）去掉，除掉，移開
off.eg: Take your jacket off.

off.eng_def: (especially of machines, electrical devices, lights, etc.) not operating because of not being switched on
off.chi_def: （尤指機器、電器設備、燈等）切斷，停止運轉；斷電
off.eg: Make sure the computers are all off before you go home.

off.eng_def: (of money) taken away from the original price
off.chi_def: （錢）（從…）扣掉，減去
off.eg: You can get some money off if you pay cash.

off.eng_def: not at work; at home or on holiday
off.chi_def: 沒上班（的）； 在家休息（的），在休假（的）
off.eg: I'm going to take/have some time off to work on my house.

off.eng_def: in such a way as to be separated
off.chi_def: 分開，隔開
off.eg: The police have shut/closed off all streets leading to the city.

off.eng_def: in such a way as to be completely absent, especially because of having been used or killed
off.chi_def: （尤指因為被用完或被殺死而）消失，沒有
off.eg: It says on the bottle that it kills off all known germs.

off.eng_def: in such a way as to get rid of something
off.chi_def: 消除；去除，去掉
off.eg: We went out for a while to walk off some of our dinner.

off.eng_def: down or away from a place, position, or time, especially the present place, position, or time
off.chi_def: （尤指離開當前所在地點或位置）離開，遠離
off.eg: There was a "Keep off the grass" sign.

off.eng_def: used with actions in which something is removed or removes itself from another thing
off.chi_def: （與表示動作的詞連用）去掉，除掉，移開
off.eg: I can't get the lid off this jar.

off.eng_def: not liking or taking something or someone
off.chi_def: 對…不喜歡；對…不接受
off.eg: He's been off his food ever since he had the stomach upset.

off.eng_def: near to
off.chi_def: 靠近，離…不遠
off.eg: He lives just off the main road.

off.eng_def: (of an arranged event) stopped or given up
off.chi_def: （安排好的活動）終止的，取消的
off.eg: The wedding's off - she's decided she's too young to settle down.

off.eng_def: having a particular amount or number, especially of money
off.chi_def: （尤指錢）有一定數量的
off.eg: Andrew must be so well-off (= rich) by now.

off.eng_def: below the usual standard or rate
off.chi_def: 低於一般標準（的）；不如平常（的）
off.eg: I'm having an off day today - I just can't seem to do anything right!

off.eng_def: (of food and drink) no longer fresh or good to eat or drink because of being too old
off.chi_def: （食物和飲料）壞了的，不新鮮的，變質的
off.eg: This milk smells off.

off.eng_def: (of food in a restaurant) not available at that particular time
off.chi_def: （餐館的食物）售完了的，不供應的
off.eg: I'm sorry, sir, the salmon is off.

off.eng_def: not thinking or worrying about other people's feelings; rude
off.chi_def: 漠不關心的，冷漠的，無情的；粗魯的
off.eg: He didn't even call her on her birthday - I thought that was a bit off.

off.eng_def: the act of leaving somewhere
off.chi_def: 走，離開
off.eg: Are we ready for the off, then?

off.eng_def: to kill someone
off.chi_def: 殺死
off.eg: They offed him and dumped his body in the swamp.

offend.eng_def: to make someone upset or angry
offend.eg: I think she was offended that she hadn't been invited to the party.
Obviously if a police officer offends it's a fairly serious matter.

offensive.eg: This programme contains language that some viewers might find offensive.
Since the other side had taken offensive action (= attacked), we had no choice but to defend ourselves.
They launched the land offensive in the middle of the night.

offer.eng_def: to ask someone if they would like to have something or if they would like you to do something
offer.chi_def: 主動給予；主動提出；提議
offer.eg: I feel bad that I didn't offer them any food/offer any food to them.

offer.eng_def: to say a prayer or make a sacrifice (= an act of killing or giving up something) to a god
offer.eg: Dear Lord, we offer up our prayers...
It's an organization that offers free legal advice to people on low incomes.

offer.eng_def: the act of asking if someone would like to have something or if they would like you to do something
offer.eg: "If you like I can help out." "That's a very kind offer."

offer.eng_def: to say officially that you would like to buy something, especially a house, at a particular price
offer.eg: They were asking €180,000 for the apartment, so I put in an offer of €170,000.

offer.eng_def: a reduction in the usual price of sth, usually for a short period
offer.eg: Don't miss out on our latest offer.

offer.eng_def: available to be bought or used
offer.eg: We were amazed at the range of products on offer.

offer.eng_def: If goods in a shop are on (special) offer, they are being sold at a lower price than usual.
offer.chi_def: 削價出售的，特價銷售的，特惠出售的

offer.eng_def: If a house is under offer, someone has already suggested a particular price at which they would be willing to buy it.
offer.chi_def: （房子）已有人出價的，在洽售中的

offering.eng_def: something that you give or offer to someone

office.eng_def: a room or part of a building in which people work, especially sitting at tables with computers, phones, etc., usually as a part of a business or other organization

office.eg: They have offices in Paris, London, and Madrid.

office.eng_def: a place where you can go to ask advice from or receive treatment from a doctor or dentist
office.eg: The doctor does not make house calls - you will have to come to her office.

office.eng_def: a position of authority and responsibility in a government or other organization
a department of the national government in Britain, or an official government organization
office.chi_def: （英國政府或其他政府組織的）部，局

officer.eng_def: a person in the armed forces who has a position of authority
a person who has a position of authority in an organization
a member of the police force
officer.eg: Two officers responded to the call at 282 Main Street.

official.eng_def: relating to a position of responsibility
official.eg: He visited China in his official capacity as America's trade representative.

official.eng_def: agreed to or arranged by people in positions of authority
official.eg: the official photos of the president's tour of India

official.eng_def: If a piece of information is official, it has been announced publicly with authority.
official.chi_def: 公開的；公佈的；據官方的

official.eng_def: a person who has a position of responsibility in an organization

offspring.eg: In the case of the guinea pig, the number of offspring varies between two and five.
Tom's sister came over on Saturday with all her offspring.

often.eg: I often see him in the garden.

oil.eng_def: petroleum (= the black oil obtained from under the earth's surface from which petrol comes)
a thick liquid that comes from petroleum, used as a fuel and for making parts of machines move easily
a smooth thick liquid produced from plants or animals that is used in cooking
a smooth thick liquid that is used to improve the appearance or quality of the skin or hair
thick paints with an oil base, used for painting pictures
oil.eg: Do you paint in oils or watercolours?

oil.eng_def: to put oil on something, especially a machine, usually to make it work more easily without sticking
oil.chi_def: 給（尤指機器）上油，給…上潤滑油

okay.eng_def: used to show that you agree with something or agree to do something
okay.chi_def: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
okay.eg: "I'll pay you back tomorrow." "OK, no problem."

okay.eng_def: used to check that someone understands something or that they agree to something
okay.chi_def: （用於確認某人是否明白或同意某事）明白嗎？好嗎？
okay.eg: You need to add more vinegar, OK?

okay.eng_def: used as a way of showing that you are going to take action or start something new
okay.chi_def: （用於表示打算行動或開始新的活動）行，好吧

okay.eng_def: used in the middle of a sentence as a way of pausing
okay.eg: We saw these guys, okay, so we went up to them and started talking.

okay.chi_def: 可以的，同意的；能接受的，可行的
okay.eg: Is it okay if I bring a friend to the party?

okay.eng_def: in a satisfactory state or of a satisfactory quality
okay.chi_def: 令人滿意的；可以的；不錯的
okay.eg: How's Paula? Is she okay after her fall yesterday?

okay.eng_def: not bad but certainly not good
okay.chi_def: 還可以的，還行的，湊合的
okay.eg: "Did you have a good dinner out last night?" "It was okay - I've definitely had better."
Everything was going OK until the printer stopped working.
Have the committee OK'd your proposal?
He got the OK to go ahead with his project.

okay.eng_def: written abbreviation for the US state of Oklahoma: used in addresses
okay.chi_def: （美國）奧克拉荷馬州，奧克拉何馬州（寫地址時Oklahoma的縮寫）

old.eng_def: having lived or existed for many years
unsuitable because intended for older people
old.chi_def: （因目標使用者為年齡更大一些的人而）不適合的
old.eg: Don't you think that book is too old for you?

old.eng_def: used to describe or ask about someone's age
from a period in the past
old.chi_def: 過去的；舊時的，從前的，以前的
old.eg: I saw my old English teacher last time I went home.

old.eng_def: a language when it was in an early stage in its development
(especially of a friend) known for a long time
old.eg: She's one of my oldest friends - we met in kindergarten.

old.eng_def: used before someone's name when you are referring to or talking to them, to show that you know that person well and like them
old.chi_def: （用於人名前表示親密、熟悉的稱呼）老…
old.eg: There's old Sara working away in the corner.

old.eng_def: old people considered together as a group
old.eg: These cuts in services will particularly affect the old.

olive.eng_def: a small bitter green or black fruit that is eaten or used to produce oil, or a Mediterranean tree on which this fruit grows

omit.eng_def: to fail to include or do something
omit.eg: She was omitted from the list of contributors to the report.

on.eng_def: used to show that something is in a position above something else and touching it, or that something is moving into such a position
on.eg: Look at all the books on your desk!

on.eng_def: covering the surface of, being held by, or connected to something
on.eg: There's blood on your shirt.

on.eng_def: used to show when something happens
on.eg: Hair salons don't usually open on Sundays.

on.eng_def: used to show where something has been written, printed, or drawn
on.eg: Which page is that curry recipe on?

on.eng_def: used for showing some methods of travelling
on.eg: I love travelling on trains.

on.eng_def: used to show that a condition or process is being experienced
on.eg: He accidentally set his bed on fire.

on.eng_def: used to show the form in which something is recorded or performed
on.chi_def: （記錄、錄製或演出）以…方式，透過，使用
on.eg: How much data can you store on the flash drive?

on.eng_def: used to show what causes pain or injury as a result of being touched
on.eg: I hit my head on the shelf as I was standing up.

on.eng_def: to or towards
on.eg: Our house is the first on the left after the post office.

on.eng_def: relating to
on.eg: a book on pregnancy

on.eng_def: used to show something for which a payment is made
on.eg: He spent €180 on a hat.

on.eng_def: used to show a person or thing that is necessary for something to happen or that is the origin of something
on.eg: We're relying on you.

on.eng_def: used to show when someone is involved or taking part in something
on.chi_def: （表示牽涉或參與其中）在從事…
on.eg: I'm working on a new book.

on.eng_def: used to show what is providing financial support or an income
on.eg: I only have $70 a week to live on at the moment.

on.eng_def: used to show something that is used as food, fuel, or a drug
on.eg: What do mice live on?

on.eng_def: next to or along the side of
on.eg: It's a small town on the Mississippi River.

on.eng_def: used to show when someone is a member of a group or organization
on.eg: Have you ever served on a jury?

on.eng_def: used when referring to a tool, instrument, or system that is used to do something
on.eg: I do all my household accounts on the computer.

on.eng_def: used to show when something is repeated one or more times
on.eg: The government suffered defeat on defeat in the local elections.

on.eng_def: used when making a comparison
on.eg: That's my final offer, and I can't improve on it.

on.eng_def: used to show when someone has something in a pocket or in a bag that they are carrying
on.eg: Do you have a spare pen on you?

on.eng_def: happening after and usually because of
on.eg: Acting on information given to them anonymously, the police arrested him.

on.eng_def: used to show who is paying for something
on.eg: Dinner meal is on me.

on.eng_def: used to show who suffers when something does not operate as it should
on.chi_def: （表示運轉出故障時受影響的人）
on.eg: The phone suddenly went dead on me.

on.eng_def: used to show the number of points a person or team has in a competition
on.eg: Clive's team is on five points while Joan's is on seven.

on.eng_def: on your body or someone's body
on.eg: It's very cold so put a coat on.

on.eng_def: covering the surface of something or connected to something
on.eg: Screw the lid on tightly.

on.eng_def: used to show when something is operating or starting to operate
on.chi_def: 開著；在工作中；開始運行
on.eg: Could you switch on the radio?

on.eng_def: continuing or not stopping
on.eg: If her phone's busy, keep on trying.

on.eng_def: into a bus, train, plane, etc., or in the correct position to start using some other method of travelling
on.chi_def: 上（公車、火車、飛機等交通工具）
on.eg: The train suddenly started moving as I was getting on.

on.eng_def: performing
on.eg: Hurry up with the make-up - I'm on in ten minutes.

on.eng_def: continuing forward in time or space
on.eg: They never spoke to each other from that day on (= after that day).

on.eng_def: happening or planned
on.chi_def: 正在發生；根據預定計劃
on.eg: Is the party still on for tomorrow?

on.eng_def: used when talking about the position of one thing compared with the position of another
on.eg: It's amazing nobody was injured because the two buses crashed head on (= the front parts of the buses hit each other).

once.eg: I went sailing once, but I didn't like it.
They all started talking at once.

once.eng_def: used when something happens that does not usually happen
once.eg: For once, the bus came on time.

once.eng_def: used to say that you will only do or request something on this particular occasion
once.eg: All right, I'll lend you the money - just this once.
Once again, racist attacks are increasing across Europe.
I'd like to visit the campus once more before we leave.
When my father came home, everything felt right once more.
I've seen him once or twice in town.
We meet for lunch once in a while.

once.eng_def: completely and in a way that will finally solve a problem
once.chi_def: 徹底了結地；一勞永逸地
once.eg: Our intention is to destroy their offensive capability once and for all.

once.eng_def: only likely to happen once in a person's life
once.chi_def: 一生只有一次；千載難逢地；難得地
once.eg: An opportunity as good as this arises once in a lifetime.
I've only played rugby the once, and I never want to play it again.

once.eng_def: in the past, but not now
once.eg: This house once belonged to my grandfather.

once.eng_def: as soon as, or from the moment when
once.eg: Once I've found somewhere to live I'll send you my address.
I knew at once that I'd like it here.

one.eg: He had two slices and I only had one.

one.eng_def: a member of a group of people or things
one.chi_def: （一群人或事物）中的一個，之一
one.eg: One of their daughters has just had a baby.

one.eng_def: used to refer to a time in the future that is not yet decided
one.chi_def: （用於指將來某個未確定的時間）某一
one.eg: Why don't we meet for lunch one day next week?

one.eng_def: used to refer to a particular occasion while avoiding stating the exact moment
one.eg: One night we stayed up talking till dawn.

one.eng_def: a single thing; not two or more
one.eg: Eat them one at a time (= separately).

one.eng_def: combined in a single person or object
one.chi_def: 集於一體，合為一體；兼具
one.eg: With this model you get a radio, CD player, and MP3 dock all in one.

one.eng_def: used when saying there is no other person or thing
one.eg: He's the one person you can rely on in an emergency.

one.eng_def: used before the name of someone who is not known
one.chi_def: （用於不認識的人的名字前）某一個
one.eg: Her solicitor is one John Wintersgill.
His mother is one (= a very) generous woman.

one.eng_def: used to refer to a particular thing or person within a group or range of things or people that are possible or available
one.chi_def: （一群人或一批東西中的）一個
one.eg: I have a few books on Chinese food. You can borrow one if you want.
I'm not one to criticize other people, as you know.
I've never been one for staying out late.

one.eng_def: used to talk about one person or thing compared with other similar or related people or things
one.chi_def: （表示與另一類似或相關的人或物相對照的）一個
one.eg: They look so similar it's often difficult to distinguish one from the other.

one.eng_def: any person, but not a particular person
one.eg: One has an obligation to one's friends.

one.chi_def: （講話者或筆者用於自稱）我，本人
one.eg: Of course, one (= I) would be delighted to dine with the Queen.

onion.eng_def: a vegetable with a strong smell and flavour, made up of several layers surrounding each other tightly in a round shape, usually brown or red on the outside and white inside
onion.eg: I always cry when I'm chopping onions.

only.eng_def: used to show that there is a single one or very few of something, or that there are no others
only.eg: I was the only person on the train.

only.eng_def: used to show that something is limited to not more than, or is not anything other than, the people, things, amount, or activity stated
only.eg: At present these televisions are only available in Japan.
