only.eng_def: used to refer to something that happens almost immediately after something else
only.eg: People were leaving and I'd only just arrived.
There was only just enough food to go round.

only.eng_def: used to say that two related things are true or happened, especially when this is surprising or shocking
only.eg: Not only did he turn up late, he also forgot his books.

only.eng_def: If you say you have only (got) to do something, you mean that it is all you need to do in order to achieve something else.
only.eg: If you want any help, you have only to ask.

only.eng_def: used when saying that something unpleasant will happen as a result of an action or a failure to act
only.chi_def: （表示由於某個行動或未能採取行動而導致不好的事情發生）只，只會
only.eg: If you don't do something about it now it will only get worse.

only.eng_def: used to show that you feel sorry about something that cannot happen when explaining why it cannot happen
only.eg: I'd love to go to Australia. I only wish I could afford to.

only.eng_def: used to emphasize what you are hoping or wishing for
only.eg: I only hope you know what you're doing.

only.eng_def: used to show that you think someone has done something silly
only.chi_def: （表示認為某人做了傻事）不過，只是
only.eg: She's only locked herself out of her flat again!

only.eng_def: used to show what is the single or main reason why something mentioned in the first part of the sentence cannot be performed or is not completely true
only.eg: I'd invite Frances to the party, only (= but I will not because) I don't want her husband to come.

onto.eng_def: used to show movement into or on a particular place
onto.eg: I slipped as I stepped onto the platform.

onto.eng_def: used about changing to, or starting to talk about, a different subject
onto.chi_def: （用於表示開始談論另一話題）
onto.eg: How did we get onto this subject?
Hold onto my hand and you'll be perfectly safe.

onto.eng_def: knowing about someone or something that can be useful to you
onto.chi_def: 知道，了解，發現（能從中獲益的人或事物）
onto.eg: You're onto a good thing with this buy-one-get-one-free deal.

onto.eng_def: knowing about something bad someone has done
onto.chi_def: 知道，發現（某人做了壞事）

onto.eng_def: If you are onto someone, you talk to that person, especially to ask them to do something, or to complain to them.
onto.chi_def: 跟…說（尤指要求某人做事或向其抱怨）
onto.eg: I must get onto the plumber about the shower.

onto.eng_def: used about someone or something that is added to or joins a particular thing
onto.chi_def: 某人加入；某事物被添加
onto.eg: Imir's been voted onto the union committee.

open.eng_def: ready to be used or ready to provide a service
open.eg: The supermarket is open till 8.00 p.m.

open.chi_def: 沒有圍上的，敞開的；開闊的；無遮蓋的
open.eg: It's not a good idea to camp in the middle of an open field (= one which is not covered with trees, bushes, etc.).

open.eng_def: If a computer document or program is open, it is ready to be read or used.
open.chi_def: （電腦文檔或程式）打開的，已啟動的
open.eg: Make sure you have both files open at the same time.

open.chi_def: 可利用的；可得到的；沒有限制的
open.eg: There are still several possibilities open to you.

open.chi_def: 不保密的；公開的；毫不掩飾的
open.eg: There has been open hostility between them ever since they had that argument last summer.

open.eng_def: honest and not trying to keep things secret
open.chi_def: 坦誠的；坦率的；毫不隱諱的
open.eg: He's very open about his weaknesses.

open.chi_def: 尚未決定的，正在考慮中的；不確定的
open.eg: We don't have to make a firm decision yet. Let's leave it open.
I would like to open my talk by giving a brief background to the subject.

open.eng_def: to move something to a position that is not closed, or to make something change to a position that is not closed
open.eg: Could you open the window, please?

open.eng_def: to remove or separate part of a container or parcel so that you can see or use what it contains
open.chi_def: 開，開啟，打開，揭開（包裝或容器）
open.eg: Don't open a new bottle just for me.

open.eng_def: If a shop or office opens at a particular time of day, it starts to do business at that time.
open.chi_def: 開門，開始營業；開始辦公
open.eg: The coffee shop opens at ten o'clock.

open.eng_def: If someone, usually someone important, opens a building, event, etc., they officially say that it is ready to be used or to start operating.
open.chi_def: （通常指要人）宣佈開業，宣佈投入運營，為…揭幕
open.eg: The new hospital will be officially opened by the mayor on Tuesday.

open.chi_def: 提供；使有…；開放，取消限制
open.eg: This research opens (up) the possibility of being able to find a cure for the disease.

open.eng_def: If you open a computer document or program, you make it ready to read or use.
open.chi_def: 打開，啟動（電腦文檔或程式）
open.eg: To open a new document, click "File" and then click "New".

open.eng_def: somewhere outside, rather than in a building
open.eg: It's good to be (out) in the open after being cooped up in an office all day.

open.eng_def: to tell people information that was secret
open.chi_def: 公開（秘密）； 把…公之於眾
open.eg: It's time this issue was brought out into the open.

opera.eng_def: a musical play in which most of the words are sung, or plays and music of this type

operate.eng_def: to (cause to) work, be in action or have an effect
operate.chi_def: （使）工作，（使）運行；運作；操作；起作用
operate.eg: How do you operate the remote control unit?

operate.eng_def: to cut a body open for medical reasons in order to repair, remove, or replace an unhealthy or damaged part
operate.eg: If the growth gets any bigger they'll have to operate.

operation.eng_def: the fact of operating or being active
operation.eg: There are several reactors of the type in operation (= working) at the moment.

operation.eng_def: the way that parts of a machine or system work together, or the process of making parts of a machine or system work together
operation.chi_def: （機器或系統的）運作，運行；（對機器或系統的）操作，使用

operation.eg: Less profitable business operations will have difficulty in finding financial support.

operation.eng_def: an activity that is planned to achieve something
an occasion when a doctor cuts a body for medical reasons in order to repair, remove, or replace an unhealthy or damaged part
a mathematical process, such as addition, in which one set of numbers is produced from another

operational.chi_def: 工作上的；經營上的；運作上的；實施上的
operational.eg: There are operational advantages in putting sales and admin in the same building.

operational.eng_def: If a system is operational, it is working.
operational.chi_def: （系統）運作中的，工作中的，運行中的
operational.eg: Repairs have already begun and we expect the factory to be fully operational again with six months.

operator.eng_def: someone whose job is to use and control a machine or vehicle
a company that does a particular type of business
a person who helps to connect people on a phone system
someone who is skilled at dealing with people and getting what he or she wants from a situation
operator.chi_def: 圓滑的／精明的人等（尤指善於牟取私利的人）
operator.eg: He has shown himself to be a canny operator in wage negotiations.

opinion.eng_def: a thought or belief about something or someone
opinion.eg: What's your opinion about/on the matter?

opinion.eng_def: the thoughts or beliefs that a group of people have
opinion.eg: Eventually, the government will have to take notice of public opinion.

opinion.eng_def: a judgment about someone or something
opinion.eg: Her opinion of Adam changed after he was so helpful at the wedding.

opinion.eng_def: a judgment made by an expert
opinion.eg: My doctor has referred me to a specialist for a second opinion on the results of my blood test.

opponent.eng_def: a person who disagrees with something and speaks against it or tries to change it
a person who someone is competing against in a sports event
opponent.eg: In the second game, her opponent hurt her leg and had to retire.

opportunity.eng_def: an occasion or situation that makes it possible to do something that you want to do or have to do, or the possibility of doing something
opportunity.eg: Everyone will have an opportunity to comment.

opportunity.eng_def: the chance to get a job

oppose.eng_def: to disagree with something or someone, often by speaking or fighting against it, him, or her
oppose.eg: The proposed new testing system has been vigorously opposed by teachers.

opposite.chi_def: 全然不同的，迥異的，截然相反的
opposite.eg: You'd never know they're sisters - they're completely opposite to each other in every way.

opposite.eng_def: being in a position on the other side; facing
opposite.chi_def: 另一邊的，相反的，對面的
opposite.eg: My brother and I live on opposite sides of the city.

opposite.eng_def: facing the speaker or stated person or thing
opposite.chi_def: （在說話者、所指的人或物）對面的
opposite.eg: If you want to buy tickets, you need to go to the counter opposite.

opposite.eng_def: in a position facing someone or something but on the other side
opposite.eg: We're in the building opposite the government offices.

opposite.eng_def: to act a part in a film or play with someone as a partner
opposite.chi_def: （在電影或戲劇中）與（某人）聯袂演出，與（某人）合演
opposite.eg: Katharine Hepburn played opposite Henry Fonda in many films.

opposite.eng_def: something or someone that is completely different from another person or thing
opposite.chi_def: 對立的物（或人）；對立面；反面
opposite.eg: My father is a very calm person, but my mother is just the opposite.

opposite.eng_def: in a position facing someone or something but on the other side
opposite.eg: She asked the man sitting opposite whether he'd mind if she opened the window.

opposition.eg: There is a lot of opposition to the proposed changes.

opposition.eng_def: the team or person being played against in a sports competition
opposition.eg: The opposition has/have some good players so it should be a tough match.

opposition.eng_def: in some political systems, the elected politicians who belong to the largest party that does not form the government
